name: Messanges
description:
Parking lot next to the dunes. Endless beach!

It's FREE for a maximum of 48HRS. Car park is right on the entrancw to a magnificent beach which goes on and on!!! There's a restaurant at the top of the dunes.

name: Sinnemary Carbet
description: Run down old municipal campsite in country area beside river, and near to wetland hiking. Note- maybe this has been repaired? It‚Äôs not so bad.

name: Boat Ramp for boat to Kaw
description: Parking lot at the end of the road. Option to take boat to Kaw, or visit wetlands by boat (nobody is at the boat ramp, but people will come and go so you can ask them), also a hiking trail goes up the mountain via a path behind the cemetery.

name: plan  d'eau de Rochepaule
description:
- great boondock spot with no services.
- plenty of spaces, green areas.
- right along swimable river stream.
- shadow parking spot
- may be crowded on sunday during summertime

name: Boulogne Sur Mer
description: A working French farm. Very basic for 5 euros for a camping car and 2 euros for electricity. You can get fresh water and dump grey and black water as well.

name: Honfleur
description: This Aire is Honfleur. Parking costs 11 euros for 24hrs, payment by credit card. This is a very large and busy aire with water, waste and electricity within the price. It is a three minute walk to the bars and restaurants as well as the wonderful harbour. Splendid

name: Camping Des Iles
description: Small camping site literally bang next to the ocean. Utah beach is within close proximity. It costs 13 euros per night for a camping car. The price includes EHU, showers at a cost of 1 euro for 7 minutes. Fresh water and sanitation. Also there is internet if you need it.

name: Rue De La Fontaine Blanche
description: It's a French Aire. It's totally Free but very basic. There's fresh water available, and you can dump grey and black water. No thrills.

name: Camping De La Lande
description: We payed 27 euros for one night. A site situated in a superb location, especially if you love surfing. EHU, fresh water, you can dispose of grey and black water. There's toilets and showers and washing machines available as well. Fresh bread in the morning.

name: Jonzac
description: This is a really handy place to stop. There's a petrol garage, a Lidls and McDonald's for FREE WIFI üòÄ. There's also gas bottles on site at the garage as well. It also has a Flot bleu sanitation point to empty black water and rinse your cassette also has fresh water if you're running low for tea.

name: Camping Plague Sud
description: It's a little pricey but facilities are excellent especially if you're travelling with children in tow. Prices will depend on the time you visit. It has everything you need. Cest Bon !!! It's a surfers Mecca here so bring your boards dudes.

name: Chateau De Langeais
description: It's a free car park that belongs to the chateau where you can stay overnight. Chateau De Langeais is a 1 minute walk away. Cest Bon!

name: Camperspot Le Crotoy
description: Camperspot. ‚Ç¨5,- per night per spot

name: Camping Municipal
description: ‚Ç¨12,40 without power per night (2 persons and car)

name: Camperspot Juno Beach
description: Camperspot direct at the beach, no charge, no facilities.

name: Park Parking
description: Bushcamp at a parking near a park nearby La Lacelle. WC and water available, no charge

name: Camping Indigo
description: in Bois de Bologne. ‚Ç¨ 35,70 per night without power. Expensive but only camping nearby city center. Shuttle bus to the center stops in front of the camping. Price shuttle bus ‚Ç¨ 1,70 per person one way.

name: Route des Plages RD1 outside Remire-Montjoly
description: Nice and sandy beach with lots of trees. Quiet at night but busy on weekends.

name: VITRY AUX LOGES
description:
Motor home, black and gray water, free water parking on the canal All shops, 

Aire de camping-car, vidange eaux noires et grises, eau gratuit
parking au bord du canal 
Tous commerces,

name: VITRY AUX LOGES
description:
Motorhome, dump, water, overnight parking at the canal: free all shops 

Aire de camping-car, vidange, eau, parking de nuit au bord du canal:
gratuit
tous commerces

name: Les 3 Rivieres
description: Off season price for two people, two motorcycles and one tent is 12 Euros. Opens on 15 March. One of very few places that are open. Lots of hot water. Electrical hookups for motor homes. We charged things in the bathroom. There is a large washing dishes area and those sinks all have hot water. Nice location with walk into town of Creully. Lots of D-day places within easy drive. There is wifi but we didn't use it. It is by the admin building. And in season there is a restaurant with snacks.

name: Chambres D'Hotes La Guintre
description: 38 Euros for two people in a room with bathroom and simple breakfast. There is secure motorcycle parking in the barn. Parking for other vehicles out front. There is a kitchen for guests. Very friendly owners Sylvie and Damien. Some English spoken. Good price for the area. Rooms very clean.

name: Camping Saint-Martin De Re
description: Camping for tents and vehicles. Opens in mid-February. In off season we paid 17 euros for tent, two people and two motorcycles. Easy walk to St Martin.

name: cabane dans les arbres
description:
Possibility to sleep in a cabin or in a room 

possibilite de dormir en cabanne ou en chambbre

name: Camper Car
description: A big parking lot near the yard club for about 40/50 Camper or Van. It's easy to have a bike, when you want to go to down town. There's a market on Saterday morning

name: Camper Car
description: A big parking lot voor 40/50 Camper or Van. There's also another spot on the other side of the water. That's means a little bit more walking to downtown, the beach and the boulevard. ‚Ç¨ 12,00 per 24 hours with a max of 48 hours to stay

name: Camping
description:
Official Campground, with all the facilities. There's also a parking lot from Camper Car when you enter the small town. 
Price ‚Ç¨ 12,00 without electricity or ‚Ç¨ 15,00 with
Wifi is ‚Ç¨ 1,00 for one code (24 hours)

name: Lapalisse
description: Next to the river. In the middle of the city, but silent. Nice place.

name: Balazuc, Camping a la Ferme
description:
Very nice, wild campground in the forests directly beside the ardeche. At the end of the road (east), there is the farm of Jules Ranchin (?) where you have to register. In the forest, there is a llittle hut with water, toilet and showers. 
Theres no electricty, Wifi, or any "comfort", but one of the nicest places, i've ever visit!

name: Near "Gorges Du Verdon"
description: Really wild camping where you will need 4x4 to cross a river. Not far from the main road.

name: Le terrier
description: Was getting dark so stopped here. Basically the French version of a trailer park on the edge of town. Pleasant enough next to big river and a big field. Wifi 2euros only reaches bar. Meh.

name: Municipal camping
description: Crowded, very average place. There are at least 20 different campsites within 15min of here so I would shop around. This end of the lagoon seems to have more windsurfers whereas other end is better for kitesurfing. There is also nice 5 point cable park next to kiteschool about 8km south. Wild camping possible in front but not recommended for tent since very exposed and (hopefully) windy!

name: Farm Campground
description: Nice big grassy field / pasture with a couple small trees in valley just outside little town in Gorges De Verdune. (or whatever French grand canyon is called) Very quiet & peaceful countryside with horses and pretty view of valley. Very basic sanitary block but clean (squat toilet hot water shower not working - maybe need to ask to turn on) This spot is right at start/end of the Crete road loop with spectacular views from summit not to be missed if you're here. Loop is like 20km detour but so worth it.

name: Le Panoramic
description: didnt stay but pretty spot outside of town

name: Camping europe
description: shady, grassy spot 5 min walk to beach. horses, stream. quiet. clean facilities, free fast wifi by office. a little cramped but ok for a night. some mosquitos

name: By The River
description: Be careful not to get stuck in the mud, like we did

name: Pont Du Fosse
description: former municipal campsite in woodland with walks to village.  Now a free aire with services, bins, toilets.  Picnic/BBQ area, children's play area, lots of walks great for dogs.  Plenty of space park where you like.

name: ELNE Beach Parking for Camping Cars
description:
HEIGHT RESTRICTION 2m has been put in place! 14/09/18
Beside the official Car Parking there is a small signalized (max 48h) environment for Camping Cars weak frequented. The place is more wild than a Camperstay. Near the beach of the reserve natural. Right side is clothed, left side is nude beach.

name: Aire De camping car San Martin
description: Aire located within the walls of San Martin a beautiful little port town. Great location, mostly flat sites, and trees for shade. Very quiet at night. Highly recommended. 10 euro for 24 hours in the high season; 5 euro in the low season. Grey water and wc dump. Potable water 2 euro for 100 liters.

name: Monte Saint Michel Parking
description: The official parking lot for visiting Monte Saint Michel there is a special section for campers. Staying overnight is allowed but not with the "appearance" of camping. Free shuttles and bathrooms are located at the information center. 17.20 euros for 24 hours

name: Ferme De La Rouge Fosse Camper Parking
description: Very nice parking for campers on a private farm. Flat gravel sites with grass and vegetation separating each site on a lovely little farm. No bathrooms/showers; self contained rigs only. 5 euro for parking with electricity. 3 euro for potable water and to dump the wc. Very quiet and much nicer (and cheaper) than the overcrowded aire up the road. There is a great cider place a short walk up the road that is also recommend.

name: Aire Municipal Montville
description: Very nice aire in a cute little town. Located next to a nice little lake with walking paths. Some spots have a little incline but mostly flat. Very quite at night. Free to park and dump grey water and wc. Potable water requires a coin that is purchased from the stand on the lake that rents boats and costs 5 euro for 100 liters. Free wifi from the city available but not very good.

name: Close to Ballon d'Alsace
description: Very nice place, flat spot, space for about 5 Camper even big one. Quied @night. Restaurant about 5 minutes away slope down, fresh water and gray water for 1‚Ç¨. We enjoyed very much the short hike to the top of the hill with a nice view.

name: Area Camper Marseillan Plage
description:
Guarded parking space. Open all year round. No infrastructure. 
We had massiv problem finding a place to stay for the night in winter - therefore not a bad option.

name: Gorges du Verdon
description: Begining/end of one of the best drives in the French Alps.

name: Picnic Area At Valle Nans
description: Parking lot by the road(traffic dies at night), which includes a picnic area and acts as a trailhead for nearby mountains. No facilities and it is explicitly forbidden to light fire and pitch tents. No idea what is the attitude towards car camping, but we decided to give it a try and see.

name: Free Wifi
description: Free and fast wifi at Maison du Turisme. There seems to be a 2h limit per device.

name: Roadside Blues
description: Emergency docking site on a patch of dirt by the road leading to the ferry. No amenities and no traffic. Zillions of harmless flies.

name: Camping De I'hippodrome
description: It'a place 15km to nice Port and not so expensive i paid 14‚Ç¨/Night with motocicle and tent with small campcar two persons i paid about22‚Ç¨/Night

name: dune du pilat
description:
about 2kms south of la dune du pilat carpark, between 2 camp sites (before les flots bleu campsite) you climb up the dune. you can climb in the sand or there are stairs on your right when you are in front of the dune. 
you go down the dune at the level of the path between the 2 campsites and just next to the sea there are some nice bushes and a place for a tent !
nice spot to camp, maybe you can find some all along this little coast. 
just leave the place clean when you leave ! respect ! ;-)
about 2kms north there's a bar on the beach, expensive but they can give you water !

name: Camping Municipal Verdon Carajuan
description: Nice basic camp ground amongst pines trees. Showers and toilets are a bit grubby but there is plenty of hot water. Washing machin available. Wifi only around reception. SFR mobile signal low. Power available at some sites. ‚Ç¨10ish pn or ‚Ç¨13 with electricity.

name: Aire de Camping Car
description:
Just east of Saumur, in the village of Dampierre sur Loire on the D947 to Tours, there is a campsite for camper vans and cyclists.

‚Ç¨6 for camper vans. free for cyclists.

name: Camping De La Cite
description: 29.10 euros per night during high season. Parcel pricing. We are two people, two motorcycles and a tent but can have other configuration same price. Did not include electricity. Hot showers and slow wifi at reception. Odd bathrooms that are showers, toilets and sinks all in one building but each as own booth but all mixed gender. Laundry and dish sinks. Dishes sinks have hot water. Pool, bar and snack shop. Expensive. But only place walking distance into carcassonne old town. We did see a parking lot closer to old town along the creek where lots of camper cars were parked. No way for tents there. On OSM maps this is noted as municipal camping. .

name: Richelieu Camping
description: Nice quiet campsite situated in the town of Richelieu. Showers, electricity fresh bread in the morning. Open from June to late October. We paid 14 euros.

name: Ancient Bridge Rest Stop
description: Nice road side rest stop with trees and grass, plus a few benches. Road is quiet at night. Good for an overnight stop.

name: Forest Rest Stop
description: Nice spot on the edge of a forest and 100m from the main road and out of sight. Two picnic benches and a bin. Gravel parking a grass area for tent.

name: Saint Rome De Dolan Municipal Camping
description: Parcel pricing. 13.00 euros per night for 2 people, 2 motorcycles and a tent. With camping car it is 13.50. Electricity and pet are additional. Really nice place and quiet. Hot water in all sinks and showers. Laundry area including washing machine and dish area. and wifi at reception. Camping spaces are on grass and plenty of shade and trees and shrubs between parcels. Very relaxed atmosphere. In reception area is a common room open all night with books, tables and chairs, refrigerators and tv for use. Can get drinks and order bread for the morning.

name: Les Pins
description: Menu pricing. For two people, two motorcycles and a tent 13.50 euros. Person 5, motorcycle 1, tent 1.50. Hot water, nice bathrooms, very clean. Wifi but we didn't use it. Places for laundry and dishes. Refrigerator. Lots of shade. Very quiet and dark at night. Some picnic tables. There are some plug ins for electricity for vehicles.

name: Le Marintan
description: Parcel pricing. We paid 12.60 euros for a tent, two people and two motorcycles. They considered two motorcycles the same as one car. Fine place with shrubs and trees between spaces. Clean bathrooms, hot water, laundry and dish areas.

name: Field Camp
description: Quiet area amoungst fields and near the sea to pull up for the night. Large flat area either side of track junction. No swimming here as its mud flats.

name: Villers s/Meuse, Camping de l' Esperance
description: Nice, simple campground on the river bank of the Meuse. During high seasin we paid ‚Ç¨14 all-in. Wifi at reception. Small building with unisex showers and toilets.

name: Free parking St Nazaire
description: Free over night camping/parking in the center of St Nazaire. WWII subpens just over the road and free to visit. Tourist office and tickets for other atractions in the subpen. Supermarket a short walk away.

name: Aire de Loisirs du Val Jouin
description: Nice picnic spot next to lake. Picnic tables and benchs available. Flat but not level gravel parking area and grass areas to pitch tents. It is a junction for several walking paths in the area. So locals come and go. FSR mobile signal is low and only gprs data (slow)

name: Epernay, Camping Municipal
description: Camping 2km from centre of town. Nice cites with hedges.  Including electricity during high season 22 euro. Rental bicycles very expensive: 20 euro per day.

name: Camping A STELLA
description: Camping at the sea

name: Camping Le Moulin
description: A lovely little campsite with everything you need. Quite cheap and friendly owners. WiFi, showers, electricity, water, restaurant.

name: Guinguette de Renamon
description: nice, natural campground near the river.little, sandy beach with a beach bar.

name: Le Relais des Hautes C√¥tes
description: nice little campground with pool and a little pizzeria... but not a typical campground with the same equipment. shaded places for your tent/midsize-campervan, some woodhuts and tipis, bbq-place... on a little hill near dijon.

name: Blick Auf Calvi
description:
Directly at the sea 


Direkt am Meer

name: Hafen von Galeria
description:
Directly for bathing 

Direkt zum Baden

name: Cariu
description:
Nice place with beach access 3min! 

Netter Platz mit Strandzugang 3min!

name: S√ºdcorse
description:
4WD and lock and you will be spoiled with Panoramablick and it disturbed you here Ober garanties none.Wer still want to make party, under the beach there is a bar

description:
Really a dream beach

1 KM directly at the beach and many possibilities for Wildkamper 

1 KM direkt am Strand und viele M√∂glichkeiten f√ºr Wildkamper

Attention: Height Limit 2.10m

name: Rica Bella blick
description:
Nice place at the end of the land 

Sch√∂nes Pl√§tzchen am Ende der Landzunge

name: Cape corsika
description:
The top tip of Corsica, a lot of wildkamper a bar and a few fishermen's houses. The Wars!


Der oberste Zipfel von Korsika, mehere Wildkamper eine Bar und ein paar Fischerh√§usschen. Das Wars!

name: Sant' Amanza Beach
description: There are multiple turnouts and dirt parking areas along this road. We stayed in the area for 3 nights, and there were around 8-12 other vans camping along the stretch each night. We've heard that the police are a bit strict about camping here during the summer months, but no one hassled us now, in September. Beautiful view, quiet, and right on the water. 10 min drive from the downtown area of Bonifacio. 3G seems to work well here.

name: Wild Camping Near Collioure
description: Large pull out off a little used road in the hills overlooking the coastline. Fairly flat and with amazing views. Quiet at night. A great place to pass a night! No services.

name: Val d'Aleth
description: Campsite with very clean facilities in a charming medieval village.  Tents & overland vehicles welcomed, also offer B&B

name: Mauroux Aire
description: Free camping in small woodland area adjacent to small village, free water, emptying, EHU if required, sinks, bbq area, toilet, childrens play area.   Great for dogs open fields next door.  Parking under trees. Picnic benchs all around. Nice peaceful stop.

name: Les Bains Romains de Dorres
description:
Cost: Free
Water: Yes
WC: No

A largish motorhome rest stop.
5 mins walk from the Roman Baths of Dorres. ‚Ç¨5 entry and well worth it.
A quite spot on a bit of a slope, so chocks are needed, although we coped without.

name: baraque des bouvier
description: Along a dust road. Nice view.

name: GR43 Tour en Margeride
description: Under pine trees with large panorama. Table for picnic. Easy access by a very good dust road

name: Thi√©zac, Cascada de Faillitoux
description: It is a small car park on a bend in the road, where the path towards the waterfall begings. It is a dead end road so traffic is  non-existent, and the views over the valley are beautiful.

name: Edge of the field
description: Take the parkinglot at the d931, drive behind the bush, there is a farmers trail were you can stay the night with your rig or tent

name: Camping porte de Lyon
description:
All comfort 27.52 ‚Ç¨ with electricity vehicle 2 people bus to reach Lyon near shopping center shade in summer it is .WiFi at the reception possible connections Hotel IBIS from the camp

The entry street to the campsite is limited to 3,5t max

---

name: Back track to Jujols
description:
Very bumpy 4x4 track leads to this nice little flat spot to wild camp - spectacular views -stayed here twice and only 3 other vehicles passed by

ideal spot to stay if you hiking to the etangs near Nohedes

name: Chambonas
description:

name: Parking communal
description:
Big parking area in dolomite, opposite the monument to the dead, the town hall and the Romanesque church St Victor. Container area nearby, public toilet behind the town hall.

name: Le Nassier
description:
Parking overlooking the river Le Chassezac
ATTENTION: height limited by a portico. Maximum 2m

name: Parking communal
description:
A small parking area that can accommodate 3 to 5 vehicles or a dozen cars.Face in the communal cemetery and at the start of a hike on a marked botanical path. Departure of the rando to the right of the cemetery, to envisage good shoes, end of the Hiking in the village (300m from the car park)

name: Montchamp
description:
Communal area, open (grass cut) and flat, able to accommodate large vehicles.Restriction in periods of rains, the ground (grass) can be slippery.


Zone communale, d√©gag√©e (herbe coup√©e) et plane, pouvant accueillir de gros v√©hicules.
Restriction en p√©riodes de pluies, le sol (herbe) peut √™tre glissant.

name: Bord de riviere, "La Thinette"
description:
Zone en bord de route, permettant de passer une belle nuit au calme en surplombant la rivi√®re.
Ne pas s'aventurer plus loin et ne pas passer le pont avec un v√©hicule de grand gabarit, la route devient de plus en plus √©troite et il n'y a pas de zone de retournement plus en avant.

name: Font Romeu Parking
description: Free parking at Font-Romeu's entrance. Many campers right now. No infrastructure.

name: Foret De Perseigne
description: Free camping site for motorhomes with drinkable water and waste disposals (waste water and wc). All free. No wifi and no electricity. Picnic tables.

name: Metz Municipal Campsite
description: At the Moselle, close to the center, only 6 places in front of the campsite are free of charge, the rest cost ‚Ç¨4 per day. disposal.

name: Le Lac campsite
description: ‚Ç¨23 for two persons including car.  Overpriced with old facilities.  Stupid system with keys to access separate facilities that have limited hot water, zero soap or toilet paper.

name: Marie Rose camping
description: Nice small relaxed campsite run by very nice people.  Beautiful area.  I think charges are approx. ‚Ç¨25 for 2 persons and a car.  Free wifi at reception otherwise ‚Ç¨2.

name: Camping les Floralys
description: Nice family run place with clean facilities.  Near some beautiful villages.  Paid ‚Ç¨15 for 2 persons and car.  Free wifi near reception, laundry and washing up facilities.

name: Open toilet
description: Down by the river and marina, small toilet appears to be open.  600m from Aire de Services (free camping) for those without facilities.

name: Saint Seurin de Bourg- Aire de Services/Camping
description: Lovely spot below the city walls and next to the river.  Municipal camping is next door but closed when we were here in March.  There are toilets at the campground but open ones are 600m away to the east by the river.  Great spot!

name: Picnic zone
description:
Loop of the old road, with picnic table and panoramic view.

Boucle de l'ancienne route, avec table picnic et vue panoramique

name: Bord de route
description:
Wide zone got out of it from bend just after the bridge, in the right-hand side of the road and in gap of this one.
Parking lot, allowing easy technical stop or to spend one night (on the roadside üòï ) same for very big convey.

Zone large en sortie de virage juste apr√®s le pont, c√¥t√© droit de la route et en d√©calage de celle-ci.
Parking, permettant un stop voir une nuit (en bord de route) m√™me pour les tr√®s grand v√©hicules.

name: Col de l'Arenier
description:
Pleasant zone of picnic with tables and a panoramic view from the collar of "Arenier".

Zone de pic-nic avec tables . . .

name: Descente vers Aubenas
description:
Loop of the old road, in light sunken in the right side when coming from the collar.

Ancienne boucle de la route, en l√©ger contrebas √† droite venant du col.

name: Place de village
description:
Small place of village on the roadside, some businesses like bakery and pharmacy.
Easy access but presence of small trees between locations for cars.

name: Station Intermarch√©
description: Shopping district, big parking lots, any services and any businesses.

name: Chassagne Haut
description: Large park place on the roadside with tables of picnic and panoramic view on the valley of "Chassezac"

name: Aire de camping ski lake
description: Not entirely sure if this still exists but we camped by the ski lake.  Toilet close by.

name: Campion pere et fils
description: Agricultural shop and service centre - they sell heavy duty oils suitable for landcruisers (the oils in garages, mechanics and supermarkets are all light duty).  Also there are tools and equipment for sale here.

name: Toulouse Camping
description:
Sanitary. water heater. shade. large place washing machine. Open all year.
.....
sanitaires chauffes ombrages grande place machine √† laver

name: MTT Auto - 4x4 Specialist, Merdrignac
description: Very good mechanic - repacked the front wheel bearings on my Toyota Landcruiser.  Did a great job and charges are fair, not overpriced.  Also allowed me to watch and ask questions.

name: Grands Pres, Vendome
description: Good camping a short walk from centre of town and chateau.  Lovely village.

name: La Vitrine Du Marin
description:
In Bouzigues at the edge of the Thauvin pond, a family for 4 generations will allow you to taste fresh and inexpensive oysters. Very fresh oyster witz a good dry Wright wine

A Bouzigues au bord de l'√©tang de Thauvin une famille depuis 4 g√©n√©rations vous permettra de d√©guster des hu√Ætres fra√Æches et bon march√© . Very fresh oyster witz a good dry Wright wine

description:
A flat car park has 2 km2 of the port one has a view on the oyster parks, without any comfort if not the platitude of the ground

name: Monuments Al Pastor
description:
Ameyugo N1 Some places for camping car and. Tents in a camp-site dedicated to bungalows, very clean sanitary with hot water (very) near the N1 for two people electricity and vehicles 14 ‚Ç¨ 80 suitable for vehicles not too long

name: Camping Le Lac des Charmilles
description: A small camping that offers what ever you might need. There are sinks for both washing up and doing laundry. Washing machines are available if you rather spend cash, than muscular work. A bar with some simpler dishes to choose between is open until 23:00. There‚Äôs a pool free of charge. Showers offer boiling hot water to warm you up after a dip, or to just clean the dust from the road off your body. WiFi is available, also free of charge, but we didn‚Äôt use it. For prices summer 2018 look at the attached photo.

name: Mont-Saint-Michel
description:
Outclassing Versailles, the Eiffel Tower and just anything else in France. This place is beyond description. Access to the island is free of charge but you‚Äôll pay for the parking. The monastery and the church at the top do have a entry fee of 10‚Ç¨ (2018). Children free. It‚Äôs well worth the money! A really astonishing building. The four museums in the lower village are at the other hand, in our opinion, not worth the money. They are rather small and doesn‚Äôt show anything that can‚Äôt be seen elsewhere, except the Acheoscope; Sound and Light Show. But it‚Äôs all in French so maybe you should put your hard earned cash elsewhere.

Take care of where you park. The regular parking for cars shows signs of maximum 5 meters. Our HiLux is longer so we opted for the camping-car area which aloud up to 8 meters long vehicles. But there we had to pay for minimum a full 24 hours. About 17,50 ‚Ç¨ at 2018. Any regular ‚Äúsmall rig‚Äù can go for the regular car parking area.

According to description one of the major amusement parks in France. It‚Äôs not particularly ‚Äúfuture‚Äù in theme. The big attractions are mainly, as they call it, 4D. You watch a three dimensional movie and they add a feel of directional move, falling things on you or a blowing wind.

The area for the smaller ones are just as a good bet as the cinematic. Here it‚Äôs more about climbing, biking, going around in small cars and boats.

45‚Ç¨ for an adult summer 2018. We didn‚Äôt really felt that it was worth it.

If you still want to offer the park a visit, we recommend downloading the app which was rather helpful.

You might have to traverse over some one else pitch the get between your pitch and the car. (We currently use a ground tent.)

There is a pool which closes at... think it was 19:00. The whole campground feels and look rather ‚Äúused‚Äù. But it was all functional, except the light at the shower house.

Bloody expensive... 52,30‚Ç¨ for a small tent with two adults and a child without electricity. But I suppose it‚Äôs all the same considering the area.  Camp further away if you have the possibility.

name: Lake camp
description: Space for a couple. Right by the lake. Access is of the N19 onto a small road and then turn onto the gravel path. Nothing big unfortunately as the path is narrow. Has a bench and BBQ. Some road noice

name: beach car park
description: beach car park near the surf shack.  Plenty of space, few surfers pitched up with caravans so seems accepted that it's ok to spend the night. good access to beach.

name: road side sea overlook
description: Loads of spaces along the road with plenty of room for all types of rigs. don't use the dunes for tenting. dunes are protected areas!. Great surf beach, easy access. Maybe a mile or so stretch of spaces to choose from.

name: River La Somme
description: Nice little hard standing outside of village close to Amiens. Just some fishers and joggers in the morning

name: camping de la forƒõt
description:
Suitable for campers & motorcycle. large camp area with wifi, power plug, very clean toilet, tv room with fridge. you can also cook here. 
We paid ‚Ç¨12.40 for 2 pax, a tent & a motorcycle. we love this place! 

Friendly & helpful receptionist with very good english!

name: Camping et Guinguette les √îlivieres
description: Cheap and clean camping municipal. Listen to crickets at sunset.

name: Chateau Chambord parking
description:
Large parking for camper vehicles. Overnight staying is allowed. No facilities, except for a sanitary dump station. Official parking for the chateau, which is definitely worth a visit (take at least half a day for this). Quiet at night, large spaces. Rate is ‚Ç¨11 per vehicle per 24 hours for vehicles higher then about 2,1 m. ‚Ç¨4 or ‚Ç¨6 for smaller vehicles,depending on how close you park to the chateau. 
A few km north are several car parks in the surrounding park where you can leisure and go on walks in the beautiful park.

name: Camping Soissons
description:
Municipal campsite. Well organized and cheap. Nothing fancy, but decent enough for 1 or 2 nights. ‚Ç¨3.15 per person, same per car, same per tent, and same for electricity. ‚Ç¨1.10 per child, and same per dog. ‚Ç¨2.10 per motorcycle. All prices per night. ‚Ç¨0.22 taxes.

Pitches are quite large and flat. Some trees for shadow. About 40 pitches. Receptionist didn't speak English but was nice. Ablutions simple and moderately clean. Showers have fixed temperature, about lukewarm. 
No admittance after 10 pm, so arrive on time!
Not as noisy at night as you might expect.

name: wood overload station
description:
A quote campsite along a quite road. Ground is stable. 
Nice Place to spend the night while traveling through.

name: Queue de grand Etang
description:
A beautiful place at the side of a lake. You are allowed to park near the fence, which is right on the waterfront. 
There is a small shop with local products and a restaurant that sometimes opens for lunch. Very friendly people.
The lake is a nature reservation and you are not allowed to swim. Fishing is allowed.

name: Botanical Garden Parking with Lookout
description: Small parking lot of the Jardin Botanique Saint Jean de Luz. About 9 spots to park, but only the lower ones are flat since it's a dead end leading up to a lookout over the coast. Busy in the morning for local runners etc. Camping seems to be tolerated (at least in low season). No big camper vans allowed.

name: waterbuffer
description:
A quiet place on the end of a stable dirt road. There is space enough for a normal rig. To get there you need to take the gravel road (before or after 1km of theater) that goes into the forrest. At the end of the road there is a large horizontal spot to park.
Very quiet, only a few runners go by.

name: City campground
description: public campground, public toilets, free.

name: Lake view with facilities
description:
Beautiful spot at the lake. Quite, peaceful. 
Apparently great spot for fishing.

There are public facilities (toilet and water)

There is water, we don‚Äôt know whether it‚Äôs drinking water.

name: Parking des Cul√©es - Challes-les-Eaux
description:
Big free parking lot near the campground. Quiet at night. Near a small lake with a view on the montains
Dumping station at the campground

name: beautiful view campspot
description: wild spot right at the end of a little road. There is a beautiful wide view. some tourists the day, very quiet at night

name: wineyard property
description:
Good place near Bordeaux for a night or
 2. Big parking lot of a wine property.
You have to buy a bottle of wine or pay 5eur for the night.
Drinking water available.

name: Campersite near a lake

name: Camping de la Chevrette

name: Along the river Allier at Billy

name: Camping Domaine d'Aucroix
description:

2,20‚Ç¨ for shower.
Can come in any time and pay at office hours!

name: Albi

3 km Gravel road Jabron River side no service

a car Park with to much campers, no service

name: Soleils

Fontaine √©quip√©e d'un robinet

fontaine, lavoir,toilettes

au bord d'un petit lac accessible par une piste pour tous v√©hicules pas de service

name: Quiet back roads in Cassis

Avoid mid day in high season, the level of traffic and tourists is unreal!! Pretty tight roads all around so maybe not so suitable for motor homes, campers and vans will be all good üëåüèº

name: Camping Des Lapins
description: A small campsite with basic amenities. Mostly permanent campers but a few spots open for tents. The owners are a fantastic older couple who live at the house and farm just past the campsite. ‚Ç¨10 for a Jeep tent and 2 people.

name: Lions Georges -  Verdun Moustiers
description: Well off the beaten path, right at the base of the mountains. Quiet and pretty with a lot of large pitches. Stone teepees for tents. Had a spectacular sunset. Only ‚Ç¨4/per person and per car. Dogs are free. A lot of the roads in are dirt/gravel or mountain roads. Might be difficult to get to in a big rig or pulling a camper.

name: Camping Le Dramont
description: Large very commercial campsite right on the water. A few spaces are close to the water. Most are interior. Has all the amenities and a lot of huts or cabins for rent. Could use a few more sets of sanitary areas.

name: Aire in small town
description: 4 places designated for camper vans in a small town next to a leisure center with a small playground. Worth noting that while there are 3 bakeries in the town there‚Äôs no groceries walk-able not even wine! There is a Hyper U a few minutes drive outside the other end of town.

name: LPG and aire
description: Auto gas/LPG available at gas station with extra large parking lot. Picnic tables and small playground as well.

name: Rocky creek in Savoie
description: There is a rocky creek, mostly shallow but with some places deep enough to swim. There's a path from the road, a camper van parked part way but if you're walking a bicycle you can easily get down right next to the creek. Traffic from the road is heard. Seemingly a place where locals have bonfires occasionally.

name: DFDS Ferry Dunkirk-Dover
description: We hitchhiked from here to Dover. Its pretty easy because the consumers payed for the vehicle, it doesn't matter how many people are in the car. If you have an EU Passport it will be really easy. Just make shure you catch your lift before it will check in (of course) so the employees can check your identity. The ship needs at last about 2 hours to get to Dover. I think there is a ferry starting nearly every hour.

name: Brilliant little hideaway
description: Small dead end road looking across to the European Parliament. 100 meters to tram stop directly into town. 5 minutes wall to the Park de l‚ÄôOrangerie which has several playgrounds and a small ‚Äúzoo‚Äù and public toilets. It‚Äôs an unpaved dead end road with parking along the sides, don‚Äôt bother coming between 8:45 and 4 as all spots will be taken by people using the tram. We‚Äôre a bit over 6 meters and I defiantly wouldn‚Äôt bring anything bigger as the turning would be tight. But overall a brilliant find.

name: Paid for camper van spot

the Campground is in ok condition, the facilities were clean. We paid 16‚Ç¨ for 2 persons and 1 car but behind the offical campsites. Prices vary from 15 - 40‚Ç¨.
To get here, navigate to 42.6648, 9.210828. fourwheel drive is an advantage.

Camping car at the farm, Mas du Roc

name: Les roches l'√©v√™que

Another car park is avalible before height restrictions however. Car park next to a river of clear glacial melt water. Large pond and beautiful trail heads a 5min walk away. 
   Bins & recycling points avalible so please use them!
