name: Aire de pique-nique
description: Near the canal and the river you have 10 places and very quiet

name: Camping Maisonneuve
description: Probably one of the most beautiful camp sites in France! The owners are from GB and do their best for the guests. Small and well kept camp site, very green and with lots of trees. Nice facilities (with toilet paper!), bar and restaurant in an old french building. We paid 15 ‚Ç¨ for two persons with a tent and bicycles. Highly recommended!

name: Camping Municipale Le Veurdre
description: Very small and basic (~ 20 parcels) camp site, but cheap! We paid 6.40‚Ç¨ for two persons in a tent with bicycles for one night (no cash, only card!). Staff is very friendly and facilities are clean. There is also a place with a table under a roof where you can stay during rain (nice for cyclists!), you could even pitch your tent there if the rain is too heavy. There is a small shop and a bakery in the town (closed on mondays) and also a restaurant (open every day).

name: Camping Du Lac
description: Small camp site at a lake, right at eurovelo 6. Thus, they have special places for cyclists with a table and two chairs. Price for two people in a tent is 15 ‚Ç¨. Use of the washing machine is free! There is a little bar, a pool and in the facility building you can find everything you need, including a fridge!

name: Inoudouer
description: small place on the Landscape. 0nly 0ne v√©hicule. quiet

name: sourdeval region
description: the small place only for 4x4 and low traction . Good  for 1 night in landscape

name: At river Doubs (near Besancon)
description: Nice and quiet place right at the Doubs. Leave N83 to the right in Larnod, then follow the signs to 'Moulinot'. At the river there is a small parking. At night you only hear frogs and owls.

name: Le Camp Bernard
description: Also a good place for a night. Large flat place in the Forest. We had a very quiet night.

name: Rivercamp Le Meuse
description: Nice place at the River La Meuse. Small place for one car and well hidden from the road. Of course fishermen around. We had a quiet night.

name: Big gravel place
description: Nice place to spend a night. Lots of place and quiet also well hidden.

name: Fort de Liouville
description: Official Campplace at the parking for the Fort. Green meadow, beautiful surrounding, no facilities, very remote, don't think that there are a lot of visitors coming...

name: Camping municipal de Charmes sur Rh√¥ne
description:
Pleasant little camping. Quiet at nigth.
Washing machine free. Restaurant good and cheap. Very friendly

name: Millau
description: Absolutely beautiful spot. Lots of parking in the open or under shade trees. Although no WiFi there are two cell towers so if you have your own WiFi , no problem. Overlooking the town of Millau, home of the highest bridge in the world. Lots of walking and hiking trails.  No amenities other than toilets. If interested in Parapente AirZone, they run tandem rides. Check prices with owner, Antoine. As far as big rigs go to get to the top, I feel 3.5 ton is comfortable. Larger than that and there will be problems with a couple of narrow places and 5 or 6 hairpin turns. All in all an excellent place for a few days!

name: Free parking Carcassonne
description: Free parking slots with a nice view of the Castle. Did not stay over night, but would be good to spend a night. 15 to 20 min. by foot to the Castle. Not suitable for big rigs or motorhomes. The slots are to small. Unless you can find a free space on the opposite side of the road.

name: Gorges de Galamus
description: Parking space at the south entrance of the gorge. Fantastic views all around. Normal tourist traffic during daytime, but at night absolutely allon. There is a small shop/cafe with toilets that closes at around 18:00. Parking space can only be reached from the south for cars higher than 2,70m. Not suitable for caravans.

name: Saint-Nazaire en Royans
description: Camping Municipal. Easy access, at the river La Bourne, quiet, beautiful sight-seeing, restaurants and stores less than 1 km.

name: Camping Gites de Prieur√©
description:
Nice remote campground. Nice spots to pitch the tent or park your mobile home/van/car.

Lots of trees and very shady.

They also have gites (cabins). These are available all year, camping from may till september.

Cost: ‚Ç¨11,30 for 1p, tent & motorbike.

name: Wild Camping at a lake Verdon
description: We stay here with a nice view to the lake at the end of Verdon lake. space for many cars. and some other campers. noisy in the daytime and some cars stopping in the night. but just 200 meters to walk and there is the entrance of verdon canyon. beautiful view.

name: Camping Blue Valle
description: You can stay here in the parking area of the campground for free. Max. 36 h. Very quiet.

name: Camping La Foret
description: Camping La Foret is a wonderful nice and quiet campsite for nature fans and friendly families. The great diversity of plants and trees attracts many bird species and butterflies. The campsite is run by friendly people and has a sanitation block, swimming pool, terrace and hiking and nature trails. A natural river is on walking distance, providing an extra refreshing getaway.

name: Wildcamp next to the Canal du Midi
description: Lovely little wildcamp that would be especially good for cycle tourists along the Canal du Midi not far from Portinages. The ground is flat and has good shade from the pine trees. It‚Äôs just past the campground (Camping Mimosa) so you might get some campground noise but otherwise it was very quiet. There‚Äôs a little concrete pad that‚Äôs good for cooking as well. You‚Äôre tucked back and away from the canal so it‚Äôs private too. We spent one night here in a tent with our bicycles and were not disturbed. No facilities or water so fill up before you arrive.

name: From du moulin soulon
description: Nice little campsite, good views! Plenty of space and great facilities! Not expensive ‚Ç¨23 for 3 people, 2 cars and 3 tents for 1 night

name: Hautacam
description: Large parking in front of the tramassel refuge. Slightly sloping. 360 degree spectacular view. No service. --- Grand parking devant le refuge de tramassel. L√©g√®rement en pente. Vue spectaculaire 360 degr√©s. Aucun service.

name: nieuil l'espoir
description: good place in the village to Park your camper and pass a good and quiet night. next to the shop : pan, ...

name: Bergues
description: 50 sites close the city and a lot of very good restaurants.

name: Parking Lot  Rue Clovis
description: Parking lot near the center. Costs are low, 24h costs 4‚Ç¨. Free on Sunday and between 7pm and 9am, 12noon and 2pm. Only for shorter RVs, only 6m

name: Camping in the Forest
description:
This is an area we just passed and there are so many little streets in the forest and spots where u can free-camp!  
No toilets no running water or showers just a free space! 
Please don‚Äôt litter or light fires !!!!

name: Water tap and picnic area
description: There is a little fishing dam right in Eurovelo 8 with picnic tables and a water tap. Lots of shade.

name: Camping de Paris
description:
Great camping ground. Everything available. Restaurant, small market, shuttle to a metro station.

Fee is 66 euros, for 2 adults, 2 kids and a vehicle, with electricity and booking fees, since I did on-line reservations, which are highly recommended. Not cheap, but it‚Äôs inside Paris, for a very good price.

name: Wild Camp at Fishing Dam
description: A lovely spot to spend the night next to a little fishing fam right off the Eurovelo 8. You can even swim if you don‚Äôt the fish. Two picnic tables, a water tap and garbage cans. Quiet and lovely views. There is a side road that camper vans could park on. 2km from a Super U with toilets and bakery. We spent the night with our tent and bicycles and while some kids came down to the picnic tables for a bit at around 11 PM no one disturbed us.

name: Campervans at Beach Anglet
description:
This is a motorhome parking space.
It was 6 Euro when we were there . 
The atmosphere is not so nice, near the beach a cafe and toilets and showers.

name: River spot
description:
A nice spot nearby the mainroad. You can here it in the background but it doesnt disturb. The spot is directly at the water and you can watch the sunset while eating dinner over the fields. 
There are several spots at the road you can choose to camp. 
The river is not for swimming.

name: Camping Du Perroquet
description:
A busy campsite on the France / Belgium border. Professionally run. A mix of camping, caravans, motorhomes and static vans. Excellent clean facilities. 1euro per shower. Motorcycles are not allowed to travel around the site but there is a covered store at the entrance. 
Decent prices. 12.80 euros for two bikes and a tent on our own pitch. 
The site is huge at 1.6km front to back and has various food stores such as chips and pizza and a restaurant.

name: Spot at the river doubs
description: Nice hidden spot at the river. Beautiful water to swim. Ca 1km to the next village.

name: Frau sans
description: Nice place in the edge of the river close to the village

name: Small Car park next to Route de Saint-Barthelemy
description: Cool little spot to camp overlooking the Mediterranean Sea! Few other campers here but nice and quiet! Little traffic in the day and barely any at night. Beautiful spot must see

name: Bordeaux lac
description:
Small parking but manageable for big RV (more than 30Ft + no high limit), just at the front of the lac and with direct tramway to Bordeaux center (count 15 min to get to the center by tram). 

Nice view on the lake, no forbidden sign for RV parking at night, police saw us and didn‚Äôt say anything. 

We left our truck during the day and sleep there, a few people having drinks at night but nothing annoying. 

Overall very good option to visit Bordeaux and enjoy the lac & the very nice view ! You can reach hotel wifi from there, but also enjoy diner nearby, couple options if needed.

name: √âtang de l‚Äôarchev√™que
description: √Ä small (2 campervan) place next to a beautiful natural water plan (for fisherman).Very quiet and beautiful. To come here you have to take a small road on the right on N10.

name: Chez Bartho
description: A nice camping ground placed on terrace fields around an old farm under the city castle and a few minutes from city center , a lot of shade, running water, at the river side, where is possible to swim, good clean sanitaries with hot/warm water, around are a few possible walks.

name: Ourdegon
description: You leave the road when coming from the Col de Tourmalet to Tournaboup and take a gravel road to the right. 4x4 is handy, but not necessary. High clearance is recommended. After a 15 minutes drive you find a great spot looking over the valley in one of the needle curves. It‚Äòs very quiet here. Take everything with you you need.

name: South West of Blois along the Loire river left side
description: Fishing path along the Loire river left side. You reach it easily with small car or 4x4. Not accessible for campers.

name: Carpark in mountains
description: Carpark for restaurant/hotel and hikes. Scenic and quiet at night, during the day you will find hikers etc. Toilets in the restaurant building on entrance level. Flat grass along hiking trails for tents.

name: ponte Castirla
description: Wild camping at the riverside at the beginning of canyon Petra - Leccia

name: Belonga Mick
description: Reformed farmhouse and buildings set in stunning French Countryside run by an English couple, great food great hosts

name: Dieppe port
description: This is a Big parking for 50 cars. 12.50‚Ç¨ per24/h

name: Free lake parking
description: Approx 20 car spots for the lake. During the day you will find locals exercising in and around the lake and having a BBQ. During the night is quiet. There is flat grass for tents. There is a bakery and cheese shop 5min away, but otherwise no facilities.

name: Aire de Vivier
description: Camp area for motorhomes under trees, 5 min walk to the beach, nice spot, may be crowded in high season, lots of surfers around. 17‚Ç¨/day, night, next day (you have to leave before 8 pm). Less in mid or low season.

name: Mont Saint-Michel View
description: Quiet spot near a cornfield. nice view of the Mont Saint-Michel in the distance.

name: Camping Keronnes
description: Small, quiet, rural campsite run by an English couple.  We were offered a cup of tea when we arrived.  Immaculate facilities.  Small splash pool.  Motorbikes welcome.  We paid 6 euros per person with no electric.

name: Manet le pont
description: Nice place next to river. Near established camper site. By kajak rent

name: Combeluffe
description:
Wood cutters cabin, small bed for one/couple, wood burning stove inside, BBQ area outside, + place to pitch a tent. Tap and spring water, compost toilet, Bike parking and garage facilities.
Contact host directly (+33) 06 42 17 67 45 (english speaking)

name: Camping Urlo Gaina Epherra
description: Small simple and tranquil camp site. Terraced lots overlook the Basque countryside. A small sanitary building with showers outside, washing machine and fridge provide basic necessities. Despite peak season there was plenty of space for us to setup for two nights. We payed 20 EUR per night.

name: Versailles
description: the site is near the Palace of Versailles, it is advisable to spend one or two nights but with dissimulation and calm people, there is little movement of people and easy access.

name: Epernon for rest
description: to rest like a camping, just for a night

name: Lonely place
description: The way up is little bit hard. A lot of stones and bushes where nearly close the path. your car gona have scratches from the bushes how want close the path. Really quiet and rocks for climbing! Also nice view down to the lake.

name: Chill @ Lake
description: Awesome Spot to hang out during the Day! Camping and do fire is forbidden and after 15. June the Road is close. But for hang out and go swim, it is perfect!!

name: Oceanview
description: Very quiet place in the hills near Frontignan. You have an awesome view of the ocean.

name: Thilay Les Six Shenons
description: A stonecircle called Les Six Shenons. The restaurant (open in weekends) owner at the foot of the hill allows overnight camping within the circle for a night.

name: Parking Lac de Camiel
description:
Nice large parking area next to and with view on the lake. Busy during the day quiet in the night.
Waterski, playground, sport facilities and swimming area near by.   
Parking area gravel and grasy.

name: Camping Les Rivages
description:
Nice campsite. Big grassy area.
400m to the beach. 18‚Ç¨ for 2 Pers+Big rig.

name: Camping des Rochers des Parcs
description:
Campsite direct at the river. 
Free Wifi - Nice Cafe - friendly staff.
Perfect entry for the "Rochers de la Houle" hike.
22‚Ç¨ for 2 Pers/night without electricity.

name: Camper place direct at the Orne
description:
Private place for big rigs direct at the river Orne in Pont d Ouilly.
Very calm and beautifull surrounding. 400m to the village. 60 places for big rigs separated by bushes. During the day many canoes passing by. Canoe station nearby in the village. Even in the high season only a few rigs during the night.
10‚Ç¨ / night including electricity and water.
16‚Ç¨ / 2 nights.

name: Camping Putanges-Pont-Ecrepin
description:
Really nice campsite direct at the Orne.
Ca. 30 grassy pitches with electricity. We went canoeing direct from the campsite to the lac de Rabodanges by our own canoe and did a bike trip to the lake with the "Gorges de St-Aubert" hike and back by bike. Fabulous. 
HOT showers and toilets are at the campsite. Once a day a lady coming round for the payment.
9,50‚Ç¨ + 3‚Ç¨ electricity/night for 2 persons and a big rig.

name: Next to quarry pond
description: Nice place between an dirt road, quarry Pond and a hedge. Road Just used from a few people at all (Bike, Farmer). Had a Nice, undisturbed sleep Here. you can hear the Main Road a bit, but didnt disturbed us at all. we swum in the lake, Quite Nice temperatures atm. says danger of drawning on a sign, because the shore falls quickly Off. but If you are used to swimming, No problems at all. slept by tent and motorbike, was a good place. however 1 or 2 rigs would fit aswell

name: Parking for a night near Nimes
description: big parking area near a sport formation akademy. Wood is nearby for walk and relax. very silent at night. For free, no regulations.

name: Condeau informal camping
description: Quiet area near to the Condeau (a litle town) for informal camping with table next to the creek

name: Dune Du Pilat
description: Great spot, plenty of space to park up and stay. Toilet and running water. Not sure if it‚Äôs drinkable or not, I‚Äôd advise boiling it. It says ¬£25 if your van is taller than 2m but see how you go. No ones checking or making anyone pay, is done by a self service machine. The beach is within meters of us. There a couple of bars/cafe close by.

name: Camping Geteu - Laruns en Vall√©e D‚ÄôOssau
description: Great! Cheap ¬£16 with electric hook up for 2 people and a camper. Hot showers, good toilets and bathrooms. Highly recommend. Very quiet and cheapest place in town. Little bit run down but that doesn‚Äôt mater. 1km walk to town. Beautiful

name: Camping de l'Oiselon
description: nice, big, green and quite place with access to the river. there is small bar with pizza and some snacks. open until 22:00. you can purchase beer. clean toilets and good showers. laundry service available (in the morning), no dryer. for bike, tent and one person I paid around 10‚Ç¨

name: Etang du grand Saint Maurice
description: Couple of Spots at the lake and forest! Hit the road from south-east near Saint Germain! The other path from west are really bumpy and muddy!

name: Quiet beach car park underneath the pine trees
description: Great quiet spot, shower and toilets on the beach 10-100m away depending where you park. 2m hight barrier unfortunately but great if you can fit under. Awesome spot for swimming private spot if you walk directly down the hill of the top car park and when you get to the bottom go onto the rocks and go right and climb down the rocks to a private spot. We were undisturbed all day and went swimming 5 plus times and our gear was safe.

name: Trelevern quiet parking lot with kids games
description: In the middle of town but secluded as there is a small one way street going to this lot surrounded by back gardens so no one sees you from here and there is no traffic at all neither height limits so rigs of any size can make it.

name: Close to the river, under trees
description: Nice place, really quiet. Close to the river Garonne, a village close by.  Good place , quiet excepted few the traffic on the bridge but not too late .

name: Crouseilles aire de camping
description:
New site for one camping car.
Inauguration August 2019.

name: Biscarrosse Camper Campground and Parking lot
description: This is a parking lot under pine trees. One toilet and drinking water. Cars under 2m height are free. Camper over 2m have to get a ticket at the entrance. Parking allowed 3 days only. 17 EUR/day in high season and very crowdy. Direct access to beach walking distance 15 min.

name: Wild camp in the middle of the mountain
description: Beautiful wild camp spot in the middle of the mountains. Spectacular views. Few others campers around in high season. Highly recommended. Not far from Pic du Midi walk and other trails

name: Chateau de Bertangles Camping
description:
*Closed in low season.
....Great quiet and sheltered site in small village next to Chateau with up to 30 pitches each separated by hedges. ‚Ç¨55 for 2 nights for 2 adults and 2 kids.  Facilities good and clean, availability good if arriving before 5pm, seems to fill up fast later with people using it as an overnight stop...

name: La Citadel Loches
description: Great site in Loches! Expensive (Eu 42 for 2 adults, 2 kids and 2 tents) but great facilities, 2 pools slides, games room, restaurant and more.  5 min walk into the town, markets on Wednesday and Saturday are very good!

name: Pine forest next to the ocean
description: Great spot! Lots of shade and the beach super close by. Not sure if it‚Äôs officially allowed, but this time of year there‚Äôs a dozen campers overnighting and that seems to be alright. There‚Äôs some cool camping spots in the forest, but you can also camp next to the road. Quiet at night. Love this place!

name: Pond
description: Small pond, direct access on a gravel road. 'Scratch-free' to reach.

name: Aire Naturelle Phailac
description: Lovely little campsie with basic facilities and nice staff next to beautiful little French town.

name: Canal dear Morge
description: Nice spot next to River, little bit of noise due to Weir. Plenty of space.

name: chartreuse du reposoir
description: very quite place. ok for several tent. You have to ask to the reception before , and it closes at 18h30.

name: La Tete
description:
Viewpoint of the world at day. But quiet at night. magnificent panorama on Mont Blanc. 2 benches.
----
Table d orientation avec du monde en journee. Mais tranquille la nuit. magnifique panorama sur le Mont Blanc. 2 bancs.

name: Mimizan
description:
Beautiful parking lot right next to the beach.
Watched the sunset out of my van. Pretty crowded but peacefull.
Only vans up to 180cm!

name: Hotel Bellevue
description: Nice family run hotel with beautiful Mountain View. 70 euros for a room.

name: Sarrancolin
description:
Camping d‚ÄôEsplantats - small 2 star campground with shady spots

Very good and reasonably priced restaurant nearby (with Belgian beers): ‚ÄúCafe Restaurant de France‚Äù

name: Riverside
description: For the 4x4, for the mini camping car and motorbike. Next to the river.

name: Camping Municipal ‚ÄûL‚ÄòOlympique‚Äú
description: Nice Camping Spot. 17,20‚Ç¨ for a van and two persons. Everyone gets his own quarter covered with a little bit of bushes. Short walk to the sea. Check in starting at 12:00

name: Le Parc de la Bastide
description: Nice camp. good price. high season 32‚Ç¨ for 3 persons. You can walk to the Old town.

name: Chambre d'h√¥tes & petit camping Fantesstique
description: This petit camping is attached to a Chambre d'h√¥tes and therefor not very popular for campers yet. It's a hidden gem in the quiet countryside. First week of August: we were the only visitors! Imagine: looking out over fields with horses and sheep, waking up under a apple tree. And: very clean Rain showers and electricity!

name: Camping Le Massiol
description: We have spent two days with an overwhelming view upon the Mountains and Forrest accorded with the sound of sheep, chicken and cicadas.

name: Wild Camping
description: Nice spot with view of the lake far from busy beaches. Lots of hikes around and its between lavender fields. About 20 min hike to nice quiet beach although walk is bit rocky so good shoes recommended. Highly recommended.

name: Above Calacuccia
description: Follow the gravel track - plenty of spaces to wild camp. Great views but can be windy. Watch out for the pigs.

name: Camping Les Philippons
description: Nice campsite with all facilities. WiFi available but extra. Quite expensive in high season 30 euro. Half an hour drive from local beach. There is a tiny town up the hill where you have nice local French Restaurant overlooking the mountains.

name: Monthermee
description: Camperplace for a nice price of ‚Ç¨5,00 in the french ardennen

name: Monaco Panoramic View
description: It's a beautiful wildcamp spot with a fantastic view of Monaco and Niece. There are another wild spots a few meters up right on top of the hill where you can park and stay over, but it's quite busy as it's a tourist attraction. This place is a bit more quiet suitable for bigger cars and have some benches. There is a beautiful old town not far called Turbie. Also highly recommended to see.

name: Camping du Planet
description: Camping le Planet is a small and friendly campsite. Clean and well organised, spaces are generous for all sizes of camper cars. Very economical. Open or shaded spots available.

name: St√§dtischer Wohnmobilstellplatz in Beaune
description:
It is a parking space near the center of the city, which is well frequented by motorhomes. For some money you can empty your toilet here. There are no other offers.


Es ist ein Stellplatz N√§he dem Zentrum der Stadt, der von Wohnmobilen gut frequentiert ist. Gegen etwas Geld kann man hier seine Toilette entleeren. Weitere Angebote gibt es nicht.

name: Aire de stationnement camping
description:
New site for campers near the ocean. Short walk to the beach and the village of Sangette. Next to a road but very quiet at night.

Some gravel-grassy area for tents also available. height restrictions in place !!! cars only.

name: Near Penly Centre de nucleaire
description: Calm & quiet spot at the end of a small road. Wide views over the sea and Penly Centre nucleaire de production d'electricit√©. Stairs to walk to the rocky beach. Would not recommend swimming though.

name: Wild camp Bolqu√®re
description:
Not so far from the road, little place to put your car or your tent on a nice place for a "fast camping". 
We can see the emplacement from the road but I've passed two nights here with my moto and no problem.

name: Beaujeu
description:
Quiet place by the river, from the D900 over a small bridge and right down

ruhiger Platz am Fluss, von der D900 √ºber eine kleine Br√ºcke und gleich rechts runter

name: Col du Lautaret
description: Beautiful place near restaurant, with mountains views.

name: Chateau-Arnoux
description: Water + sanitation dump station, in a beautiful village with all the shops around. Possibility of sleeping in the square, with you RV. No electricity

name: Camping La Riviere
description: Great little campsite with good access to decent hiking and MTB trails. Also had access to the river with lovely wild swimming. Decent value at 10euro per person (high season).

name: Eucalyptus Camping
description: Great camping 100m from the beach. Not too crowded but you won‚Äôt feel alone for sure either. Basic facilities. Not even toilet paper or soap is provided. Washing machine, shower, bbq, and you can wash dishes. No restaurant or proper kitchen.

name: Aire camping car de l'√©tang
description: Free camper parking lot. Can be found on Google Maps.

name: Montherme
description: Camper Parking lot right next to the river.

name: Le Port-Diseur
description: Two-star campsite. Right next to the river. Supermarket and Gas station close by. ‚Ç¨13 for 2 adults and a campervan, no electricity.

name: BnB in renovated 250 old farmhouse
description: Beautiful bed and breakfast in a 250 year old former farmhouse. The Maison Catalina at Mas Cambounet has five rooms, all with privat bathroom, most of them newly renovated. A huge garden with large swimming pool, sitting areas, free bicycles, petanque ground, off season BBQ, view over the vineyards and olive groves. Run by two long time world travellers, french, english, german and spanish speaking. Breakfast buffet, wifi and parking even for very big rigs. Many sights nearby., ideal for biking, hiking, canoeing. No pets, no sleeping in your camper possible. Check their website www.MaisonCatalina.fr.

name: Cirque de Navacelles
description:
nice place at the Vis, very quiet, at the bridge the gravel road there are several possibilities

sch√∂ner Platz an der Vis, sehr ruhig, an der Br√ºcke die Schotterstra√üe fahren dort sind mehrere M√∂glichkeiten

name: Camping Municipal
description: Municipal campsite. ‚Ç¨11 one night, one person, tent and car. Clean facilities. Town not a very friendly place but campsite good

name: Camping la Demi-Lune
description: Small but perfectly formed. Really nice place with a relaxed atmosphere and not expensive. ‚Ç¨9 for one person, car and tent for one night. Very clean facilities, everything works. It is near a busy road and you can hear the traffic but that's the only negative I can see.

name: Au Chant des Oiseaux, Campground
description: This campground is an awesome place. It is really big. So there is almost no neighbors aside you. We had a gorgeous place with direct view to the sea. The facilities are very clean and almost new. From some places you have to walk a little and as this campground is in the cliffs, it goes up and down. Our two dogs enjoyed it as well. Every morning there is fresh baguettes at the restaurant. It is family owned and very friendly. We searched only for one night but stayed a second one. Strongly recommending this place.

name: Campsite
description: I can honestly say it‚Äôs the best campsite i‚Äôve ever found. Among the trees, on a little hill with views but still hidden. Amazing

name: Aire des Amarons
description: Rest area next to the highway. Toilets, water and picknick tables. Nice spot. Overnite possible (and as to my knowledge permitted).

name: Watertap at casino carpark
description: There is a watertap at the carpark of the casino supermarket. At the side to the street.

name: Camping Osenbach
description: A very nice and big camping with a lot of trees and shady places. Very recommended. Sometimes you can have a meal for 10‚Ç¨.

name: Quiet place next to the lake
description:
It's a nice and quiet spot in a dead end street right next to the lake. Locals said that it is commonly used by campers.
Not suited for bigger vehicles.
No water or toilets available but there are trash containers.

There is sign right next to the spot saying swimming isn't allowed. (Not sure if this counts for the whole lake)

name: Camping-Car Park
description:
Nice and quiet Campground under big trees
11‚Ç¨ per night
Portable water, toilets, electricity and bad Wifi available

name: G√©radout, unnamed road
description:
Nice place quiet place near a lake, beware of the put holes if you drive a camper-van some ground clearance is advised.
And watch the hogs they are plenty if you have a dog.
Big rigs needs definitely some ground clearance, you can walk to the campgrounds from the road a 15 to 29 minute walk (guessing)

name: bay camp spot at beautiful beach
description: Very nice spot at the beach. Not good for swimming though. It is not allowed here.  No 4wd needed. Bring a shovel unless you have a toilet. Its not nice to  find all the paper behind the bushes.

name: Welcome to Nice Caennais
description: Extremely quiet street. No one from the city pass here, only locals (very few). Camping could be possible in private garden if you ask gently to the neighborhood. (try 24)

name: Municipal Camping Charolles
description: Big campsite. Clean and tidy, with big pitches for mainly camper vans also chalet available.

name: Municipal camping Les Pres Bas
description: 2* Municipal site. 10 very big pitches, very basic but all works. Hot showers.

name: Le Teich
description:
Huge Parking Lot with a lot of trees and benches to sit and picknick. There is a swimming area with a beach and free hot showers as well as toilets. They can be used only during the day until 7pm
Good for one night. No signs that camping is forbidden.

name: St. Brieuc
description: Nice and calm parking spot, near by the sea with view over ‚Äöle gr√®ve‚Äò. At the end of the road. During the day lots of people with dogs, but quiet in the night.

name: Chalet du grand Wintersberg
description:
Very very nice and quiet place to wild camp. Tower on the nearby hilltop with Great view over Niederbronn-les-Bains and nearby Germany on the opposite side.
Club vosgien chalet is only busy on week ends and Food+ Drinks served on Sunday.

name: Crystal Laverie
description: This was the third laundry we tried in Cayenne. one was closed, the other didn't work. You can pay cash or card and its ‚Ç¨6 for 7kg, ‚Ç¨8 for 9kg and ‚Ç¨10 for 14kg, ‚Ç¨2 to dry. The machines offer 90/60/40/30 degree washes (select before you pay)  The wash takes about 40 mins.

name: Reims Stade Auguste Delaune
description: Just in front of the stadium, beside main road into centre. Have to leave by 7 am some Saturdays when matches are on (see sign by entrance for dates). Shady small car park, bit of traffic noise but surprisingly peaceful. 15 mins walk to historic centre and beautiful cathedral. McDonald's near cathedral has excellent free WiFi. Canal few minutes away. Suggest suitable for up to 7.5 t. Free.

name: Dole, Camping Du Pasquier
description: Busy site, best to reserve. Takes Camping Card ASCI. ‚Ç¨17.20 p n Inc WiFi. No pitches with electricity‚Äã left when we arrive in September at 5 pm. Wash blocks adequate. Newer one best. Friendly welcome and some English/German spoken. Fresh bread/pastries available for the next morning if ordered. Has swimming pool. Tiny shop in reception. Noisy sports field/fairground nearby

name: L‚Äôetang public campsite
description: Established car park with toilet. Both with and without fee, depends if you stay inside or outside the bar. 10 campers but can fit 50 at least!

name: Lakeside Parking Lot
description: Big parking lot for buses direct at the lake. Toilets in the main building are closed at night. There are some other public toilets next to the playground. Good for one night.

name: watertap at the entrance of the Cimetiere Marin
description: Watertap for the cemetery outside the paid parking.

name: pond and pit stop.
description: truck stop with pond.  we road around lake and camped behind trees.

name: Domaine du Balbuzard
description: Great camping w/ cabanas & yurts along a little lake. Great views and friendly owners. They have a restaurant onsite which who serve delicious local dishes. Sanitary is ok. Beautiful sauna on the edge of the lake (‚Ç¨20). Camping ‚Ç¨6,- pp

name: Fort Mahon Plage
description: In the dunes, parking with water and sanitation. No electricity. 10‚Ç¨ /24h.

name: Le Touquet Paris Plage
description: Near the race course, parking for motorhome 11‚Ç¨/23h. Water 10 mn=2‚Ç¨, electricity 60mn=2‚Ç¨.

name: Cornimont Camper Van Free Camp
description: Camper van parking with a bit of green near the river. Easy access. Water or dump for a few euros. Overnighting free.

name: Camping Teouleyre
description: Great place to stop over, ocean with sandy beach is at biking distance, free wifi, playground for children, perfect for 2 or 3 nights. 19 euro/night for a tent pitch, 25 euro/night per Van pitch (with electricity)

name: Opposite Chateau Monbazillac
description: Large tarmaced area, room for several motor homes, three parked up there the night we were there. No services but amazing views.

name: Domaine La Lande
description: Excellent site for motor homes, ten pitches, grassed area, set in the middle of the vineyard. Very welcoming owners (third generation wine makers), incredibly peaceful & beautiful. Free of charge but you‚Äôll have to be strong willed to resist buying some of the (excellent) wine all of which is made and sold direct from this estate. Working vineyard so may be woken by harvesting at crack of dawn! Bread delivered in the morning. Fresh water, grey waste drainage & chemical toilet emptying facilities available. Also - a beautiful chateau 15 mins walk away in the village.

name: Forest Paradise
description: Parking lot in a big forest with amazing hikes! Good air and nice surrounding. Enjoy!

name: Aire Campingcar LeCrotoy
description: This is the second  spot where you can stay with your camper. Nicer but smaller than the other one at the other side of town. You can stay at the foot of the dunes. Just behind the dunes is the beach/ bay. You can stay 24 h for 7 euro, payable by card. Busy during summer.

name: Aire du Bois Chaudron, St Maure-de-Touraine
description: Large grassy site, plenty of space, some pitches with electricity.  Surrounded by trees so plenty of choice of shady/sunny spots. Level and peaceful, despite being nearby to busy main road. Fresh bread/croissants etc can be ordered from the caretaker when he comes round in the evening. Parking/fresh water/grey waste/dark waste all included for ‚Ç¨4.50 p night. Electricity an extra ‚Ç¨2. Free WiFi apparently but haven‚Äôt found a connection.

name: Mus√©e de la Bataille de Normandie
description: aire de campingcar next to the museum. Free parking but you have to pay to stay overnight (5 euro) between 18:00 and 8:00. Clean place with garbage collectors. Next to a busy road, quiet at night, lots of traffic in the morning.

name: Issigny-s/m
description: Free camper spots in the small harbour of Isigny sur Mer. Free water. Clean spots, some with some green between them. Close to centre and very close to Carrefour supermarket. I ignored some 3.5t signs to get here via the Carrefour parking.

name: Saint Val√©ry sur Somme
description:
A very pretty parking, with fifty locations. Some of this locations have electricity, others don't.

MODERATOR NOTE: This is a public established parking lot in a Residential Area. Only for RVs, Big Rigs or similar.

name: Saint Val√©ry sur Somme
description: Nice, quiet, clean place. About a hundred sites. City nearby. Bike Trail. Some locations have electricity, not all.

name: Aire Camping-car
description: clean grassy stop for camper, very close to the museum and the famous church, 2 euro for 8 hours, 10 euro for 23 hours, 35 euro for 24 hours. There is a camping with all facilities further down the road.

name: Aire de Beaune Merceuil
description: Rest area next to a gas station. Close to highway - not quiet. Overnight stay possible. Toilets, showers, shop available 24/7. Next to no shadow.

name: aire de camping-car
description: close to city centre and lighthouse viewpoint, dustbin and all services. 10 euro for 24 hours

name: u stazzu
description: Very nice campsite, near Macinaggio. friendly people

name: Nantes Camping/Petit Port/Camping de Nantes
description: clean city camping near the center of town, not very cheap, paid 40 euro the first night for a 'premium' spot

name: A nice hidden spot surrounded by river
description: Along the river we parked the camper just by the side of the offroad that crosses a few cattle farms. Nice and quiet! We also had access to the river.

name: Aire de camping-car
description: Only place in the village where campers can park, with or without overnight stay. Free place near the coast, no services at all.

name: Swan lake
description: Nice wild camp for cyclist close to the lake with some swan. Can make fire and sleep well at this quiet place.

name: Camping La Fontaine
description: small clean camping near St Malo, there is a bus going to the town, 23 euro for camper and 2 persons, electricity included

name: Camping a la ferme La Maison Blanche
description: camping a la ferme, 9 euro per night, camping in a field, there are some picknick tables, compost toilet in the shed and you can get water. SuperU 5 km away. tel. 0631492833 , earl-maisonblanche@orange.fr.

name: La Mielle
description:
In front of sea, very quiet for some days.
Water and electricity free. Parking 8‚Ç¨ from 7 in the evening to 9 h in the morning.

name: Beauvoir - Le Mont Saint Michel
description:
Very nice place, very pleasant, to go to the Mont Saint Michel. The location for Motorhomes are either on sand, or on grass. 
The price for 24h is 16,50‚Ç¨, water and electricity free. If you want just the services, the price is just 4,50‚Ç¨.

name: Les Fallaises
description: Aire de camping-cars Les Fallaises Clean, on top of the cliffs, beautiful views if you are near the road. Near the funiculaire to go to the lower part of town where all the restaurants are. 6,4 euro per night.

name: Beach Backjard
description: Beach Camping on a Back yard parking place

name: Camping Acqua Dolce
description: Nice Campsite next to the beach. Some places with electricity under trees. Some on grassy area. Pretty. Showers as usual.

name: camping gourjatoux
description: Nice litre camping in a small nice village. almost wild camping! 8 euros a night for 2 people! fishing, swimming in the river possible ! lovely place!

name: Lac de Der
description: 20 meter from the lake du Der, quiet and clean, pleasant place. Free parking, water and electricity (pay). Possibility to ride around the lake by bike.

name: Camping River
description:
Lovely Campsite in a Valley near the River. Beside a Quiet Road and with very nice wc and Shower. Frindly english speaking People. For Tents, Campers... Place to be.
Electric available. Restaurant...

name: In a  Curve motorcycle access
description:
Small and hidden place near D2204.
Only usable for Bikes, Motorbikes a little running water. Nice trees and a few fireplaces.

name: Ch√¢teau de Queribus
description:
Square with a 360¬∫ view, at the parking lot. The gravel road up above is a straight area, overlooking the Katerer castle and the Pyrenees.

Platz mit 360‚Äô Blick, am Parkplatz die Schotterstra√üe hochfahren oben ist eine gerade Fl√§che, Blick auf die Katerer Burg und die Pyren√§en.

name: Camping Strasbourg
description:
Campground half an hour by foot from Strasbourg‚Äòs city centre. Bus and tram station in short distance.
Around 24‚Ç¨/night for two people and a campervan without electricity.

name: close to col du bonnehomme - Roadside Forrest
description: wodden Campingtablets at the entrance, but further back on the path your alone.

name: Camping Municipal Pierre de Coubertin
description: Nice campground in walking distance to the City Centre. 2 persons/night with campervan (without) electricity: 13.50‚Ç¨

name: Plage de Liamone
description: Big parking lot belonging to a Restaurant/Pizzeria. Free overnight parking if you buy something at the Restaurant. Gate closed at around 22:00 and reopens in the morning around 8:30. Nice sandy beach directly on spot.

name: Abondance
description: Large communal parking area, especially for camper vans. Free to use. There‚Äôs a service point (Flot bleu) to get water and electricity, where you can pay by credit card. Quiet location near the local tennis club, on walking distance of the small village of Abondance (restaurants, bakery, butcher, small shops). Public toilets in the next door sports hall (‚Äògymnase‚Äô) were closed when I visited, but those in the village (next to the tourist info, ca. 400 m) were open and rather well kept.

name: Port Celet
description: Quiet, no service, really next to the river... Clean and quiet so keep it that way!

name: Camping La Pindiere
description:
Large campsite 30mins north of Nantes, organised into lots for cabins, motorhomes & tents.
With small restaurant/bar, undercover outdoor area and covered heated pool (though only open May-Sept).

name: Line Maginot
description: Bunkers from the war. In the middle of the foresty area. Ample parking outside.

name: Aire de camping-cars de Sisteron
description: Large communal campervan-site (aire municipale) of the town of Sisteron. Level grass field, some gravel pitches at the foot of the citadel, overlooking the city. Rather steep access road. No facilities, but there are public toilets at the citadel. Town centre within walking distance (500-1000 m). Dump station at the railway station.

name: Camping de Nevers
description: On the banks of the River Loire overlooking Nevers. Shady. English & German spoken. 5 mins walk into town. Comfortable lounge/bar area (pizzas & drinks + ice creams) with tv, microwave & kettle + books. Limited number of pitches with electricity. ‚Ç¨19.50 pn for van & 2 adults with electricity with ASCI card out of season. Interesting unisex ablutions: 2 separate rooms; 1 for unisex toilets (ladies/men's cubicles labelled separately but full view of urinals!) and the other for unisex showers/basins, individual showers are labelled for ladies/men. Laundry facilities for ‚Ç¨4.50. WiFi good but only available near reception/lounge. Children's play area and tables. Closed from 4 November to 3 March inc.

name: Houeilles
description: P Air in the middel of de village.Tres calme.

name: La Cle des Champs
description: Little, simple campground near to Calvi, hot showers even at the end of October, not too expensive. Just a simple campground, no bar, no pool, no playground, but good if you are looking for a hot shower and a place to stay near Calvi.

name: Wildcamp in Bargemon
description: This is an ideal spot for one night. We stayed here with one tent and 2 bikes. It is out of the way and discreet. So sorry can‚Äôt find the picture I took!

name: Autry-Issards, small lake camp
description: Camping allowed next to a small lake. A pretty quiet secondary road passes next to the campsite area, did not bother me too much. Some people came to walk their dogs in the evening. There is plenty of space to park but I have a feeling this might be a busy place during high season, today we were two here.

name: l'aire Marin
description:
Informal camping beside the Canal du Midi next to the campsite. 
Frequently used by vans from all over as well as mooring for canal boats. There are numerous places along this part of the canal and even a few spaces the other side wher boaters park up. There are shops in Vias and Vias Plage both 15-20 min walk. Beach very nice.

name: Saint-Jean-le-Vieux
description: Small, flat tarmac parking behind the main parking, right in the centre of Saint-Jean-le-Vieux. Bar, hotel-restaurant, local well stocked supermarket and bakery, plus clean public toilets and wash basin with drinking water behind the post-office, all within 100 m. I spent a very pleasant, quiet night there, far away from the busy St. Jean-Pied-de-Port (at 4 km).

name: Spot a l‚Äôexploitation de noix
description:
Nice place to camp in the garden or in the parking. They produce nuts and sell theirs products. Free to camp. Toilket and water available.

Exploitation de noix - parking mis √† disposition (√©t√© possibilit√© de dormir dans le verger) proprio tr√®s sympa. Toilette √† disposition et eau. D√©licieux produits en vente sur place !
Gratuit !

name: Aire de Camping-cars
description: Large communal camper-van site with flat concrete flaps as hard stands on every pitch. Electricty provided on each pitch, but not all points are working. Some taps on site, again: not all running. Within walking distance of busy, touristy St. Jean-pied-de-Port, which has a few public toilets. This place is right behind the Camping Municipal, which was closed when I visited, beginning of November.

name: air de Pic nic de p√©zilla-la-rivi√®res
description: jolie endroit pos√© son v√©hicule avec table proche de la ville , avec toilettes ouvert jusqu'√† 22h, tranquille et paisible.

name: Campsite in the woods
description: Plenty of space in the forest. Couple of picnic benches, a fire pit on a concrete slab. A small old abandoned structure with a table and chairs and a functional indoor fireplace to get out of the weather. LTE. Nice lake very close.

name: Parc de l'√âdit camping-car parking
description: Free parking spot for small RVs (vans and small motorhomes) right next to a municipal park. Includes a dumping station and drinking water (4‚Ç¨). Walking distance to town. Ok.

name: Fontainblhostel
description:
The host is very nice and welcoming.
There are all the facilities from a typical hostel plus you can rent crash pads for bouldering at 8 euros per day and bikes too (guests only).
Showers 3.50 euros
Showers plus beer 4 euros
Room in a dorm 32 euros pp first night, 25 for the following nights.
Camping 16 euros pp
50% discount for kids up to 12, free for babies under 2.

35 mins walk to Elephant/Dame Jouanne/Maunoury boulders

name: Les Collieurs
description: Friendly owner, you can choose your own spot. Also accessable for big rigs. The Ares is great for Wales from the camping grounds.

name: Parking
description: parking near shop and office. huge free parking

name: Reignac Sur Indre
description: Parking next to the river L'indre. Close to the village.

name: Fountains free water drinking
description: Fountains with free drinking water. There are 3 in the village.

name: Camping les roux
description: This is a very inexpensive campsite with showers ( x 4 ) toilets , wash basins and a few bbq‚Äôs its capacity reads as 30 but I think this is 30 pitches with electric . And if you turn up and the full sign is up just ask because when the electric pitches are full the sign goes out . It has a small restaurant and sells drinks . It is a wonderful site very friendly, motorbike friendly too . They have a web site . It is five minutes walk to see one of the most amazing coloured lakes I have ever seen and only 25 minutes to walk to the shore , where you can swim. There is a small local supermarket that sells everything you could want including camping supplies

name: Cuchery viewpoint
description: A very quiet place with a wonderfull panoramic view over vineyards. There are picknicktables and a garbage bin.

name: sani Saint imoges

name: Saint Mesmin . Morineaux lake
description:
Free Car park near the small lake. For all motorhomes 
Toilets. Free watter . Very quiet 

Parking gratuit √† c√¥t√© du petit lac. Pour tout camping ar
Toilettes.possibilit√© de faire le plein d ‚Äòeau . tr√®s calme

name: Flat ground

Nice flat ground surrounded by forest. Nobody can see you from the road. 
Only some cows but without any problem. 
Offroad camper is better to access but onroad camper can stay near to the main road.

name: Uchizy, riverbank

name: Bord de la vilaine

name: Parking
description:
We stayed here for a night without problems, right by the beach , not sure if we were allowed to but the parking didnt state any times or ‚Äúprivate ‚Äú. There‚Äôs a public toilet 20 m away , free
Many parking spaces available

name: Col de Turini/‚ÄãCamp d'argent

Official picknik area, quite close to a cheese factory. 
Greate view and start point of many hiking tours. 
Buy some food and ask them if its ok to stay. 
Not reachable in winter time!

The Clos Imbert municipal campsite has 44 locations. This two-star campsite is located in the Thouet Valley, by the river a few steps from the city center. Labeled "Accueil v√©lo", this campsite is an essential stop on the V√©lo Francette.

name: Dieulefit, les grands moulins

name: Camping in the woods

name: Rest area with showers

name: Dream Team Car

Dream Team Car +33 442 060 404 
vincent@dreamteamcar.com

big rig friendly.

picknick tables here..

small typical french village (juill√©) 2 minutes walking distance. i did not check it out if there's shops/bakery's etc.

name: Sainte-Marie-de-la-Mer
description: Good place for Camping car en Camargue !

name: Lermot Beach

name: near epagnette on river

name: P√©llissane Camper Parking Free Camp

name: Ibis budget

name: Beauvoir Hotel

name: Motorway rest area with toilets

name: Melle

name: Camping Toy

name: Canal du Midi
description: parking lot with gravel and grass by the canal, now in the wintertime it's very quiet, nice nature

name: carrefour laundry
description: laundry machines next to carrefour supermarket. ‚Ç¨8 for 18 kg, ‚Ç¨4 for 8 kg. 15 min drying ‚Ç¨2. no need of washing liquid, included in the machine

name: Camping Les 7 Laux
description: open December - March and May - October,  very nice campground with beautiful view,  2 person and camper 20 Eur, with 2 dogs and Tax we pay 26 Eur, WiFi only at the reception

name: Wild Spot - North of Moulinet
description:
Little Wildspot Next to 180degree Curve. 
Over the Little Bridge. Suitable for Max. 4 Cars

name: Saint brison -sur loire
description: Tarmac carpark. 6 places big rigs go in lengthwise

name: Le Domaine Vert
description:
Beautiful campsite with only a limited number of completely free places and a great reception by Anne and Gerhard who really understand what hospitality is. The dog is not a problem
Open from 01.04-15.10

name: Les Cigales camping
description:
nice place for camping car, 4x4 or tent.
we stayed for one night in tent in winter time. 
hot shower, WiFi and toilets available.
very clean place.
the staff is friendly.

name: Plateau de Gergovie
description: Magnificent site very beautiful view of the chain of puy de dome and the plain of limagne,  historic site gaulois, beware there can be wind .

name: Camping Aux M√™mes

Lovely campsite. Very friendly, including bikers. Very small and quiet but great beer and food.
Highly recommended.

name: Orpierre
description: Follow the signs to Adresh Parking, park at the last bend. A rocky road to get there, but the view is worth it. Nice and quiet.

name: Mus√©um
description: Near a Wood, a little road is but is far. It‚Äôs quiet

name: Saint R√©my de Provence
description: Near cemetery on a gravel road good under trees for shadow, quiet night drinking water in cemetery also 50 m an asphalted parking 5 minutes down town

name: les Baux de Provence
description: .3 kms from the village along a gravel road. without traffic.  quiet.  no service except speedy internet Manu . other places around

name: Couches
description: Nice spot in the countryside without any accommodations.

name: Villa Victor Louis
description: Refined setting for the new boutique hotel, located right by the "Golden Triangle" of Bordeaux. Intimate, secret and elegant atmosphere of an 18th century Bordeaux mansion, the rooms and suites customized and unique of Villa Victor Louis offer you comfort and calm in an exclusive environment.

name: Au Rocher Baron
description: typical French Bistro/bar. good quality, reasonably priced home cooking. Plat du jour,. coffee/tea/beer/wine. friendly welcoming service.   open all week from 08:00 until mon, tues, weds open until 19:00, thurs, fri, sat open until 21:00 sunday closed. great friendly service.

name: Secluded Lay-by near Boulogne-sur-Mer
description: Great quiet spot in the woods to park a camper-van overnight.

name: wild spot with lake view
description:
Nice spot behind the Saint Apollinaire Village. Amazing view on the lake. 
Parking place on the side of the road, and hundred meter of hike to reach the flat and grassy spot between some rock.

name: next to the Roman bridge
description:
Nice spot to stay. 
Didn't actually sleep here (just lunch break) but the place is nice and quiet, with water from the river. Sleeping next to the bridge is very close to the road (but very few circulation during the day so probably even less at night)  but there a lot a place to stay 500m away from it.
If you ask to local people where to stay, it's even safer (just to be sure what is public and what is private)

name: Saint Pabu
description:
Parking with access to the beach and hikes on the dune. Dry toilet on site. No sea view. Easy access for template less than 8 meters.

parking avec acc√®s √† la plage et randonn√©es sur dune. toilette s√®che sur place. aucune vue sur mer. acc√®s facile pour gabarit moins de 8 m√®tres.

name: Port Saint Pierre
description:
After few meters on a track you will arrive on a flat area with lake view.
No shadow but you can find a wooden table under a tree if you take the small path on the right side. And have an access to the beach with this same path.

name: small narrow parking lot by the sea

Near a camping.

Its a nice place between the cliff and some farming fields. There are no toilets and no fresh water and no access to the beach but you have a great view on the sea and a perfect sunset and sunrise!

There is enough space for a few cars.

name: laundromat intermarch√©

name: Parking randonneurs
description: Quiet place near a river, with place for many rigs, water, one picnic table and a little river.

name: Parking lot near Refuge de l'Ab√©rouat
description: nice place to stay for one night, especially if you want to make a hike next day up to pic d'Anie or around. there are no restrictive signs and it seems to be that is all right to stay for a night. but difficult to navigate, because you aren't allowed to drive through Lescun with mobile homes. anyway there is a small road possibilty to go around Lescun. The parking lot itself is a bit downhill orientated but you can manage it to get a likely plane place. not for very big rigs! max. about 4t and up to 6m length i would recommend

drive only with all-wheel drive. great bay. space for two vehicles access prohibited from June to September
 --- zufahr nur mit allrad. tolle bucht. platz f√ºr zwei Fahrzeuge

description: big open space to camp next to little stream of water. Water is super clean so wash your dirty self !  people sometimes walk their dogs here but they are super friendly and did not mind me camping here.

name: Froncles

Maybe 15 camping spots or less. we did'nt even have to pay because nobody was here

name: Moselquelle / La Source de la Moselle
description:
Source of the River Mosel. 

(MOD Note: according to pictures on Google Maps you will not be able to fill RVs tanks easily. Probably only bottles and small containers)


Die Quelle der Mosel,

name: La Broche
description: A very nice and quiet campsite. The owner is very helpful

name: Pradons‚Äô cave
description: There is a cave just next to the road along the Dr√¥me (the river). You can easily fit a van. A bit windy but you can sleep protected from the rain and there is no much cars at night. Pigeons are nesting in this cave so it might be a bit noisy. 20m away from this cave there is another one giving access to the river so you can swim, bath or wash the dishes.

name: Le Petit Bistrot
description:
Nice pub to get a drink.
Calm and out of the old town.

name: Camping Vauban
description: Nice camping for cyclists. The owners are cyclists themself and knows what cyclists needs. Spots whith shade. Small tent with fridge, microwave, tables and plugs for charging.

name: Relais de la Gare
description: Place to pitch tents behind the bike shop.

name: Wolfartsboffen lake
description: Grassy field parking lot, nearby the lake (artificial). Surrounded by forest with multiple hiking tracks. The little town of Reichshoffen (supermarket, etc) can be reached by walking 10‚Äô.

name: mountain communication station
description: flat spot for a small vehicle with astonishing view. 4x4 and ground clearance necessary. please don't leave any trash or toilet paper behind p

name: beachsite
description: nice little spot. You need to drive through rough terrain. lots of ground clearance and possibly 4wd necessary. car will get scratches for sure as the harsh vegetation really narrow. take your trash and toilet paper with you! respect the nature

name: Riverside Tours Loire. Wonderful spot
description:
Wild camp spot for ‚Äúoffroad‚Äù rigs and trucks. Best spot at the Loire river. You can even swim but be careful because of the current. 
Drive down the dike road. Steep road and getting narrow. Not for big white campers.

name: Air naturelle de Hinsbourg
description: Beautiful quiet camper place basic facilities

name: Parking lot overseeing Belmont
description: Super quiet parking lot overseeing Belmont and the valley surrounded by forest and grass fields. Gorgeous view on the Vosges Mountains

name: By the river
description: If you follow the steep dirt road downhill off the road you'll come to a nice old stone bridge across the river. Just on the other side is a flattish area where you could set up a couple of tents, or you could also pitch on the bridge itself (plenty of rocks around to weigh down your tent). Quiet spot, I left early as there's a work camp nearby but I doubt anyone would disturb you. Decent place for a cyclist as camping options are very limited in this area. I would NOT recommend driving down here in a car or van unless you have 4 wheel drive as its very steep and slippery - you might have a job getting back out again!

name: Stealth camp in the woods
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Likely only tent camping possible

It's really hard to find a hidden spot to pitch a tent around Chamonix as all the woodland has many paths running through and there are so many people around. The best place I could find was this one, tucked away in the trees. Not very far from the path, but as long as your tent is a fairly well camouflaged colour (green being ideal) you're pretty much invisible. Only space for one small tent here though, and it's pretty tight.

name: Camping le vieux moulin
description: Nice campsite next to the river tarn. small and calm. Simple and clean sanitaire.

name: Parking in the nature
description: Nice parking in the nature next to the village of Roussillon

name: DEFENDER Workshop - Baracaland
description: Hard to find but definitely worth it. See photos. Vincent is old school and been doing this a long time. Only speaks French, but we worked it out.  Lots of parts on stock. +33613692254

name: Grassy parking lot
description: Grassy parking with several spots at the start of the "Pierre de Bosson" hiking trail, from where you can see the Mer de Glace glacier. Sign says no parking between July 15th and September 1st.

name: Roadside place with beautiful view
description: beautiful roadside location.  marked one way road but we passed anyway.  breathtaking view of the valley and the Rustrel Colorado. almost no passage, super calm night.  sunset and starry sky as a bonus :)

name: Parking lot at La Roche Mignonne
description: Parking with nice view of the bay, 3 spaces for motorhome and ten standard spaces. (paying if someone passes ask for the 7 ‚Ç¨ fee) toilets, trash cans

name: Spot by the lake
description: Great place by the lake for a van or two. The neighbor told us there was no problem for us to stay there. Great sunrise!  Please respect nature here so that we can continue to enjoy it freely. No service. Enjoy!

name: Places along the way to the lake
description: Four or five places on a path leading to the lake, rather flat, very quiet. Visit of the environmental police who told us that it was okay to stay, if we don't make a fire and be careful with the garbage. Please respect this lovely place.

name: Aire camping Car Collonges La rouge
description: Pretty wooded place with plenty of places under trees, toilets and water, no electricity. 8‚Ç¨ / 24h. Near the village, the baker comes at 8 a.m.

name: little field on side a little sand way
description: Only for 4x4 üö® after a little kilometer in a pedestrian & horseriding way You ll arrived at a little field of grass clear of trees and people Juste before the intersection

name: very nice parking
description: very nice parking next to the river, very calm, water free

name: water tap
description: water tape on the parking next to the river.

name: Lake lay-by
description: Beautiful spot outside the towns surrounding the lake! Road is fairly busy, but it‚Äôs flat and a great view

name: Camping Casa di luna
description: Very nice campsite, easygoing owner. Pool, 15 min to Fango-pools, 10 min to sea. Wide plots, shady under olive trees.

name: L'Occitan
description: Small friendly bar and restaurant, good choice of beers, brasserie type of food, vegetarian options on the menu + don't hesitate to ask the chef for vg specials.

name: River Loire parking spot
description: Good little area at the side of the River Loire in the middle of France. Space for several vans and a big rig or two. Lay-by out of carpark too if necessary until the locals leave. A few people were here Mid-july dotted up the river but they all left and we were the only ones there overnight. Parking on good firm ground. Access to riverside over quite a large sandy/pebble area. Lots of room up the waterside. River shallow and cool in the hot summer sun. Nice for a dip. Not muddy. Good sunset between the trees over the water.

name: inter marche
description:
Behind the Inter marche is a 24/7 laundry.

hinter dem Inter marche ist eine 7x24h w√§scherei.

name: place de la mairie
description:
very good well to fill the water tank. Two taps.

sehr guter Brunnen zum Wassertank f√ºllen. Zwei Zapfstellen.

name: Fredencon
description:
Some pitches for small mobile homes.
Driveway steep and narrow.
Even a disposal point.

Einige Stellpl√§tze f√ºr kleine Wohnmobile.
Zufahrt steil und eng.
Sogar eine Entsorgungsstelle.

name: Natural area Chanteuge
description: Natural area campsite authorized on Chanteuges in the Allier Gorges near the Allier River.

name: Cap de Long
description:
Larger spaces for RVs. Top location on the Lake


Gr√∂sserer Platz f√ºr mehre Wohnmobile. Top Lage am see

description:
Big area for big rigs and tents.13‚Ç¨ with water and electricity. Toilets on place.
Restaurant, and free shower 300m around.
But you could use free parking too close to this, to stay the night without electricity...

name: Flot Bleu - Madine Dump Station
description: Free for used water, 3‚Ç¨ for toilets water (european system)
