name: Parking lot at the belv√©d√®re
description: parking for around 15 cars;  very nice view of the lake at the end of a path.  we slept there with 3 other vans.  very little traffic on the road.  did not see a prohibition sign.

name: By the lake
description: huge flat place by the lake, usualy very crowded but beautiful view !!

name: Col de la Fromag√®re
description: Coming from Rosans take the second unmarked ‚Äúpiste‚Äù in the right hand side. Follow the gravel road up, until just before the barrier past a left hand corner. Here you have a level plateau wher you can camp peacefully. No services whatsoever and no mechanical noises. Access requires vehicle with sufficient ground clearance (4x4)

name: Grassy clearing next to the Wood
description: pretty grassy clearing at the end of an asphalt road then a short gravel path (Easy) 100% quiet night, we saw no one.

name: picnic area water
description: Free drinking water at the side of the road at a large picnic/bbq area on the way up to m√©ribel. Free toilet also here at the top corner in the wooden hut

name: Tentes
description: Shortly before the camping forbidden sign on the edge of the national park. Great view and lots of sheep.

name: Vallon-Pont-d'Arc
description: If you want to stay overnight close to this  amazing arc across the river, this is the best place. Wild camping is forbidden in this area. During day time crowded, but in the morning you can swimm alone under the arc.

name: Prieur√© de Marcevol
description: You have a wonderful view over the Pyrenees from the parking in front of the priory, but it might be very windy. Thus, we chose to dislocate on the dirt road, where it is calm. At the parking is a map with hiking circuits. You also can visit from here the  bee wax chamber of Wolfgang Laib. Ask for the key at the priory, in the village Marcevol or in the tourist office in Vin√ßa. For contemporary art lovers an absolutely must, but quite strenuous.

name: Hill underneath the street
description: Little spot down the hill. Great view. okay for one night. Ground clearance necessary. not suitable for big rigs!

name: cap corse
description: Nice spot with panoramic view, the road is quite damaged but ok. Drinking water available close to the church on the road.

name: Briffons Village
description: place of the village next to the church. a distributor of bread is on the place and toilet also.

name: 4x4 wildcamp in the forrest
description:
Nice secluded spot in the forrest. Accesable for 4x4 vehicle with min 20 cm ground clearance. 

Bring your shovel for a nice levelled spot ;-)

We didnt see or hear anyone around in the time we were there. 

Reachable from 48.4189763, 0.2248888 at the road with the treetrunks.

name: sauf autorisation
description:
place with a great view

hammer Pl√§tzchen mit eben solcher Aussicht

name: Rue de la Planchette to Quai du Port
description: At the end of Rue de la Planchette turn right and there is a small, rough, informal car park next to the canal.  A few dog walkers, but very quiet.

name: Near river
description: Parking just outside Chablis by river and before the campsite. car parking on lane next to river. no signs prohibiting overnight stays

name: √âtang de Rambaille
description:
Quiet place around a pond. Good place to fish! 
We came at 7pm. we put up the tent and folded it up at 7:30 am. No 'no camping' sign but people advised us not to leave the tent too long. There are some tables and garbage containers. Fence for big vehicles, we think it's about 2 meters high. Very nice spot.

name: Canalside
description: Canalside grassy parking. WC, shower and bar across canal. A large grassy parking area with a few trees on the banks of a canal. Picnic tables. Some road noise but not enough to disturb a nights sleep in my opinion. A lovely spot.

name: Route de la broderie
description: Free parking, quiet, 300m from town center

name: Beachside
description: We arrived in Boyardville around 3pm and all the spots and parking were full. We found this one and it was empty for the night. And surprise, there is a restaurant just 50m away. The food was delicious! The beach is close and you can see Fort Boyard. Quiet at night !

name: col de agnes
description:
A wonderful place somewhat sheltered from the road.
With all-wheel drive, the upper and better place is accessible. Otherwise the lower place. A few vehicles fit here.No mobile phone reception.

Ein wunderbares Pl√§tzchen etwas gedeckt von der Strasse weg.
Mit Allrad ist der obere und bessere Platz erreichbar. Ansonsten der untere Platz.
Es passen ein paar Fahrzeuge hier hin.
Kein Mobilfunk Empfang.

name: la Loire. Riverside
description: Little places along the way on side the Loire. Not so quiet with the cycles and people passing there. But enough for a night.

name: Riverside parking lot
description:
Small concrete parking lot at a quiet river near the forest, right next to a dirt bike track.
Another place some 100 meters down the road.
Forest hiking track right next to it

name: Flavigny
description: Grassy picnic area beside a lane. Quiet. Close to town.

name: end of field on side vienne
description: At the end of field a little places on side water  With trees Almost no body except the kayak There is a national road away in front that is noisy a bite

name: Garcia
description:
Nice places along the stream. The specified coordinates can only be reached with good ground clearance.
Good starting point for hikes. e.g. up to the lake

name: Tremouille
description: Nice place near the river. You can swim.

name: Camping des Merveilles
description:
Nice campsite with spacious plots. Well tended and clean.

Medium rigs could fit here.

It‚Äôs located next to the main road so during the day it may be a bit noisy, but at night it is quiet. I paid ‚Ç¨ 8,50 for the night with tent and motorbike.

name: Camping Municipal Le Gurp
description: Wonderful campsite right behind the beach dunes in a beautiful, shady pine forest (good to hang your hammock between the trees). It has 1000 sites for tents / caravans with or without electricity points but it never feels crowded because there is so much space. It‚Äôs all very natural, basic showers and toilets in several sanitary blocks, children‚Äòs playgroung, ping-pong, surf school, small supermarket and restaurants just outside on the beach. Lots of families, surfers and alternative people. Very reasonable price (20‚Ç¨ night for one person in a Caravan including electricity).

name: tremouille
description: nice spot near the river. you can swim. possibility for van or tent

name: Vent des For√™ts - Parking
description: In the middle of a forest with more than 130 sculpture you will find this parking lot, where overnight camping is explicitly allowed. You can do several hikes, see map attached.

name: Source Lavoir
description: fresh running water out of pipe and tap where you can fill up bottles and small canisters

name: Dordogne river
description: anglard, on Dordogne river. a small meadow, at the end of a motorable path

name: Roadside R√©serve Naturelle
description: Beautiful spot near the side of a road. Amazing views on both sides of the road. Enough space for multiple campers.  Near beach acces and hiking trails.

name: Lakeside Parking
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Unclear if accessible by vehicles

At the end of a rough unmade track with many pot holes is an area of parking by the lakeside. A small chapel commemorates the resistance fighters of WW2 and tents have been pitched nearby. On cycle path number 19. Not Level. No facilities. A nice, pretty, quiet spot.

name: Nanas Bordon
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No car access

Next to a stream, a few places to pitch a tent. On the way or from Chamonix. Good fresh wild shower.

name: Ch√¢teau
description: Very Nice place and quite next to the Castle

name: Spot bivouac - St Maurice Navacelles
description:
Hiiden place next to road.
Toilets and shower and fires are allowed


toilettes et douche et le feux sont autoris√©s

name: Free car park under trees by the river
description: St Piere. A pretty village by a river to paddle or kayak. Just a 2km ascent to Vezelay, easily done if you can cycle.

name: Parking next to a park (Max. 2,2m width)
description: Nice parking spot along the road. We came here because the parking along the sea were overcrowded. It is next to a park. Very quiet by night. Plus, there are public toilets that are very clean. To reach the parking spot you need to cross a narrow bridge that is max. 2,20 meter wide.

name: Aire de Blagny Picnic Parking
description: Off a quiet lane on the cycle route, The Vineyards Trail. Picnic tables and a small grassy area to park. Overlooking the vineyards. Quiet. Just wish people would dispose of their toilet paper rather than leaving it in the bushes! Leave no trace!!!!!

name: Excellent free drinking water!
description: Public pump at the end of a village. Free to use for all.

name: By the river
description: Nice spot next to the river Seine. It's quiet, and there are bins, possibilities to sit and a book exchange. We spent one night with our camper here and can recommend it.

name: By the river
description:
Just besides the Doubs river, protected then no fither man
With the railway further but not noisy.
Water super clean.

name: Camping de la Vallee de l‚Äôoise, Guise
description: Nice quiet campsite, clean bathrooms, hot showers, lots of space, Carrefour nearby. We stayed 6 days when it was bloody hot sitting under shady trees. When you need a place to telax, this one is highly recommended. The people are nice, we got interviewed by the local press.

name: Domaine de Clarat
description:
Really nice little campsite with hughe plots of the main roads. Super dark quiet at night.

Have a swimming pool and bar/restaurant on site.

Not for big rigs since you have to cross a bridge with max weight and width.

name: Large picknick area
description: Nice place next to a lake with lots of space for big rigs. Park your car on the dead end track or just park it on the grass. During the day there is some traffic and cyclist and other daytime users. At night it‚Äôs quiet, good stop for one night.

name: Camping de la Vegre
description:
Very nice campsite!! Large plots, lots of trees, swimming pool (also for small children), bar.
Hot showers included.

I paid the incredible amount of ‚Ç¨7,55 for one night (tent + motorbike) and that included everything.

Big rigs will definitely fit here.

name: Even more relaxed!
description:
Just around the corner of the other location nearby, is a much quieter and secluded area to enjoy. Plenty of shade or sunshine, whichever you prefer. Absolutely quiet at night, bigger rigs or any tent size can find a lovely spot.
If needed: full 4G coverage.

name: Plage de Bellecin
description: Beautiful lake with a Rimini-like beach feeling. Several free gravel camping grounds in different elevations to the lake. At this location beautiful view, some privacy but no walking distance to the beach. Further below there are huge parkings for hundreds of cars during the day and countless campers during the night.

name: Public water faucet
description: Free water from the public faucet at a tiny square. Excellent taste and cool.

name: Wild Swimming. Very cold!
description: Jade green cold water for swimming and diving if you know where to jump off the bridge safely

name: Lake Ospedale
description: Quite place by forest, a lot of room for van or camper.

name: Parking spot, view on the beach
description:
We stayed there 2 nights. Very quiet at night, no too much lights. LOT of camper van staying for the night.
Only thing, 1.9m!!!
Toilets and shower on the beach.

name: Camping in the wild
description:
Next to a small rural road, a picnic area with a  really small parking sport.
Ok for cars. You van even pitch your tent in the picnic area!

name: Nice spot at the lake
description: Great spot by a lake. Near a village but still secluded. There where some people fishing here during the day but at night we were alone.

name: Jura Mountains NP
description: Tucked in the trees. There is a two track loop in the Jura Mountains Regional Natural Park.  We chose an offshoot of the loop to park for the night. The two track offshoot becomes single track, just FYI. There are other options for parking off of the loop.

name: la Bienne
description: pretty site near the Bienne river.  ideal for a night in wild camping.  place known to locals.

name: Sarthe river
description: Idyllic spot at the slow flowing Sarthe river, with river banks, fishing, swimming. High clearance car/camper or 4x4 needed (see pictures) as you reach the spot via a farmer's track, but then you have your spot right at the water and under some tall poplars. Very quiet except for frogs and ducks. Phone coverage is OK.

name: Camper parking Quarr√©-les-Tombes
description: Nice sleepy town in the Morvan with butchers bakery, hotel, restaurant, pub, grocery, etc. Camper parking is nothing special but spacey and big rigs will fit easily. Good place fill up the food and wines.

name: Camping Bagatelle
description:
Probably the closest campsite to the town. It is a quick walk to the historical center of the town. A good locating to stay in my eyes and visit the town. 

I paid 9.24 euros with my bicycle and tent. There are poles with power outlets throughout the campsite but needed an adapter for use. I got one from the reception for a 20 euro deposit. There were also rooms available and swimming pool. The wifi was rather useless for down or uploads.

name: Le vallon de Sancey
description:
3 place free for van or motorhome with nice view.
Little village

name: eau potable
description: drinkable water in a very nice village on gr3.

name: Cabane - Etang de Mercoire
description: Small hut next to the pond. Several picnic tables. a source of drinking water in the middle of a field 500m before arriving

name: Car Park for Restaurant
description: If you ask politely and eat at the restaurant, you may be permitted to stay overnight in their car park. Fields and cow bells.

name: Bout De Haut
description: Public picnic place, 100 meter from the public road.

name: cabane bonnal
description: nice hut on the Stevenson path. bring your own water

name: Parking de Bagne
description: Rural car park with eco toilet and picnic bench. Beautiful far reaching open views. Quiet at night. I would recommend the circular walk displayed in the car park. Varied terrain. It can be extended to the passerelle at Combe du Grenand. Boulangerie at La Bridoire can be reached during the walk too.

name: Next to river near Pelonne
description: A beautiful spot next to a small river. It is near the road but  by the evening there is almost no traffic.

name: Champ Massot Combe de l'Ours Ski Lift Car Parking
description: During summer this large stone/gravel car park is unused making it a quiet spot to stay overnight beneath the mountain.

name: Saint-Pierre-les-Ebeuf
description: Nice gravel parking in park on a quiet neighborhood. Perfect to stay overnight for free outside Rouen. No amenities. Have map of other camper parking lots in area, too.

name: Place in the village
description: Nice view on the castle. Possibility of water. Nice trek in the nature.

name: Drinking water fountain, push button
description: Drinks water fountain with push button to fill water bottles.

name: Parking at end of road
description: At the end of the D102A Vers Arpison road. Go past the Nordic walking hotel and continue on the pot holes but manageable road to the end. A quiet place in the pine forest.  Walker in morning passing.

name: Fecamp - Aire municipal
description: Gravel parking lot at the harbor for camping mobiles. Free from 08:00 to 17:30, just 5 Euro from 17:30 to 08:00. Right next to the town with dumping station. Toilets in tourist info.

name: Nordic Ski Centre
description: Currently closed  Nordic Ski Centre carpark. Start for hiking. Wonderful views. Very quiet and relaxed.

name: Camping les Richardes
description:
Campsite at the eastern end of Val-d'Is√®re. More like an open field. Nice view of the mountains. Can do laundry. By hand. Maybe there is a washing machine available, I didn't ask. 

Paid 7 euros for my tent, bicycle and me.5 minutes of hot water in the shower was 1 euro. 

Good starting point for cyclists that go over the Col de l'Iseran.

name: Ecluse de Le Gueslin
description:
We stayed there with our tent and 2 bikes along the canal.
You can pitch your tent near the wood table .
You can ask for water from the guy of the ecluse (lock).

name: Pontivy camping
description:
Municipal campground in town along the canal
7,80 euros for 2 adults with a tent ( and 2x 0,20 euros for taxes )

name: Combe du Faux
description: A narrow lane leads to the top of the hill where there is a large area of flat ground for free camping. Unlikely to be alone, but there is enough space for seclusion and it's quiet with 360 degree views. Can be windy.

name: Lower Picnic Car Park for Aboretum
description: Flat site with wonderful views. Picnic Benches. Toilet. Basin. Bins. Two car parks. Use lower car park.

name: Next to the River Bez
description: 10 minutes walk to Chatillon.  Space for two vehicles next to a quiet lane used by cyclists and walkers. Access to the river but deep enough for swimming. Access via Chemin de l'abeurau then turn left at the large picnic area which has been closed to vehicles with rocky barriers.  A short distance along the lane running along the river are the various spaces to camp.

name: Best free Camp in Summer
description: Probably the best free site you will find in the area. Though it‚Äôs not really marked as a campsite there is plenty of space for a few tents and tables. River close. Pit toilet was closed. I stayed with my motorbike - no problem... Very open view to the mountains close. #freiheitenwelt

name: Hotel la Bastibe - Good for motorbikes
description: Nice little Hotel in center of town. They have a good garage to keep your bike inside. Payed 50‚Ç¨ for a nice room with private bath. The old ‚Äûcite‚Äú is in 20-30 minutes walking distance. Breakfast is another 8‚Ç¨ and definitely worth it. My full recommendation. Very helpful stuff as well. #freiheitenwelt

name: Parking space on Route Panoramic
description: Plenty of space to park off this small road. This parking space for two vehicles is quiet and secluded overnight and next to a small wood. Occasionally vehicle.

name: Parking du Vidourle
description: Parking lot with "120 spaces" by the river. Good place to sleep in your car. We set up a tent at night and quickly took it down in the morning.

name: St. Jean le Thomas
description: Nice camping car area with all services, next to campground. Very quiet with trees and next to a meadow. 8 Euro per night, 2 Euro for drinking water, grey water and toilet are free.

name: Car Park
description: No prohibition signs. Close to houses so perhaps just one night. Church bells every hour and some traffic noise.

name: Aire in natural surroundings
description: An Aire costing ‚Ç¨5 per van.  Natural surroundings, trees, overlooking vineyard.  5 mins from a lovely village with water fountain, WC and restaurants.

name: La Fourcelles
description: A little bit offroad, a little gravelpad winds 100m upward. In the middle of the woods, only a mountainbike crossroads there, but a nice little place to park a camper or 4X4 jeep. Only for the more adventurous, but quiet and a lot of forest to hike in.

name: Aire Municipale de Lampaul
description: Nice campground with all facilities in the Dunes. Hot showers. Great for surfing - lots of kite surfers. 12.50 Euro per camping car + 0.22 Euro Tax/p.

name: The Vitrouillieres Ancient Quarry Car Park
description: Secluded Car Park in natural setting at head of walk to ancient quarry. Fantastic views. Quiet.

name: cabane on gr70
description:
Hut not equipped on the Stevenson road. just a place to shelter from the rain and to sleep on the wooden floor
==========================================================
Cabane non √©quip√©e sur le chemin de Stevenson. juste un endroit pour se mettre √† l'abri de la pluie et pour dormir sur le plancher en bois

name: near Courboux
description: Lots of small countryroads through the fields, with a lot of side space to put a camper. Very quiet, nice views and nice walks.

name: Hautacam
description: Grassy flat field area overseeing Tramassel mountain restaurant . 360 view, over the Pyrenees mountains with a view on observatory of Pic du Midi

name: Gignac car park
description: Car park in nature provided by Gignac, a tiny village of 60 inhabitants. Super quiet. Toilet in village, 2 minutes. Do not use road access to village from the river as it's only 2m wide at the bridge and between the houses. Very tight!

name: Aire camping car Vigne de l‚Äòest
description: Camping site near the road under pine trees. Camping allowed for 48 hours. Free of charge. Gets quite full in the evening. Next to cycling path. Short cycling distance to town and walk to beach.

name: Above SERS village
description:
Two small grassy parking lot overviewing the valley and the mountains. Fantastic view 
You‚Äôll need a 4x4 , some passes super narrow and steep. Extremely quite place. From there you can hike several trials

name: Between Arinthod and St Julien on D3
description: Nice place on top of the hill but   100 meter of steep gravel road though.... we did it with a small camper, but a 4x4 will do better. Big rigs: don't even try.. Nice view and very quiet.

name: Manses Village Car Park
description: Not exactly wild, but worth mentioning as a very amenable village. The church bells stop ringing between 10pm and 7pm and this tiny place has a car park for four vehicles behind a stunning Cathar church set in natural suroundings and overlooking the village green and hills.  There's a water tap with thread, a BBQ and a immaculate toilet and sink just down by the main road in another car park. Many thanks to the people of Manses.  Please respect this place and use the nearby toilet not the gardens!

name: Toissieu (North Ardeche)
description: Great place on moutain top. You can see the Alps in the east.. Go to the village Tossieu until church, then take a right (small street, big rig might not fit in) drive 80 meters. at the T junction take a right and go 100 meter till you see a parking sign. Plenty of space there and very quiet at night.

name: Aulus Les bains Aire.
description: Aire in natural settings for easy trip into town. Toilet a couple of minutes away.

name: Fort Bertheaume parking
description: Parking lot above Fort Bertheaume. Quiet with 2 other campers on flat concrete platform. Free. Alternative is Aire municipale with all services just 40 up the road for 9 Euro.

name: Next to the sea
description:
(12/2021) Access now has a 2m barrier, which can be swung back but has lights to show that this is just temporary and it will be replaced. So if open and you go through, dont assume that it will be open for your return.
Unofficial parking space right next to the sea. Some fishers in the morning. Dusty ground, no concrete ground.
2m access barrier at the turn from the Avenue du Port

name: Arboretum Car Park

name: Loudervielle Village Car Park

name: Laverne Revolution Hirson

name: Col du Sapet

place still ok but no more Toilette, well i have seen many much cleaner than this one. Wifi very bad. It is slow and you have to renew the code every time you ask something new. It is close to the city.

name: La tonnara

name: font d'hurles

name: Camping Municipal
description:
The Langenwasen municipal campsite in Mittlach is located 3 km upstream from the village. Its land is spread out in a marvelous setting of unspoiled nature, in the very heart of the Ballons des Vosges Regional Natural Park. Renowned for its calm, the campsite is located at the start of many hiking trails. These hikes give access to mountain lakes (Schiessrothried, Altenweiher), to the ridge with its magnificent viewpoints, to farm inns and their traditional meals. 

FRANCAIS
Le camping municipal du Langenwasen √† Mittlach est situ√© √† 3 km en amont du village. Son terrain s‚Äô√©tale dans un cadre merveilleux de nature pr√©serv√©e, au c≈ìur m√™me du Parc Naturel R√©gional des Ballons des Vosges. R√©put√© pour son calme, le camping se situe au d√©part de nombreux sentiers de randonn√©es p√©destres. Ces randonn√©es donnent acc√®s aux lacs de montagne (Schiessrothried, Altenweiher), √† la cr√™te avec ses magnifiques points de vue, aux fermes auberges et leurs repas traditionnels.

name: Car Park Cerstet

next to crestet one of the most beautiful old villages in france

name: Aire municipale de Rocroi

name: A49 Rest Place

name: Roche

name: Camping La Ferme
description:
4 * family campsite located between Lake Annecy and the mountains, in the heart of a Regional Natural Park. 

In a shaded and quiet setting, we offer various FREE activities: 
heated swimming pool, covered and heated paddling pool, solarium, jacuzzi, playground, bouncy castle, multisports ground, fitness area, p√©tanque grounds, ping-pong, loan of books. 

On-site services: bicycle rental, bar and breakfasts, grocery store and fresh bread, laundry, barbecue loan, games room, wellness area (sauna / hammam to be privatized, beauty treatments and massages) 

In July + August: Restaurant, take-away food, entertainment, free shuttles to the beach 

Lake Annecy at 1km, the cycle path at 500m, the proximity of hiking trails and tourist sites will allow you to discover the region in a sporty and fun way while contemplating magnificent landscapes. 

Special discount on our websitesite https://www.campinglaferme.com/fr/hebergement/vanlife-itinerance-roadtrip

name: Lac de Vassiviere
description:
The Broussas peninsula is the second largest beach on the shores of Lake Vassivi√®re. One of its shores is dedicated to supervised swimming during the summer and to sports and water activities. Practice canoeing, pedalo and also paddling, a practice newly arrived in Vassivi√®re. The other bank is the children's corner with its wooden castle and multi-sport field descending to the pontoon access to the water taxi. The beach 'guinguette' is everyone's rendezvous. Sip refreshing drinks from the terrace overlooking the lake while waiting for the evening's entertainment: outdoor cinema? concert? The festive agenda is varied.
....
La presqu‚Äô√Æle de Broussas est la seconde grande plage des rives creusoises du Lac de Vassivi√®re. Une de ses rives est consacr√©e √† la baignade surveill√©e pendant l‚Äô√©t√©* et aux activit√©s sportives et aquatiques. Pratiquez √† loisir le cano√´, le p√©dalo et d√©couvrez aussi le paddle, pratique nouvellement arriv√©e √† Vassivi√®re. L‚Äôautre rive est le coin des enfants avec son ch√¢teau de bois et son terrain multi-sport descendant jusqu‚Äôau ponton d‚Äôacc√®s au bateau-taxi. La guinguette de plage est le rendez-vous de tous. Sirotez des boissons rafraichissantes depuis la terrasse avec vue sur le lac en attendant les animations de la soir√©e : cin√©ma de plein air ? Concert ? L‚Äôagenda festif est vari√© et g√©n√©reux.

name: Lac de Lavaud Gelade
description:
Accessible only to compact vehicles, 4x4.The area at the end of the non-vehicle path allows a nice bivouac at the water's edge but the half turn is a bit complicated with a slope a little steep to start again.

With an area of 300 hectares, Lake Lavaud Gelade is one of the largest lakes in the Creuse after Lake Vassivi√®re. Artificial lake, built in 1943 on the Taurion River, it is located in the Millevaches Regional Natural Park and is classified as Natura 2000. Wilder than Lake Vassivi√®re, this 2nd category lake is a fisherman's paradise.
.....
Accessible seulement au v√©hicules compacts, 4x4 ou tout chemin suivant m√©t√©o.
La zone au bout du chemin non carrossable permet un bivouac sympa au ras de l'eau mais le demi tour est un peu compliqu√© avec une pente un peu raide pour repartir.

D‚Äôune superficie de 300 hectares, le lac de Lavaud Gelade est l‚Äôun des plus grands lacs de la Creuse apr√®s le lac de Vassivi√®re. Lac artificiel, construit en 1943 sur la rivi√®re Taurion, il est situ√© dans le Parc Naturel R√©gional de Millevaches et est class√© zone Natura 2000. Plus sauvage que le lac de Vassivi√®re, ce lac de 2√®me cat√©gorie est le paradis des p√™cheurs.

name: Moulin de Chitr√©
description:
quiet parking by the Viene, near to Chitre windmill

Parking isol√© en bord de Vienne pr√©s du moulin de Chitr√©.

name: Plage de Plougloum.
description:
Parking near the beach.

Parking pr√©s de la plage de Plougoulm et de l'Anse du Guillec. Sentier de randonn√©e √† proximit√©.

name: Vivonne
description: In the centre of town. Can park-up there.

name: Aire de Camping Car
description: Beautiful place near river Seine. Quite and fine.

name: camping a. la ferme. des anes.
description:
camping on a farm 
quite and lots of space
possibility of canoeing and tours with the donkeys

name: Camp watching the Mont Saint Michel
description: Beautiful place along the bike road going to Mont Saint Michel. Not a very well isolated place but quite good according to the places around.

name: Forest and river
description: Great quiet place in the middle of a forest. A river is passing nearby giving the opportunity of a cold but sensational shower.

name: cucuron parking
description:
Parking where you can stay overnight expect on Mondays (local market).
No height restriction.
Toilets with water right next to the parking

name: Lovely Loire
description:
Very nice and quiet spot on the riverside.
Can be a bit muddy on the approach.

name: Chapelle du Templaires
description:
Nice large place with some facilities.
Pit fire place. Benches and picnic tables.
Table tennis, garbage disposal and a little football area.

name: Parking lot - Rhone River
description:
Dramatic view from the mountains and a few meters from the river.
There is a P sign and a lot of space.
Shade. Take a bath at the river. Cold of course.
There is a ramp to unload your boat and kayak.

name: D1075 Highway
description:
There are some little trails on the right side of the highway heading south.
This one is just beside the road in a good place with a view of the French Alps.
A good place to stay for a night.

name: Behind the Cemetery
description:
150 meters from the Citadele-Ruins
Several good places. Flat and grassy.
Great view of the Citadel and mountains.

name: Camping near the VAR River
description:
A nice little spot for 1 or 2 vehicles.
We parked our SUV with rooftent under the trees and made our meal.
Made some hiking around.
At the end of the small road is  established campground, but we camped free just beside the VAR River.

name: Public Parking Lot
description:
There is a public parking lot for Vans and Motor homes.
Just beside a restaurant and the marina.
Nice beach. We camped with our Car and rooftent.

name: Free Camping near the Beach
description:
Plage d'Aiguebelle in a public parking lot.
There is a sign indicating that the place is not for Motorhomes.
But OK for small cars.
We have a SUV with rooftent so we had a very good night here.
Good shadow with trees. Grassy area. You reach the beach crossing the street by a underneath bridge 100 meters.

name: Briere
description: Bivouac in the place for campers. Close the marais.

name: √âtang de Pr√®s Cossin
description: Near access trail to the small dam Many places between dam and trout river fishing allowed with permit. without service except Internet ans cell phone

name: Near Road
description: Coming from La Palud-sur-Verdon, take a track on the left after approx 2km. This track (which is basically a walking trail but easy by car) divides in 2 tracks, take the one on the right and continue 100m. Plenty spaces to stay but very little shade because no high trees around. Very quiet for the night.

name: Balbuzard Domain
description:
There is a water tap at the edge of the Domain of Balbuzard.
It is located next to the tipi. if you only want to fill water bottle it will be ok. For other uses, please ask the owner first.

name: La Goutelle Cemetary
description:
Left to the main entrance of the Church.
Only to refill water bottle.
Please be kind and respectful to the place and for the people

name: Bel-iscle √†  Saint Paul sur Ubaye
description:
Camping in the middle of nature. very wooded on the banks of the Ubaye. Easy access for any type of motorbike, big camper. A common room available with tables, books, maps of the region. Very clean sanitary facilities, hot showers with coat racks, thermostatic faucets, water points throughout the campsite. Very friendly welcome. 1 tent, people and 2 motorcycles 12 ‚Ç¨. Wifi and grocery store in the village 5 minutes walk.
.....
Camping en pleine nature tr√®s arbor√© au bord de l'Ubaye. Acc√®s facile tout type de moto, gros camping car. Une salle commune √† disposition avec tables, livres, cartes de la r√©gion. Sanitaires tr√®s propres, douches chaudes avec porte manteaux, robinets thermostatiques, points d'eau partout dans le camping. Accueil tr√®s sympathique. 1 tente, personnes et 2 motos 12‚Ç¨. Wifi et √©picerie dans le village √† 5 minutes √† pied.

name: Lachamps Cemetery
description:
Inside the cemetery, on the right at the entrance.
Only to use to quickly fill water bottle (I used it to fill bottle during a bikepacking).
If you use it, please be respectful of the place and of the people there.

name: peaceful grass spot
description:
large grass spot with 2 picnic tables just near a small river.
even has a roof sheltered area if needed.
nearby road very peaceful, no problems, even on weekends. 
highly recommended

name: Aire de Bivouac
description:
Nice plateau next to babbling brook.  The zone is attached to nearby hiking refuge.  The zone is separated into 2 parts, one for the autonomous camping cars and one for tents - notably the hikers of the GR10.  Car campers can pitch a tent, but parking is next to the refuge so carrying gear down to the tenting area is required.

Cows and cowbells pass...so may interrupt sleepers, but for some ambiance.

The camping is free. In the unmanned refuge are toilet and hot showers.  Food can be had in the 2 nearby Restaurants.

name: Plage - Beach Jai
description:
Plage-Beach Jai
A big public place. Free. Flat and just 10 meters from the beach.
Quiet and clean. Little shade.
Nice to sleep and stay for 2 or 3 days.

name: Sainte Maries de la Mer
description:
You come to the Sainte Maries de la Mer village and take a right.
Go till the end of the road, passing some established campgrounds.
Then you arrive a large parking lot where is a sign saying not recommended for Motorhomes.
But we stayed here and the police came by and didn't say anything.
There were also 4 or 5 other Motorhomes here already.
Very good night, near the beach.
Many fisherman come passing by to fish on the rooks of the Rh√¥ne River.
At this place you can book a little trip along the Rh√¥ne River.

name: Le Poujol S/Orb
description:
Coming to the little city near the river there is a public parking lot. Free.
150 meters from the River where you can take a good bath.
There is potable water some meters ahead in the public park just 50 meters from here in front of the school.
We camped with our rooftent.

name: Public Camping
description:
Nice place just beside the road. Free.
Big lake to fish.
Dumping station and potable water
Lac Gimont is a place for campers, vans and Motorhomes.
You can stay as long as you want.

name: Near Clarence
description:
Nice spot under the trees. On the right side of the road heading towards Tarbes.
Quiet and flat with very good shade and a view of the mountains.

name: Near Les Chalets de L'Ossau
description:
Nice and flat spot to stay and camp.
Just beside the road.
On the opposite side of the road you can stay on the parking lot.
This place is grassy and has a picnic table and a bench.
Dramatic view of the mountains. Very quiet at night.

name: Center of Saint J Pied d Port
description:
A big parking lot for cars and vans.
Also little Motorhomes can enter, but you enter using a small road at the right side of the main entrance.
You can open the barrier that is not locked. It was suggested that we leave our car here while we make our 35 day walk to Santiago de Compostela.
We gave our license plate number to the Gerdarmerie and they said this is the place to park and leave the cars.
There is potable water 50 meters from here in the Toilette just right down the street.
Restaurants and bars 1 minute from here and 5 minutes to the historic center.
Perfect. Free.

name: Camping de Peridundellu
description: Nice camping with friendly hosts. I arrived late and still could have the 3 course dinner at 9 pm (14.5‚Ç¨). Price motorbike friendly as you don't have to pay extra for the bike. 5 ‚Ç¨ per person plus 2.50 ‚Ç¨ for the tent plus a small city tax.

name: Hostens
description: Nice wild spot with camping tables, shade and lakes nearby. No facilities

name: On the banks of the Loire
description: Grassy space right next to the Loire, just outside Saint-Dye-Sur-Loire. Flat grounds.

name: Croix de la lib√©ration
description: Monument in the forest. Departure of descent for mountain biking (people on weekends) Possibility to stay for the night (respect the environment, no wild toilet please). Very good 4G connection (antenna within 300 meters). The view in the morning is exceptional and if you are lucky you could admire a sea of clouds covers the plains.

name: Above Travassac
description: Quiet place above Travassac (11mins from highway exit). Multiple level place (natural parking). We stayed at the top (the largest). There were other two vans and one tent with us.

name: Near Le Villard
description: Organized Campsite (5 euros or 6 euros with shower) near river

name: Camping Kathy and Dave
description: Super sweet campground with lovely owners.

name: Geneva
description:
Small parking near the road but quiet. Possible to camp in the forest or surrounding fields. Ideal for a van and a magnificent view of Geneva!

Petit parking pr√®s de la route mais calme. Possibilit√© de camper dans la for√™t ou les champs autour. Id√©al pour les van, tranquil et magnifique vue sur Geneve !

name: Hostellerie du Randonneur
description: Super Hotel, we were here with the Motorbike.

name: malleval
description:
Calm and nice view around wine fields.
Only for small campers.
Water in cemetery.

name: chantelot
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Wild camping in France is in general prohibited. Due check local regulations.

Near the canal, at the end of a small road. Easy excess.

name: Parking source de Gornies
description: Quiet place to park for night near the road to Ferri√®res les verreries

name: Ferri√®res les verreries
description: Just water on a lovely village nothing else

name: les √©chelles center
description: place for stationnary and fill water potable

name: Etang a Pouanc√©
description:
√Ä nice area just aside a small lake. 
There are 4/5 spots at least. Could be a little bit noisy due to the highway. And many frogs at night

name: Parking Le Markstein
description: Large parking, a lot of camping cars come in at night, but it‚Äôs rather quiet. It‚Äôs said that there are toilets and a water point (near a mini-golf) but we didn‚Äôt find them.

name: Camping La Saousse - Air Naturelle
description: Nice quiet small campsite with large spots friendly owner terraces with large spots, amenities.  Dated but clean. One night two people was only 17,50 euro.

name: Le Bois
description: Walk 300m to the top of the forest road (dead end sign). Campsite is on top. Safe and very quiet, in the woods.

name: Pond - Lake
description: Grassy place near a small lake. Picnic tables.

name: Collobri√®res
description: At the entrance of the village, next to the road, there is a flat space that is mainly used by camper vans but also by tent pitchers.  There is shadow, not crowded and can be used for 1 or more nights.  The village is also very beautiful.

name: Lac de Charpal
description: Beautiful spot. Can be cool (altitude 1300m)

name: Lac Carpal barrage
description: Parking for RVs and camping cars. Nice spot. Cold in winter.

name: saint sixte
description:
wild camping in forest.
clean and wonderful.
please respect this clean place.
good place to running trail or outdoor activity

name: Le Paquis
description:
Very nice camping, quiet exept some trains, direct on the river Mosel and just 15 km outside Metz. Open from may 1st until September 15th. 
Campervan for two with electricity 20 EUR the night. Free spots to choose and lots of trees for a shadow place. Friendly staff. You can order bread and there is a snack restaurant in the evening (burgers and co).

name: loze
description: Very quiet good for all v√©hicule on the side of lake

name: Camping Ribiera
description:
Simple, verry clean and quiet camping place next to a nice mountainriver.
Free showers(warm) and lots of shady campingspots (not always ideal if you relay on solar)
No shop or toiletdump, but closest of all campings to the centre of Quillestre, free slow wifi at reception and not on the big road like the other campings who are also bigger and more crowdy.

Water from tap was ok√© to drink we think, although our neighbour told is it was better to use bottlewater for drinking 
For repairs on car there is a good and garage close by called Garage du Guillestrois. The reseptionist speaks verly good English.

name: Les Isclasses
description:
Garage Du Guillestrois

At arrival the mechanic was helpful and looked at our jeepcamper straightaway, saw the problem in our springs and made a accurate and fair (checked with price back home) estamate of parts. 
Although they were eventually not able to repair our bend leafsprings because they appeared to be specially build and not stock as we thought, they refunded us in full our advance and appologized for not being able to help. 
Receptionist spoke good enough English and was friendly.

name: Seaside informal campsite
description: With a beautiful view on the Atlantic, beach and restaurants close by. Calm at night on our stay

name: Big parking in between river Durance and small lake.
description:
Out of the way parking in natural environment. Exellent for fishing! Special wheelchair fishingplateau. No facilities but fairly easy to reach and quiet. Lots of space and possibilites for shade or sun
On entry you have to get between two fences, not alle trucks will fit, that‚Äôs why description says no big rigs, got nothing to do with hight!

name: Saint Laurent du Pont Tourbieres
description: St Laurent du Pont. Supermarket near this place, Hiking all around.

name: Camping Domaine des Poteries
description: Small campsite with mostly more permanent mobile homes. They welcomed us and provided us with a plot for the night. Does have electric but we didn‚Äôt need it. Pitch quite private if you‚Äôre looking for somewhere to chill for the night. Small bar on site. Shower, toilet and washing up area available and are in great condition and are included in the pitch cost. Cost of pitch for one night was ‚Ç¨13.5

name: Camping des dunes
description: Large family lively campsite on the coast. Bar and entertainment onsite. A few minutes walk to the dunes and the beach of the Channel. Pet friendly. ‚Ç¨26 a night without electric but the best site close to Calais and Dunkirk, about 10 miles from each.

name: Frog lake: Etang de Souches
description:
Camping spot best for cyclists and hikers, next to a (closed) refuge with beautiful view at a small lake. 
You can sleep dry on the porch of the refuge.
Accessible by car by a two track path, till the road barrier, about 30m before the spot. Not suited for big rigs.

name: Des Pins
description: Big Parkng space, also for big rigs, as a few meters from the road very quiet. No infrastructure but picknick tables. Perfect spot to start a stroll through the F√¥ret Domaniale de Verzy with its very special trees. We did not spend the night, but no sign for no parking around.

name: serrieres sur ain  leclos
description: New parking with toilets and garbage bin.boat rent nearby. I spent one night with no problem.

name: au bon accueil
description: Nice hotel. fair deal. awesome attendance. nice and peaceful. parking for big rigs and bikes. lots of places to explore around. paid 50 bucks for a single with breakfast. they grow their own veggies and have their own fresh water. zero network and bad wifi.

name: Le Mont Olympe
description: Terrain near the Meuse river on walking distance from town. Large grassy sites separated by hedges. Ablutions are ok, but not exceptional. Dish washing facilities. Free (town) wifi throughout the campground. Fee EUR 18.50 (2 adults, car, tent). Every site has own electricity and tap. Washing machines are available. Pets are allowed and a sanitation dump station is provided.

name: Wild camp
description:
Really nice to spend one night here, under trees, calm and plate.
Recommended

name: donjon de pechon
description:
FOC "into the wild" camping next to the donjon de p√©chon, a medieval defense tower, in the middle of unspoiled nature

limited (2m50 width 3m height) access to the parking area via a 400 meter drive on an unpaved road next to the mailbox with number 1438 

picnic area available 

wide view on the valley 

presence of 2 female dogs

hiking and mountain biking trail in front of building, sightseeing of donjon

name: lack
description: a very beautiful wild camping place Al just 10 m of the road drive down no roster no facilities only beautiful scenery and a very nice swimming pool

name: Delestrez
description: A huge variety of parts, very helpful staff. They ordered the missing part for the next day. We can recommend this place.

name: Noyant
description: Free parking 24 hours. Special  space for campers. Flat. Dump. For water tickets are available at the bakery.

name: Parking for the night
description:
A side road in the beautiful area of Rivery, about 25 min walk to the city center. The part for big campers has a parking prohibition sign between 7.45 am and 7 pm, but we saw some campers staying the night. Plenty of parkings for normal size vans. Not very noisy but also not absolutely quiet.
Close to the street with beautiful channel houses. Good for one night and to discover Amiens.

name: Camping Bilo
description:
Nice little campsite with clean facilities. 
We paid 25‚Ç¨ for car with rooftop tents and 5 persons.
Playground for the kids and very quiet at night.

name: La Calanque
description: Terrain in a park like environment with lots of trees. Lake across the access road. 2 adults, tent, electricity EUR 18.50 (2 adults, car, tent, electricity). Ablutions are ok. Sanitation dump station.

name: Val Vert en Berry
description: 4-star rated campground. Large, grassy sites separated by hedges. Most sites share a shady tree. Well maintained ablutions. Reasonably sized swimming pool. WiFi near reception. Good 4G. EUR 26.50 (2 adults, tent, car, electricity). Washing machine. Dish washing facility.

name: Camping de la Castillonderie
description: Three star rated campground with large, grassy sites surrounded by trees targeting young families. Plenty, well maintained ablutions, but quite far from most sites. Swimming pool, children's playgrounds. Washing machines, dish washing facilities. Restaurant serving pizzas, burgers, etc. Also cottages for rent. Animation program. Friendly, helpful staff. EUR 37 per night (2 adults, car, tent, electricity). WiFi is slow and often interrupted. Ample opportunities for walks starting from the campground.

name: Parking lot
description:
3 large spaces. With picnic bench. Near a Crossroads.
No amenities.

name: Castellane route de digne
description: Nice gassy place for one. 6,50‚Ç¨. spacious places. not like a normal camping place.

name: Comps-sur-Artuby
description: A place to stay officially for the night on gravel with shade. Free campsite.

name: Sani dump camp site
description: Dumping clean Water 5‚Ç¨  campsite Right the way

name: Site for campingcars
description:
Nice campsite at the harbor, also for big rigs. Electricity and drinking water at the site, clean sanitary facilities. Office (Bureau du port) is open 8.30-12am and 3-7pm. We paid EUR 12.40 for two adults and a small camper van, all included.
About 50 min walk to the city center but a shopping mall close by with plenty of restaurants.

name: La prairie de Galuchet
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

Owner of a large field with Lake, I offer parking in the middle of nature, by the Lakeside.

---

Propri√©taire d'un grand terrain avec lac, je vous propose de stationner en pleine nature au bord du lac .

name: Camping du lac
description: Very quiet place right next to the lake. Paid 22 Euro for 2 persons and camping car.Great to dip in the water, clean facilities, warm shower.

name: Parking Labouheyre
description:
Parking with pick-nick tables and drinkable water but you can not enter if your vehicle is higher than 1'90 m (caravans, high roofs, camper vans such as the ford transit one will not pass through)

We have slept here and it is comfortable but the street lamps have stayed on all night long

P.S: It is not visible on Google Maps because it is quite new, it is next to the tennis courts

name: Lake
description:
Beautiful lake near the highway, not difficult to find, pretty good to camp with any type of vehicle or tent. 

No potable water, toilets or shower.

name: Le Pont de Lunel
description: Two star rated community campground with rather small pebble sites; many trees. On most sites are permanent cottages of locals. Dated ablutions. Although the place is cramped between some major roads it is surprisingly quiet. Washing machine and dish washing facilities, but no dryer. EUR 20 per night (2 adults, tent, car, power). Slow WiFi. Bar, but no restaurant.

name: Parking Lot. Etang de Beauchamp
description: Big parking lot, private and without too much noise. Quiet place to stay a couple of nights, 5 minutes away walking from the nearest tramway stop and then 15 minutes away from downtown using the public transport

name: Parking lot
description: Big parking lot, very quiet and private. 5 minutes away from the nearest tramway station and then 15 minutes away from downtown using the public transport.

name: Gordes
description: Quiet, large parking lot 2km above Gordes. Stayed there with 6 other campers with great view over the plains.

name: Beach parking
description:
Parking near the lake beach. You cannot enter if your vehicle is higher than 2 m. We spent the night here with some other vanlifers. There are public toilets, trees that give you some privacy and camping tables. 

Pretty cool if I say so myself.

name: wild camping
description: nice place near to a dirt road. there's a clearing where to park with views.

name: Lac du Vieux Pr√©
description: The are several parking spots not far from the road that leads to the barrage of the lake. The are even picnic tables next to the parking spots. You can go down to the lake in 5 minutes and there you can walk all around the lake. Really beautiful and calm.

name: Riverside gravel road dead end
description:
there is a small paved road that splits off from the main road. From this paved road there are multiple gravel roads that go towards the river. could be difficult with large camper. 
the spot we stayed had clear signs that people had stayed there before. we stayed in a tent. A van also pulled up in the same area.
calm and beautiful spot.
keep it clean

name: P√©gomas
description: Three star rated campground with relatively small sites separated by hedges. Adequate, well maintained ablutions. Nice swimming pool. Ten minutes walking distance from town centre. Washing machines and dryers, dish washing facilities. Good 4G. 10 minutes to slow, free WiFi per day, paid if you need more. About EUR 34 per night (2 adults, tent, car, power). The place has no restaurant, but it does have a bar and in high season a food truck is present.

name: St Omer de Blain/Canal
description:
Quiet place with toilets and potable water. Four picnics tables. 
Access possible for car or van.

name: lac plage Espinet
description: Nice place nearby the lake beach, established camp park 500m from this place.

name: Camping a l'ombre des oliviers
description: camping ground good for tents, motor vans, etc.  We stayed there two nights after a week offroad and wild camping to clean up.

name: wild camping paradise
description: Nice and numerous spots all over the mountain top.

name: Aire d‚Äôaccueil plateau de la Coche
description:
A spot set up by the municipality with several picnic tables, pitfires, a barbecue, dry toilets and a drinking water point.
Full in summer but relatively quiet.
Tents and vans are welcome. tents are better  pitched after the water point, the view is breathtaking.

name: levignacq
description:
We spent one night in a motorhome in the small parking lot just after the church (water, WC, emptying cassette), picnic area.  Small village grocery store, bakery and caterer at very affordable prices
 Thanks to the municipality.
 We recommend.
Stay discreet and clean.

name: Quiet mountains & vineyards
description:
If you're feeling a little adventurous. For cars, a 4x4 is advised. Rough road. Beautiful, silent place, on top of the hills and in the middle of a fairytale forest. You bother absolutely no one here. Enjoy!
Directions: enter from the northside without permission (D973, Auxey-Duresses), or from southside with permission (D906, Gamay).
Leave no trace!

name: Lakeside
description:
Right on Lac de Panthier, away from the busy beaches, is a mint-filled piece of land where you can easily camp for the night. Beautiful and tranquil. Best of all, no mosquitoes!
Directions: this is just in front of the house at the little bridge (you can't miss it). Between two trees just across the road from the house, there is a small inlet leading to the waterfront.
Leave no trace!

name: Tour de batere
description:
At the foot of the batere tower. Superb view of the Roussillon plain
.....
Aux pieds de la tour de batere. Superbe vue sur la plaine du Roussillon

name: Canoe entry/exit
description: Big parking lot next to the river Guil. Used for entering/ exiting canoes, kayaks or rafts. Spacious. Stayed there with 3 other campers. About 100m away from road, so river is loader than road.

name: Loisireo
description:
Camping car and accessories seller.
Work shop. They may help you, if you are in trouble.

name: Domaine Le Poteau
description: This lovely campsite is owned by the Scottish couple Fiona and Alasdair, who give their guests a warm welcome as soon as you arrive. Beside the more traditional small campsite there are also a few grassy spots at a lower/separate area which gave us the feeling of having our own wildcamp spot. A perfect place to relax in nature. For the price details and other information see the website https://le-poteau.com/

name: Valley camping next to river
description: Quiet spot next to a stream for camping. Hiking and biking activities nearby. Minimal traffic noise from nearby road.

name: Lac Pierre Perc√©e
description:
Picknick Area with access to the beautiful Lake. Might be busy with locals on weekends.
No facilities.

name: Tentes
description: Wild high mountain site, little water in summer, beneath ski lifts.

name: Riverside wild camping
description: Lots of spots on a road that runs partaken to the river on the opposite side of the main road through the mountains. You can hear the river and there are trees so there isn‚Äôt much traffic noise. Some fire pits. Nice spot close to valloire.

name: Parking de Montcuq
description:
This is a car park/caravan park on the outskirts of Montcuq. 
It is not beautiful but there is a drinking water point for campervans, plenty of space and it is free!

name: Chemin du Mulin
description: A nice quiet place next to the River Doubs.

name: Gravel spot next to the lake
description:
There's a gravel area next to the lake at the end of the official parking area of the beach. 2,20m clearance at the entrance, so only for smaller vehicles. Toilets nearby open 24/7.
Stayed one night and wasn't bothered, but people come early to put their boats into the lake.

name: Camping Chez Gendron
description: Nice, quiet and green Campground, lots of trees with schade, gravel and grass underground, inexpensive, local Bread Service, off the beaten track, little pool and restaurant. Good with kids.

name: Parking next to the Gironde
description:
This is a quiet place but you won't be alone. There are some fishermen huts. Fishermen come early in the morning.
Parking is right next to the Gironde, so you can see water from your van.
spots for a couple of vans and some people even slept in their tents.

name: Near D218
description:
Good place to stay with natural water, fire pit and BBQ,
Negative point: no view on the mountains.

name: Parking next to the beach in the forest
description:
From this place, you can see the ocean if you get a spot in the first row.
shaded by pine trees.
public toilets 24/7.
To get to the lowest level, height is restricted to 1.9m. Higher up, there's a dedicated parking spot for larger camping cars. Difficult to level. 
3km south of Dune Du Pilat, so less than an hour walk on the beach.

name: Parking off the road next to vineyard
description: Typical road side parking with pick nick tables. Next to a vineyard. Road isn't busy at night so good to spent one night.

name: plage bonaparte
description: very nice place on the kliffs, no restrictions,no service

name: Le Semaphore Lookout
description: Very nice place,overlooking the sea,for 2 or 3 Camper!

name: near dune the keremma...
description: nice place,quiet,for 10 campervans,also big rigsfriendly...

name: Semaphore de Pointe Bilou
description: very nice place to stay! seaview! very quiet because end of the road! for 4 or 5 campers!

name: Pors Matheano beach...
description: nice place to stay. great view over the ocean. place for 4 to 7 campers...

name: near Saint Pabu...
description: Top Favorite! very nice and quite place to stay! stunning oceonview! acsess to the beach! for 4 to 8 campers,little uneven... no toilet!

name: Plage de Corsen
description: Top Favorite! very nice and quite place to stay! great oceanview! acsess to a stunning beach! litte uneven! for 3 or 5 campers! with public toilet and water!

name: Saint Mathieu
description: Top Favorite! very nice place to stay! stunning view over the ocean! litte bit uneven! place for 3 to 5 camper! no toilet!

name: Loire...
description: nice place to stay. lot of space. party on the weekend...

name: Florac
description: parking lot by the river.. nice spot to spend the day.toilet available. great time with our little fleur Lila

name: Sainte Enimie
description:
Very nice spot to spend the day during summer or to stay over night off season. Cool restaurant in front and an amazing view from the parking area.

Nice time with our little fleur de printemp "lila"

name: Les Rospects
description: Grassy parking lot away from the road. Plenty of grassy space down the path to pitch a tent with great views on the sea.

name: Ciry-le-Noble
description: Recreational area/parking area, next to the Canal du Centre. opposite the village. beautiful open rural space with hardly any houses in sight. Rows of huge trees with a crow-colony. picnic tables;  clean, brand new norwegian dry-toilet, (drink?) water. I know, in France it isn't difficult to find nice overnight aspots, but this one was too good not to mention.

name: Verneuil-sur-seine. Quaie de Seine.
description: Half overgrown former industrial area with a few old riverboats waiting for demolition. sounds dismal, charming nevertheless. grand view of the river. not many reasonable spots in this area.

name: Mericourt. recreation area, on the seine.
description: Large nice recreation area with tables, table tennis, grass and hard plots. and a tree nearby. beautiful, free.

name: Rouen. Belbeuf
description: Large leftover area on the river Seine, next to the rowing club. although the road is partly visible, it is actually a nice spot. free.

name: Pompiers de Pont Bal
description: Pompiers de Pont Bal. acceuil de camping car. free spot where you can find drinkable water and empty the "thunderbox" (waste tanks). in front of the fire brigade.

name: Annevile-sur-mer
description: Perfect small spot behind the dunes. huge beach with rows and rows of mussel-poles. not for big rigs, just cars and vans. complicated road, somewhat hair-raising at times. no 4x4 needed.

name: Baie Camping Car
description:
Authorized Camping Car area, on the outskirts (10 min by car) of Concarneau. Without services, next to Del Mar. Very quiet and beautiful.
---
√Årea de Camping Car autorizada, a las afueras (10 min en coche) de Concarneau. Sin servicios, al lado Del Mar. Muy tranquila y bonita.

name: Ferme
description: Parking lot inside a ‚Äúferme‚Äù (farm). The owner let us sleep in the parking lot of the farm.

name: Rouffiac near the Charente river
description: Nice wild camp and free. Near the river Charente. WC Shower (ask for keys at clapoti restaurant) Free. Restaurant les clapotis 15june 15september open. Calm and quiet ! Nice

description: Big Place for parking near the sea. Open 8.pm to 8.AM. free for car. max 2.2 x 2.2 m. Office hours 8.AM - 8. P.M. name: col de bales
description:
Wilderness camping in the countryside with cows as the only neighbor.  
---
Camping sauvage pleine nature avec les vaches comme seul voisin.

name: Aire de camping car
description:
In the heart of the Sea, C√©vennes and Provence triangle, Castillon du Gard is a peaceful and charming medieval village overlooking the Gardon valley. Located 4km from the Pont du Gard, its central location allows you to shine on the cities of Avignon, N√Æmes, Arles and Al√®s. The town has a rich architectural heritage, its alleys are suitable for walking to admire the buildings testifying to the importance of the city over the centuries. Possibility of going by coach to NIMES - ALES - PONT ST ESPRIT via the grand duchy of Uzes for its market OR even to Avignon, the Festival & the city of the Popes Lines 115 or 121 from the area (Maison family) or VTC service The motorhome area is set up on a 2400m2 site offering 19 pitches including a special heavy vehicle pitch (18 places in 8m max + 1 place 12m) The places are separated by hedges of Rosemary which deliciously perfume the atmosphere. Access to the area is controlled by a 24-hour reception machine allowing you to enter and leave the area at your ease, while ensuring you a place on your return. Many services are at your disposal for your comfort and your safety: 19 electrical outlets of 16A, a terminal for emptying and filling water and video surveillance. To be sure of finding an available location, you can book your stay online before your departure.
 
En plein c≈ìur du triangle Mer, C√©vennes et Provence, Castillon du Gard est un village m√©di√©val paisible et plein de charme qui surplombe la vall√©e du Gardon.
Situ√© √† 4km du Pont du Gard, sa situation centrale permet de rayonner sur les villes d'Avignon, N√Æmes, Arles et Al√®s.
La commune est dot√©e d‚Äôun riche patrimoine architectural, ses ruelles sont propices √† la promenade pour admirer les √©difices t√©moignant de l'importance de la cit√© au fil des si√®cles.
Possibilit√© de se rendre en autocar jusque NIMES - ALES - PONT ST ESPRIT via le grand duch√© d'Uzes pour son march√© OU m√™me jusqu'en Avignon, le Festival & la cit√© des Papes 
Lignes 115 ou 121 au d√©part de l'aire (Maison familiale) ou service de VTC 


L'aire de camping-cars est am√©nag√©e sur un terrain de 2400m2 proposant 19 emplacements dont un emplacement sp√©cial poids-lourd (18 places en 8m maxi + 1 place 12m)
Les places sont s√©par√©es par des haies de Romarin qui parfument d√©licieusement l'atmosph√®re.
L‚Äôacc√®s √† l‚Äôaire est pilot√©e par un automate d‚Äôaccueil 24/24h permettant de rentrer et sortir de l‚Äôaire √† votre aise, tout en vous assurant une place √† votre retour.

De nombreux services sont √† votre disposition pour votre confort et votre s√©curit√© : 19 prises √©lectriques de 16A , une borne de vidange et de remplissage d'eau et la vid√©o surveillance.

Pour √™tre certain de trouver un emplacement disponible,  vous avez la possibilit√© de r√©server votre s√©jour en ligne avant votre d√©part.

name: Arc en Barrois, Chaumont
description:
Small site, ideal stopover, quiet now in mid September but possibly busy in main seasons. Great little town, small but clean utility block with toilets and shower.
‚Ç¨14 for van and 2 people.
Great walking in nearby forests and nearby stream on site to cool the dog.
A great little find.

name: Roadside place in forest
description: On both sides of the road, there are dirt roads, ok for a motorbike or bicycle, not sure about a car. A sunny location, lots of birds singing in the morning, when I was passing it.

name: BP Station - free WiFi and showers
description: Fuelling station, with cafes, free showers, toilets and WiFi.

name: Saint Paul de Fenoullet
description: Simple campsite with everything you need. Screened sites with plenty of shade. Right in the middle of the Cathar region and perfect for excursions. The owner speaks English.

name: Avic petrol station
description: Apart from petrol, there are usual treats - small shop, toilets - and a shower, door is open, seems to be free

name: Uhaitza le Saison
description: Just before the mountains, nice camping site

name: Hippodrome d'Auteuil
description: Parking at a park and horse race arena. some coming and going during the night but generally a nice place close to the city. might be worth to check if there's an event going on at the Hippodrome cause then the parking lot is fuller.

name: Saint Coulomb

Overnight at the public parking lot.
Flat and with a wonderful view from the island and the Le Fort du Guesclin just in front.
Nice beach with the low tide. 
No camping with tents allowed, but OK for vans, rooftent and campers.
There is a hight limit to enter the parking lot. 2,20m.
Keep this nice place clean.

description:
Nice parking lot with separated bays.
Flat and wind protected. Near the beach and many hiking routes.
There is a little sandwich shop that probably works only in summer time.
Pit toilets available.

name: Plage Near Port Racine
description:
Continue the small road more 4 km. You will arrive a gravel road parallel to the beach.
Wonderful and quiet place to sleep and rest.
There are several spots to stay.
Not good for big rigs. Campers, vans and 4x4with rooftent, perfect.

name: Parking de Nantouar
description:
Small parking closed to the sea, really quiet.
Good place for a 4x4 or van.

name: Valliere Cemetery
description:
Valliere cemetery with a potable water robinet.
Only to fill water bottle.
Please be respectful of the location and people that might be there

name: Camping Fief Angibaud
description: Informal sites, water and power if needed. great facilities. Friendly owner. Close to nature. No pool or gimmicks. just nature and the beautiful French countryside.

name: Next to the Church
description:
Small restroom with an outside water supply.
Good for filling water bottle.

name: Fred-Neuville
description:
Great camping area next to the river in a small village. Parking for up to 10 motorhomes or truck campers. No height restriction, some shade and some sunny spots. Bin provided and a baguette vending machine but no water or waste disposal that I saw. 
Really good Super U market 3 klm away on main road. 
I had a great peaceful night here.

name: V√©lo-route 93 Ch√©rign√©
description:
Lunch site along the v√©lo-route 93.
Two points of water.
Good for cycling or small vehicle.

name: water and toilet
description: clean place in front of the school. free water well, clean toilets

name: next to lake
description: Nice little gravel spot next to a small road next to the lake. Very quiet (oktober) but it might be busier in summer season.

name: Free dumping and water
description: free dumping and fresh water. you will need a hose.

name: Mauressargues
description: Little sideroad on the D123 near Mauressargues. Goes on between the vineyards, very flat and lots of small side places without disturbing the vineyards. Perfect for an overnight stay with camper type. We've met the owner, nice guy. Don't leave trash!

name: Marvejol, free dump station
description: Free and nice, black waters OK, toilets, free parking and water included.

name: place de la Fontaine
description: Very quiet square in Bedoues village, fountains around, no amenity. Free parking.

name: Camping Le Manoir de l' Abbaye
description:
Brilliant campsite behind an old farmhouse. Three fields separated by high walls. Nicely protected area from the weather by large tree rows (had a thunderstorm, my tent hardly moved). 

Away from the hubbub of the nearby beaches and sites and away from the main roads. Really quiet at night. But still close enough for the daily exploration of the surroundings.

Plenty of space, also for bigger rigs. Getting in there might be a bit narrow but should work. 

Showers and toilettes are in the old barn. Good showers!! Really hot.

Wifi on the field

Real gem.

I paid ‚Ç¨10 for a night (1 person, motorbike and tent).

name: free spot in pretty Chamberet
description: Amazing spot free of charge, looking like a camping in a park, with 5 spaces + more outside the park. Very quiet, free electricity, water and a toilet (closed in winter). Minutes walk from bakery, supermarket and more.

name: Plage du Porteau
description: Beautiful bay and golden sand beach with a parking where campers are tolerated. Top notch!

name: Chateaubourg
description: Nice spot near vineyards with wonderful view of the Rhone

name: H√¥tel parking near Mt Saint Michel
description: Large parking reserved for clients. But it looks like the hotel is only open in summer, making it a nice spot rest of the year. We were there in October 2021. There are otherwise official, free parking slots in the lane adjacent to the parking (other side of the hotel.)

name: Lac du Mas Chaban
description:
Nice view of the lake. Easily accessible. a few fishermen keep us company.
.....
jolie vue sur le lac accessible facilement. quelques p√™cheurs nous tiennent compagnie.

name: Free sleeping at Anse du Poulet
description:

There are tables and benches on the road level and some tables on the superior level.

name: Plage Juno

Only for small vehicles. Campers, vans and other car not taller than 2,1 meters. There is a hight limitation in the parking entrance. If your vehicle is higher than this, go ahead and you can park on the street also for free.
Keep the place clean.

name: Concarneau
description:
A small cc park. About 10 sites. toilets dump a little bit sloping. 6‚Ç¨ between 1 April to 30 of September. Free others months.
Very nice paths to walk to have a pretty view of the old city of Concarneau.

name: Big gravel place

Am√©lie will offer you the wine with enthusiasm. Open only in the morning untill 13.00. Very close to the nice village Fourn√®s. Also close to the highway if you are in transit or close to the "Pont du Gard".

name: Serraval South on D12
description: Big parking space outside the road, shade and river‚Äôs song.

name: Mt Ventoux
description: Along the road to the summit, many parking lot where it is possible to stay for the night.

name: In the Alpilles mountains
description: Very quiet spaces in the forest, for small unit.

name: Les Clapar√®des
description: Huge parking lot with shade where it is possible to sleep.
