name: beautiful ocean view
description:
beautiful ocean view.
4wd is a must or you crazy as i and go full speed with rear wheel drive through the water, that's even passible.

name: Le Coudon
description: This is an exceptional spot, beautiful viewpoint and climbing area of  Mont Coudon. We parked here for one night, for longer stays there is a welcoming individual living further up the street. Park4night Pro offers the telefone number and email address. Please take your garbage with you.

name: on a meadow in the forests
description: At the end of a dirt road, in the forests on a sunny meadow. quiet place surrounded by nature. accessible for middle campingcars. your car needs some ground clearance.

name: Waterfountain by the road
description: Drinkable water fountain by the road to fill up your reserves and prevent plastic bottels.

name: Aire Naturelle de Camping ‚Äì LE CLOS VERT
description:
Small campground of 9 large spots. It's open from mid April until mid October. 
There is no reception, you show up and take a free spot. In the evening or the next morning someone from the city will collect the camp fees.
The site offers toilets, cold and hot water, showers, picnic tables.
There is a small shop, bar & restaurant nearby.

name: Vallabreques
description:
gravel
trees
lots of space
good entry
we parked here with our 40 ft bus
along the Rh√¥ne next to a leisure area and a small harbour

name: Quiet camping in farmland
description: Nice camp spot - only accessible by 4x4. Takes a steep hill to get up, path towards spot can be very muddy. Spot is on unused farmland, lots of flowers and great views.

name: Domaine du Lac
description:
Open all year. 40 places by the lake. 12 euros for 2 people and tax. cces to the beach is free in July and August.
.....
Ouvert toute l'ann√©e
40 emplacements face au lac
12,00 ‚Ç¨ par emplacement pour 2 personnes + taxe de s√©jour
Acc√®s √† la plage gratuitement en juillet et ao√ªt.

name: Parking Plage du Bill
description: Parking closed to the beach Bill. Nice place.

name: Camping des cigales
description: Nice camping, possible take shower for 1/2‚Ç¨

name: Gron Aire de Camping Car
description: This is one of the many local community run motorhome camping sites in France.   And this over is free!  Water and dump available March 15th to November 15th but when we were here at least bathroom was working.  About 15 parking spots.  There's a small trail about 500 m long into town to shops.  Okay cell signal.  Very quiet.  Our camper is 6.6m long and got okay.  much longer could be tight.

name: EuroCamping Cars
description: This place sells new and used and repairs motorhomes.  We bought a used one.  We are not European residents so they helped us get in touch with some accountants that set up a 'civil societe' to own the vehicle using this address. This is however not a fast process.  They also have vehicle storage for both indoor and outdoor long term storage.  There is also a parts department but the prices are not low.

name: Cassis parking
description: Parking for about 15 vehicles, no height limit but places are rather short (our sprinter just fit). Walking distance to city centre and very quiet neighbourhood.

name: Parking supermarket Menton
description: Big parking lot next to U express supermarket. Limited at 2m but the gate was open when we visited in December. Quiet at night and nice walk to city center.

name: Sens Aire de camping
description: Motorhome/van camping.  10E plus 1.35E for two people includes power.  2E for 10 mins water.  Blackwater dump free.  Rubbish bins, a couple of picnic tables, a clothes line and close to shops.  Walking distance to the centre of town.  Quiet at night.  Excellent cell reception.  Grassy sites, some back on to river.  A few spots need a long power cord or don't need power.  Showers and bathrooms closed in winter.

name: Tennis court parking lot
description: Big lot just off main drag.  Enter off the street south of tennis court: Rue de Bernes. No services except garbage bins.  Excellent cell reception. There's a school here too.  Local told us it was okay.

name: Camperplace L√©on
description: Large area where only campervans and the like are allowed. Near a lake. Charges are ‚Ç¨12,- In winter the restaurant and ameneties are all close but there is no charge either. Quiet place.

name: Fort Pethus
description: Parking next to big fort. Quiet place with crazy view. Close to highway so easy to stop when on the road. No facilities.

name: Etang d‚ÄôOu√©e
description: It‚Äô a nice pond for a quiet night. easy access for all types of vehicles. spaces for 3 or 4 vehicles

name: Arles at the Riverside
description: No amenities, no fee, a short walk to the city. Sketchy area with lots of shady people.

name: Aire de Mirepoix
description: Public aire, free for anyone with a motorhome or camper or vehicle for sleeping in. Safe area,  close to town centre, toilets and potable water,  empty waste (black and grey), rubbish bins nearby. Close to main road,  but a good location,  space for about 75 vehicles.

name: Camping de la Serre
description: Excellent campsite,  all facilities available, near village,  quiet,  peaceful, access to pyrenees. Cannot fault it.

name: Ferme de la for√™t du lac d‚Äôorient
description: This is a best place for night near the lake. This is in a farm with lot of horses. It‚Äôs safe and secure. You paid 10‚Ç¨/night and if you need electrical 4‚Ç¨ and water it‚Äôs 2‚Ç¨ .

name: Torrent de Beous
description: Nice and quiet place for one night. Just near the river, 50 meters from the road. There is a ford in concrete to cross.

name: Riverside
description: Few meters from the road, that we can hear. Quiet place near the water tank. 20 meters from the nice river that has good acc√®ss by foot.

name: Grassland
description: Beautiful grassland next to a goat farm. Near the abbey which is worth a visit. We stayed here with 6 other campers and there were still enough places. Public toilets 4 min away by walking.

name: Lake
description: Small camp site suitable for 2 vans or small camper, road not too large.

name: Camping Le Touroulet
description:
Very nice campsite with a small river running by. The owner from England is very friendly. There is a restaurant, shower, toilet. All basic but clean and convenient. 
Also possible to camp off grit in the forest. Possibility to make a small fire

name: Above the champagne grapes
description: Quiet little meadow on top of a hill. Only one track leading up to it. Close tot tet france

name: Ferme Fromag√®re de Suscinio
description:
At the farm. 
They have a large site (not even everywhere and on grass) where you can stay for free if buying from the shop. They also have a restaurant and you can assist at the farm. Quite place minutes away from the castle. Pets not allowed in the farm.

name: Domaine de Grave
description: Vineyard close to Bordeaux with space for 5 campers. Very warm welcome by the owners. Great wine tasting and affordable prices. Camping is free.

name: Rest area with restrooms.
description: Good place to stop for lunch and possibly overnight. Good for all size of rigs, trucks included.

name: Bois Bezard
description: Level, gravelled parking spot for cars & camping cars, overlooking a beautiful lake and surrounded by woodland. V peaceful, birdsong & water lapping. Free of charge, no amenities.

name: Camping de la Grande P√¢ture
description: Established campsite, large level field, unmarked pitches, with electricity supplies around the site, shower block, disabled toilet/shower/wet room (brilliant shower!), fresh water, grey waste disposal, chemical toilet waste disposal. Situated next to two fishing lakes. Owner is English, lives nearby, so best to book in advance via Pitch.up or the campsite‚Äôs own website. Self service petrol station with diesel, petrol and LPG (bottles only) and supermarket a few metres down the main road. Medical centre also right next to the site (closed while we were there as was a weekend.)

name: Montreuil Bellay
description: Picnic spot just off D175 at entrance to town, big enough for 7m motorhome to pull in, toilets, picnic tables.

name: Free Public parking
description: Flat free public parking for 4 medium size vans. Some view at a distance. Surveillance camera right above. Trash bins (recycled only). Some traffic but not much. No one bothered.

name: Free parking with a view
description: 6 parking places next to the road with a panoramic view. Free. Use caution, as another travel app states someone got robbed here. I decided to stay and had no issues. Beautiful view of the bay. Some noise of course, as it‚Äôs by the road.

name: Mont Grele
description:
A 1 hour 4x4 trail brings you to this place with beautiful view.
You need high clearance.
No Handy Signal.

name: Forest track
description: Very quiet forest track. Beware - the drive is difficult and will require 4x4 and maybe low range if over 3T. No big trucks and motor homes due to hairpin bends. Good 4G phone signal.

name: Serre des Giordins
description: 4x4 trail to get there. You need high clearance. Very quiet.

name: Camping Les Tr√©xons

name: Noirmoutier town centre

Adjoining river with cycle paths right into and through town towards the coastal area. No facilities on site that we saw, but loads of places to eat nearby & public toilets as you get into the town centre along the river. ‚Ç¨8 for 24 hours, pay by card/Apple pay at machine or on PayByPhone app.

name: Camping cars, Barb√¢tre
description: Tarmacked area for camping cars, very close to beach. Grey waste drain, toilets. ‚Ç¨8 for 24 hours.

name: Sites & Paysages le Vaubarlet
description:
Nice and very quiet place on Grass. Small bar and in high season restaurant.  Bread van be ordernd for next day. Lots of shade and open gras areas. Very nice owner. Electricity everyware. 
Small river only 20m away. 
Internet site:  Www.vaubarlet.com
TEL +33 471 666 495

name: Minerve Wild spot
description:
just above the payed parkingspot, were it is too small for big busses like ours(12mtr) you find a spot for 2 or 3 big motorhomes just along the quiet road.
a 15 minuten walk into the old and beautiful medieval city Minerve: known as one of the most beautiful Village 's of France, where 2 rivers come together...
you can use facilities ( toilets and drinkingwater) of payed parking just beloofd this place.

name: camping chez les ch'tis
description:
Very friendly

we are very well received here, plenty of room for motorhomes or tents.

the small fault is the train which passes from time to time a few hundred meters from here. it was not disturbing for me but I understand that it can be for some.

great pirate themed restaurant next door.

in short, a good crossing point.
---
Very friendly

nous sommes tr√®s bien accueillis ici, beaucoup de place pour camping-car ou  tentes.

le petit d√©faut est le train qui passe de temps en temps √† quelques centaines de m√®tres d'ici. ce n'√©tait pas d√©rangeant pour moi mais je comprends que √ßa puisse l'√™tre pour certains.

super restaurant sur le th√®me des pirates juste √† c√¥t√©.

en bref un bon point de passage.

name: Le lavoir d'arlinde
description:
nice place, cheap and quite.

lots of place.

quiet and inexpensive, plenty of room, small toilets but sufficient.
----
tranquil et pas ch√®re, beaucoup de place, petits sanitaires mais suffisant.

name: Reservoir du Bourdon
description:
At least 3 spots along the road directly on the shore. Good fishing and swimming. Shaded spots. Only small vehicles will fit.
I guess it will be busy in summer or even on weekends.

name: Parking Grand Puyconnieux
description: Parking and picknic table. No trafic during the night.

name: Bridge across the lake
description:
Translation: Nice place across the street by the lake.

Sch√∂ner Platz auf der anderen Seite der Stra√üe am See.

name: La Marte
description: Municipal campground. The main building is at the base of a hill. Climb the hill across the street to multiple campsites. I was here in May and there were no attendants, So I just camped out in one of the campsites. A local woman told me it was fine to do. In the high season it may be different in terms of using the space.

name: Louzy
description: Municipal area for Camping Cars (RV). Flat, grassed area in small village, set aside for overnight campers. Entrance is suitable for big rigs and trucks, but area is small and could get congested when busy. No facilities other than rubbish bins. Toilets in near building were locked when we visited. No grocery shops in the village other than bakery so come loaded. Enter from Rue su Stade next to Bakery. Very quiet and secluded.

name: P√™che salamou village
description: Wild site near the little village, owner agree for tent , car ,van ‚Ä¶ large place beautiful area you can purchase local wine from owner cave

name: Aurel-sur-Loire
description:
Run down and noisy campground. Next to the river and unfortunately to the main road. 
We left after the first sight.

name: Camping Comme Ca
description:
Established camp site for tents, campers, bikes and bikers. Rob is also always looking for help and is willing to male your stay free of charge.
Good food available, showers, toilets, potable water.

name: Camping de L'√Æle
description:
Small cute campground with access to public each on river Yonne. Possibility to rent Kajaks.
Low price, good quality, showers and toilets not too modern but clean.

name: Camping Municipal des Bords de l‚ÄôAure
description: Excellent municipal campsite in Bayeux. Full range of facilities, nice pitches, electric hook up available, really good shower/toilet blocks, everything you need for camping/motorhome. Fifteen minutes walk from the centre of Bayeux/museum/tapestry/Cathedral, absolutely brilliant for a stopover to/from the Channel with plenty of time to make a visit to see the tapestry (a fantastic experience.). Highly recommend. We booked in advance but plenty of space and several others arrived on the offchance (visited mid-May).

name: coal heap with amazing view
description: Beautifull coal heap amount quiet with nothing around. Can easily find deadwood to make a fire. Parking is about 10 minutes walking (50¬∞27'37.5"N 3¬∞37'23.5"E) There is something to block truck and camping car but a car easily passes).

name: Basilica of St Therese, Lisieux
description: Parking for camping cars right next to the Basilica. Advertised by tourist info as specifically for camping cars with space for 15 vehicles, but when we arrived most spaces were taken by cars (v annoying, as there‚Äôs a huge, free car park for cars right in front of the Basilica.). However no signage to say that it‚Äôs reserved for camping cars. Free of charge though, about 10 mins walk from the central area of town and the Basilica is beautiful.

name: Parking/picnic spot Pont de Brotonne
description: Spacious parking spot immediately by the bridge over the Seine. Picnic area/toilets.

name: Aire de L‚ÄôEtang du Pas Municipal Camping
description: Free camping. Beautiful spot by the lake. Grassed and reasonably flat. Toilets, water and RV waste water drain. Undercover seating and rubbish bins. No electric. Good 4G signal SFR (Vodafone roaming). Very quiet but some road noise. Mosquitoes likely in the hotter months.

name: Near Ribaude village
description: One km before the village, near the river. quiet area , 500 m from the scenic road .

name: Air de Lesignac-Durand
description: Official site for camping cars next to a church, has water, electricity and public toilets - everything free. Just a few minutes to the lake, cute restaurant nearby and beautiful area for hiking. Stay is limited to 72h.

name: Camping Les Pommiers
description: nice small camping with clean sanitair . staff speaks french and english

name: Eguisheim - dump station
description: Next to the paid parking there‚Äôs a dump station.

name: Parking by the wine yard
description: By the road, on a designated parking for truckers. A truck and another van spent the night as well. All good. Almost no traffic after hours.

name: Kaysersberg - Free Dump Station
description: Inside the RV parking there‚Äôs a dump station. Free to use. Parking costs ‚Ç¨2/h or ‚Ç¨10/day. Free toilets. You can access the dumping even if you‚Äôre not parked here. Parking is self paying as always.

name: Just bellow the Castle
description: Free big parking lot just before reaching the Castle.

name: By the river
description: Big flat parking by the river. Super quiet and safe. Spent one night. Another Van parked here as well.

name: Thann - Free Camper parking
description: Free camper parking at Thann. The Gothic church here is beautiful!

name: Auvergne France
description:
place on the lake.
  not for big camper vans.
on the end off a dead end road

name: Free shower & Dump Station
description:
Free hot shower. You need to leave your key while you shower.
Free Dump station as well, but you need to get someone at the gas station to open the water. The dump station is on the car‚Äôs side, after you leave the store. Better to park and shower before.

name: Annecy lake ans Mont Blanc view
description:
Really peaceful place, view on Le Mont Blanc and Annecy lake. 
Incredible.

name: In front of train station
description: There‚Äôs a small parking lot in front of an old train station at this small village. Spent one quiet and safe night. The rout is very pretty.

name: parking - free from October til May
description: Big parking you only got to pay from July until September. Hight ristriction is 1,90 m. There is a little bit of shade depending on the spot you get and there are bins on the right side of the parking where you can dump your rubbish. Public toilet is about 2 min to walk, 5 min to a nice sandy (but very wavy) beach. You come by the toilets when you go to the beach (the way to the beach is marked right of the entrence to the car parking). It's a little bit noisy at night due to the road but overall a good place to sleep for one night.

name: Bernex Camping Car parking
description: A small place to park some vans or camping-car. Not done of a camping tent.

name: Camping Porte des Vosges
description: Good campsite with clean facilities! 3 km from highway! Quiet

name: Camping de Besancon Chalezeule

Hot showers, toilettes. No restaurant, you can get snaks to carry on. It is a 1‚òÜ place but its a nice place. Check in from 17.30  - 19.00. If you get earlyer just chose a place a pay later.

name: Mareuil
description: Along the canal, next the place of the village. Very quiet night. People friendly. There is also a camping car area not far from here.

name: Free dump station - you must pay for water.
description: Nice facilities for campers. Dump black and gray water for free and fill up for a fee.

name: Les Clos Bouyssac
description: Camping area managed by Dutch family. Pleasant stay, swimming pool, canoe,  river,  table tennis, kid friendly.

name: Sult
description: Post of the Sim Santo Antonio chain, very attentive and solicitous staff. Water, and bathroom with shower, we had a very peaceful night. Post 24 hours. --- Posto da rede Sim Santo Antonio, funcion√°rios muito atenciosos e solicitos. √Ågua, e banheiro com chuveiro, tivemos uma noite muito tranquila. Posto 24 horas.

description:
Parking for 13 Euro per night. We stayed directly behind the dunes, close to the beach. One toilet, fresh water and water disposal are available. Nice place to stay for 1 or 2 nights.

name: Parking near Gordes
description: We stayed here one night with around 10 other campers.

name: Verdon View Point

name: Au bord de la riviere

pretty shaded car park, 200 meters from the river

name: Lac de Chaudanne

name: les geudins

nice car park where to spend the night, games for children and picnic table

name: Roadside

name: Quaint, Quiet and Safe

name: Parking Bizeneuille
description: Slept there for the night, quiet, near a park with picnic tables and terrain de p√©tanque. No prohibition signs but not sure if it was permitted.

name: Campin Bord de Mer
description: Nice Camp Site next to the sea. Acess to the beach. With restaurant and bar. Clean, some places with shade. Relatively narrow. Big rigs do not fit. 2km from town center of Saint Jean de Luz. It has laudery washing machine and dryer.

name: Between the fields
description:
Cute quiet spot, found it on Park4Night.
Place for one, maybe two small vehicules.
Good for a quick overnight.

name: Camping du Valentin

Nice mid-size campground on a hill. Terraced with approximately 100 sites. Swimming pool, restaurant, close to the woods. 
20‚Ç¨ for 2 people and a camping car.

name: Canalside

Just cross the small bridge and it‚Äôs to the left.

name: Camping Br√©montier
description:
Little camping area  with showers, toilets and washing mashing for clothes.

name: Flat area

name: Parking next to Abbey Relec

name: Camping Camp√©ole Navarosse 4*
description:
Large campground directly at the beach. Only aprox. 40 places for campervan. The lake is warm and over the First 100 m not more than 60cm deep. Bar and small restaurant, no big selection. Many ‚Äû gites ‚Äû. Very Good for families. 
Reservation in high season is mandatory.
Internet to be payed. 
reservations@ms-vacances.com

name: Riverside
description: A lovely spot right down by the river along the D1075: 05700, Serres. The upper carpark has a small snack bar that sells homemade food! Carry on past to the river, round to the right and you‚Äôll be tucked away from the main road. We slept overnight, undisturbed and also went into the river!

name: parking spot in the middle of forest
description: quit a nice spot only with some musquitos

name: Sainte-Maxime
description: Amazing spot close to Sainte-Maxime. We stayed here over night in a roof top tent. The view was beautiful and very peaceful. Less than 15 cars passed us the whole time we were there!

name: Lakeside
description: Lakeside spot, In between Sainte-Maxime and Frejus. No facilities but nice and peaceful, far enough away from the road that you don‚Äôt hear it. A little bit of noise from nature at the lake but nothing too bad.

name: Parking by the river
description: Nice and quiet for a lunch break or chilling out on the rocks

name: Avia Service Station
description: Free showers with all other regular station services. Friendly staff!

name: Ch√¢teau la brie

Location next to the Ch√¢teau La Brie gourmet shop, wines and local products. Shaded and wooded park with 4 sockets available. 5 minutes from  Monbazillac castle and 8 minutes from Bergerac.

name: Camping Sous Les √âtoiles
description: Very nice campground in Normandy. The plots are very spacious and can easily fit big Riggs, though the windy road there may be a bit less forgivening, but definetly doable. The camping has all the usual facilities such as water, power and such. The plots are very well maintained and the allround atmosphere with the little stone cottages dotted around is very lovely. We paid 19 euro for three people, a car and a tent. The owner is from the UK and therefore speaks fluent English and is very helpful. Definetly recommend a visit.

name: Bon Port Camping ****
description: Nice campground with lots of shade. Very clean, with marvelows pool. Ideal for kids. Aprox. 140 places for tents and/or camper vans. Nice restaurant. Good for cruises in the Camargue.

name: Laverie 7/7
description:
Laundry service and self service laundromat. Friendly woman, reasonable price‚Äôs. 
You need coins one euro and ,20 cents

name: Parc Bellevue Campground
description: Campground close to Cannes. We stayed here for a couple of nights to explore Cannes, there‚Äôs a bus stop down the road take the number 2 bus it goes straight there (‚Ç¨1.50 pp). The campsite is average, clean showers+toilets, washing up area and a nice pool. The sites are quite spacious compared to other French campsites. Wifi is available at a cost and ‚Ç¨20 cash deposit needed for the gates!

name: Remote and quiet parking lot

name: Parking Plage Du Lomer

Parking directly at the sea.
Toilets always open but without light. Sink is only in one of the toilets (right side)

name: Ocre tent spot
description:
Right near the ocres (in the ocres domain ?) we found this flat and calm spot to camp (and visit the site the next day).
Only for tents. We met friendly hikers who said this is not formally allowed but tolerated. Maybe better so set up a little late as to avoid the less friendly people. 

Be careful of the wild boar in the area. Keep food and trash in bag in a tree far from tents. And apparently pee around the tents. Place is supposed to be really full of boars, didn‚Äôt see or hear one!

Place is super flat but no water.

name: Parking Morieux
description: Small parking just in front of the beach. Very quiet during the night. The GR34 is crossing it.

name: Mont Dore CC
description: Area for camping car and van. Interesting : to visit Mont Dore and practice trek. cost 12‚Ç¨40 with electricity and services.

name: Roman bridge and Laye river
description:
Dream like place, only for pedestrians / tents. Also cool to chill for a day.

Following through the GR (marked by white and red horizontal paint stripes), take the ¬´¬†Le prieur√©¬†¬ª road, make a left into the property that is marked for the GR (close gate behind you) and follow trail through the bush to the bridge. Settle down wherever you like. (This is all on maps.me).

River was flowing end of June (while global drought in the area). People come during the day, children. But very nice and not too noisy. Great place to stay. Careful with fire, it‚Äôs a very burnable place ! We didn‚Äôt cook anything.

Really recommended, it‚Äôs a super nice place and we slept great !

name: Peyrengues camping
description: Simple old fashion camping. Does the trick ! I‚Äôm in a tent but saw a lot of what looked like big v√©hicules there ! They have a website : camping-peyrengues-moustiers.com

name: Outrebois

name: By the water

Very popular, there was already a couple of tents when we arrived.

name: Camping les roux

A small restaurant with ice cold beer and pizza, smoothies ice creams etc . Small but clean facilities, washing machines , bbq‚Äôs . There is a route to the lake but quite rocky of about 30 minutes. A good tip here is if the board reads ‚Äú full ‚Äú always ask as I think this is just for the hook ups.wifi at the restaurant. Not much shade in the centre.

name: Sentier des G√©ants
description:
Nice park site near "sentier des g√©ants", wood sculptures and giant pine trees. Quiet, flat. Picnic tables nearby.

Petit parking calme pr√®s du "sentier des g√©ants", sculptures en bois et sentier pour observer les sapins g√©ants. Calme et plat, en gravillons. Tables de pique nique √† c√¥t√©.

name: Jardins Secrets
description:
Wonderful secret gardens!

.....
Magnifiques jardins secrets !

Small campground with nice owner. Swimming pool, clean sanitaries, bar/restaurant near to a lake.
27 ‚Ç¨ for 2 kids, 2 adults, 1 dog, car and tent.
15 ‚Ç¨ for 1 adult, 1 motorcycle, 1 tent and electricity.

Shops closed on a Sunday, try gas stations 12km to the north (25 min drive there and back).

Nothing in the village but OK for one or 2 nights. Near a big road, so go to the end of the campground for a quiet night.

It‚Äôs good if you know French. Receptionist speaks good English but store vendors do not.

name: Camping Port Maladiere
description: Gravel parking for camping cars (+-8-10 spots). Costs approximately ‚Ç¨9/night incl. power and water. shower for a fee available during office hours. Office hours (july 2022) 09-20:00.

refuge with the possibility of sleeping upstairs, magnificent view. Difficult path, a city car may have trouble passing without damage.
refuge avec possibilit√© de dormir √† l'√©tage, vue magnifique. Chemin difficile, une citadine risque d'avoir du mal √† passer sans casse.

No shop, but you can order fresh bred and croissants for the next day. A supermarket is in 3km on the way to the camp ground. The place is run by a very friendly and helpful family.

Space for a few campers, there is more then one place.

Enjoy

name: Lac de crescent

enjoy!

name: l'arve

name: Loire River spot
description:
A very quiet place to park, directly next to the Loire River. Easy acces to the water for swimming, though the current is strong so be careful.
The GPS exact coordinates require 4x4, since the ground is made of very loose sand and pebbles. If you stop a bit before at the end of the road, where the trashcan and bench also stand, 4x4 is not needed.
There's a few branches and a bush that we had to push through, but we're a pretty big rig.
Enjoy :)

name: maison de la p√™che campground
description: Ideal for motorbikes as you can go around the gate (no walls or wires, just a simple gate to prevent cars to park) or park outside and walk (50m)to pitch your tent under the pine trees. You can make a small fire if discreet and there is usually water by the small dam. Very beautiful spot, flat surface for your tents, wooden benches and table.

name: Meadows & Forest
description:
A dirt road leading less than 1km away from the highway takes you to this quiet spot. Forest on one side, pastures on the other. Very quiet, friendly farmers drove by and didn't mind. No signs indicating any legal issues.
The dirt road leads to three separate pastures. Very quiet, legal, free, no infrastructure whatsoever.
Big rigs: If the dirt road is okay for you to drive, the spot will be more than fine. You can turn around.

the beach is dog friendly

- there was a bear trap close by, so be careful! 
- the road up to the spot is just a ‚Äúfield road‚Äù, but doable for cars/vans

Highly recommended :-)

name: Wildcamping spot in abandoned garage

Shortly after turning off the main road, the street is locked with a chain. However on the left there is still a smaller way on the left. This leads to an flat ground where a car could be parked or a few meters behind is an old garage (see pictures).
Someone left old toys and other household items in there, but still enough place for a tent and it's rainproof!
Unfortunately the street is right underneath, so it is quite noisy.

Please burry your poo & toilet paper so other still can enjoy this spot! üí©

description: Small parking lot near a nice fishing pond (Susville Lake). Dry toilets not far from the parking. Quiet except for a few barking dogs in the morning.

name: Overlooking Dieffenthal
description:
I came upon this place when looking for a road to Chateau de l'Ortenbourg. The road suddenly became more narrow than I was comfortable with and night was closing in so I decided to find a spot to park. Right there it was, just to the side of the road, next to a vineyard, and on a 3 km hike (according to Google at least) to the Chateau.

Space for 1 camper, also a big rig might fit lengthwise but might be difficult in the width. After that you should still have enough room for a tent or something. There is just one access, that's why only 1 vehicle.

Great view, no motorway in sight, just 1 house right in front.

name: Picnic place
description:
Nice and large place in the forest, near picnic tables and the road but very quiet at night.

Aire de pique nique avec 2 tables. Nous avons pass√© la nuit sur le chemin qui s'enfonce un peu dans la for√™t. A c√¥t√© de la route mais tr√®s calme la nuit. Jolie vue.

name: L'Escarene
description:
Look under the main road, before the bridge you will see a big place/parking lot. There's a "box" with 2 black doors, one for water and the second one to empty your wc.

Avant de passer le pont, en contrebas de la route il y a une grande place avec un parking. Sur un des murs il y a un bloc b√©ton avec 2 portes noires. L'une est pour l'eau potable et l'autre est pour vider les eaux us√©es et WC.

Gratuit
Free

name: near herault
description: quiet place for a night 2 steps from the campsite a few meters from the water natural awakening near the fishermen, barriers at the entrance to the driveway at 2m20 which are open out of season

name: Chem. de la Pinede
description: Behind the big place are more small places for Tents.

name: Forrest
description: A little Place in the Forrest for 2 or 3 tents.

name: Les Grebes du Lac de Macenay
description:
Grassy and shady spots. Small pool. On the Lake side that is easy to visit. Hiking around. 
If you want to hear some old songs like Hotel California just listen ore make your own music!

name: Parking spot along pista
description: Nice flat area along the piste with a view

name: Aire de Camping Car
description: Motorhome site close to the centre of town. 31 pitches with electric,  plus dumping station for grey and black water and fresh potable water. ‚Ç¨12 50 for the night.

name: Bivouac area
description: Designated bivouac area on the TMB close to Refuge du Miage

name: Club Mouche APNLE
description: Street parking in a side street next to an actual campsite. Really beautiful place. We are here over New Years in a van. A lot of other campers here as well, nice grass next to the van and a pond. The campsite across the street was fully booked, they directed us here.

name: Near ''Pruns'' village
description: along a small green track between fields, under young wallnuts trees. There is enough place for two or three 4x4.

name: Mecaracing motorcycle garage
description:
Very friendly garage for motorcycle, every probl√®mes has solutions. 
Sale some stuff and equipment.

name: Scenic spot in ruins
description: Spot with a scenic view over Monaco. Spent New Years Eve here and at 00:30 were the only ones left here. This path leads to a cemetary and is very quiet. There are some ruins at the side of the path, where one car fits perfectly.

name: Near Diou at Loire
description: Nice hidden place, suitable for 4x4 at Loire river

name: Domaine Julien de l'Embisque
description: Place at a wine producer. Organic farming, the location is on the edge of the forest with a view of Mont Ventoux, near a hedge which gives the choice between a location in full sun or in the shade. Very warm welcome and great wine. Obligation to be autonomous for the toilets. Maximum arrival time 8:00 p.m.

name: Huttopia
description: very tidy campsite with bathrooms, laundry, water, and small shop. view of the vineyards! i would imagine it gets busy in the summer. reasonably priced in the off season

name: beach spot
description:
great little spot for a 1 night stay next 
  to the a dirt bike spot. arrived there at 3 pm and nobody till 8 in the morning when I left. wouldn't stay there more than a night

name: bike path spot
description:
great spot for bikepacker. in the middle of nowhere on a "bikepath" #eurovelo8 
just ride along the bikepath and there's plenty of space. be aware of some crazy noises all sort of animals do near there. at one point I hear a bird I swear it sounded like a man coughing non stop.

name: Free Bivouac Fontainebleau
description: Very nice area for campers and tents, no facilities but it's clean and legal to stay here. Might be busy in summer but I was almost alone in February. good for cyclist as the EV3 isn't far and you have some beautiful paths in the forest nearby

name: Area Camper Pradelles
description: Municipal campsite to -I think- both sides of the road. Open 24/7, but no toilets or other facilities. Can get electricity for ‚Ç¨2 at nearby shop.

name: Domaine A. Geoffroy
description: Seven places at winery. Free with power, water and dump station. Very nice wines!!! In winter quiet, in summer busy.

name: Mont Saint Michel View
description:
Over the bank, you‚Äôre hidden from the road. From satellite images it looks like it‚Äôs a tidal area but on the ground it seemed fine. We had no issues.

Nobody passed our camp in the night and it was very silent and secluded. We were here in February so well outside of tourist season.

name: camping le jardin de Sully
description:
Campsite on the banks of the Loire, quite busy, tent, motorhome and caravan, relatively comfortable with all amenities.
--
Camping en bord de Loire, assez fr√©quent√©,  tente, camping-car et caravane, relativement confortable avec toutes les commodit√©s.

name: Plage de la Siesta
description:
Perfect for one night, facing the sea, but don't go too far on the beach because despite it being pebbles, it very often happens that vehicles get stuck easily.
---
Parfait pour une nuit, face √† la mer, mais ne pas trop s'avancer sur la plage car malgr√© que cela soit des galets, il arrive tr√®s souvent que les v√©hicules s'enlisent facilement.

name: Camping de la bucherie
description: Nice campsite open for tents, campervans. They also have lodge or rooms if you want. Snack, swimming pool and also a small shed for servicing motorcycles. Run by two brothers, really nice guys. Open from 15/04 to 15/09. Call 0602118314 if needed.

name: Close to the Big Beach
description: Parking within 3 minutes walking distance to the large beach. No prohibition signs, no height restrictions.

name: E.Leclerc supermarket
description: parking to spend the night next to supermarket and gas station.

name: Free Parking
description: We were lucky to find this place very close to the Eiffel Tower.  It is a very short street with no exit.  Parking is not charged.  We arrived on Friday at 8:00 p.m. and left on Sunday.

name: car park with grass for camping
description: parking area for vans and with grass area for camping

name: Bief Rapids
description:
Small place with access to the river Comt√© and small rapids. People come here to swim in the river. 
A bad dirt road leads to this place, Google largely misleading, the maps being outdated and/or very imprecise.
The dirt road starts at the old market of Cacao, passing the petrol station.

name: Womo Stellplatz Sangatte
description:
Nice place 200 m from the sea.
Only toilets - NO Womo service for toilets - ca. 25 places - big parking area

name: free parking place
description: free parking place and Picknick places on the road D2202.

name: fresh water
description: clean drinking water on the road d2202...........................

name: Camping Car Area Faucogney et la Mer
description: An parking lot and  services for Campers. 5 parking places available. Water, electricity and dump station.

name: field off lesser used walking path
description:
accessed by dirt track off the last hairpin on tarmac road. 

quiet pasture off one of the less used hiking trails. good alternative to the field at the end of tarmac road. spectacular views and seems unpopulated.

access by 4x4 only 2nd gear low ratio trial. access by dirt track off the last hair pin on the tar road. not suitable for campers or big off road rigs

came at 5pm and didn't see any one until a hiker after 8am,also had some pony friends in the morning.

name: Villefranche parking
description: Pay parking lot that is level and not too far from Monte Carlo. We parked here when we couldn't find anything in Monaco as it was jam packed.  Nice water view. We took the number 607 bus into Monaco one day and same bus in the other direction to see Nice next day.  2.50 for bus pp.  The bus stop is about 2 mins walk towards Nice. Shops and restaurants nearby. Parking is pay from 9am to noon, then 2 to 7pm - 2eu per hour but you get a free 20 mins too.  Garbage bins but nothing else.  4G signal.

name: Wild Camp Spot on the Mountain
description:
3 pitches on the Oure pass, beautiful exposed spot. View on both sides. 4x4 access because of the tiny track and the high torque needed for some leveled portions.

3 emplacements sur le col de l‚ÄôOure, magnifique spot expos√©. Vue sur les deux versants.
Acc√®s 4x4 fortement recommand√© due a certaines portions de la piste fortement pentues et a l'√©troitesse de cette derni√®re.

name: On top of a mountain near a sheepfold
description:
Spot at altitude (2400m), at the end of a long and sublime forest track, camp next to a sheepfold with is occupied in summer, but with very friendly shepherds. Several flat and grassy pitches. Departures of beautiful altitude hikes. Accessible to all vehicles (use caution if not 4x4). Be aware of the shepherd dogs if you have a pet.
---
Spot en altitude (2400m), au bout d'une longue et sublime piste foresti√®re, campement √† cot√© d'une bergerie occup√©e en √©t√©, mais avec des berger tr√®s sympathiques. Plusieurs emplacements plats et herbeux. D√©parts de belles randonn√©es d'altitude. Attention aux chiens de berger si vous avez un animal. Accessible tous v√©hicules avec pr√©cautions si pas 4x4.

name: Camping La Garenne
description: Very nice, quiet Campingplace, good facilities, small food service

name: L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue.
description: Free camper place of the city of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue.  Flat gravel place without disposal.  If you need more comfort, go to the campsite at the other end of town.

name: Aire provided by the town
description: Small area for 4 vehicles with picnic tables, water and black dump.  Next to a traffic circle but pretty quiet over night. 4G cell.

name: laundromat 24 hr
description: Typical European outdoor laundry outside the U Supermarket near the gas station end of the building. One 18 kg washer (8eu) and one 8kg (4eu) as well as one 18kg dryer (2eu for 15 mins).  Pay by cash or card

name: Nice Campsite at Mosel River
description: Get here by crossing the railway through a littel Tunnel from D90 Street. The path is an dead end, very quiet at night. Sometimes trains are passing, but more in the evening and morning, not at night.

name: Nice quiet place near the lake
description:
Nice spot near a little lake. 
Little bit Sandy road but ok for all v√©hicules.

name: St Laurent Aire
description: Free municipal camping.  Four delineated spots and some open area.  Water and power available for 2eu.  Dumping is possible too.  We only stopped for lunch but it looks good if you want to spend the night as I'm sure traffic slows down. 4G cell signal.

name: Camping du Velodrome
description: Small municipal campsite next to nice park. Under new management. Quiet. Space for tents, motorhomes. There are also a few coco suites. Restaurant under construction.

name: La Rhue
description:
La Rhue camping and gites. Very nice campsite with small swimming pool.
Every Saturday live music and nice food.

name: Air de Chenar
description: Just a spot for one night. A bit remote from the main road. No facilities, electricity or water.

name: Ferme associative PHILING AT HOME
description:
Cell phone signal available, quite place situated in shade in a natural place with a large lake area. Peacefull place with
Wifi available at the bar-restaurant  area (300 meters from the parking).
It is an hour far from " les Sables d'Olonnes" ; thirty minutes from Nantes.
You can enjoy differents services ( in add) : fishing, paddle, pilates, massage.

name: Les granges de Franould
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   
-----------------
Horse farm in the Vosges mountains. Small campsite, superb view of the Saint Mont. Possibility of meals for guests by reservation at least 24 hours in advance.

Camping PRICES: 1 person ‚Ç¨12, 2 people ‚Ç¨18 then ‚Ç¨3 extra per person, dog ‚Ç¨2. (prices possible without sanitary facilities, contact us)
Electricity and sanitary facilities included.
For water and waste water you have to go downstairs at the foot of the church of Dommartin les Remiremont, there is a service area. The farm's water comes from a source that is therefore precious.
WC access. Sheltered terrace with table and sofa.
It is possible to approach the farm animals: horses, rabbits, goats, chickens... Ideal for a family with children, horseback riding but also on foot, by mountain bike because the forest is all around, campfires possible .We speak Dutch.
Put GIRADCHANOIS on the GPS arrived at Dommartin les Remiremont.

name: Aire naturel
description:
it is a natural area for hikers (on foot, by bike, on horseback or motorhome).
cold shower, toilet, drinking water, barbecue area, games for children
recommended participation of 2‚Ç¨ per person and per night (free access box)

name: Annecy lake
description:
Lodged in between two camp sights is a slot of no man‚Äôs land which is free to camp . Campsite toilets 20m away and within 50m of the lake and water sports. 

To get here follow the signs for pedalo and kayaks in blue and end of the road turn right . Carry on down the waters front and through the car park . Turn right at the bolders and then it‚Äôs just up 20m on your left

name: Piggy Forest (cycles only)
description: Small place suitable for 1 tent, we were here with our 2 bicycles. Enter a small path uphill opposite privately owned farmland, after some meters you‚Äòll see a quite even and sheltered spot on your right side just behind an old small wall. We had a quiet night here. Lots of pigs in the surrounding forest, but no visitors at night.

name: I Sabidini
description: Small restaurant, biscuiterie artisanale - delicious food! Big GT20 sign at the entrance. Stop here :)

name: Camper Service
description: Complete service. Black (2‚Ç¨), grey and fresh water(2‚Ç¨) with 1/2 inch hose. All very well maintained and very nice.

name: Camping du Lac Kir
description: Central place to visit Dijon, campground and space for larger motorhomes, I'm driving 10,5 to  cheap

name: Champs Massot
description: 300 m after the big gravel parking and the chairlift, at the end of a track, possibility to climb on a plateau. Magnificent view, possibility of 3/4 vans. Gravel ascent a bit steep for van, but very quiet place and beautiful view on the mountains.

name: Ch√¢teau Bertinerie
description: Free parking space for camping cars, vineyard, wine tasting and wine selling.

name: Camping les Princes
description: Campsite open all year round which has pitches for motorhomes, hikers or cyclists.

name: Area sosta camper
description:
Nice site wich looks out over the grape fields.

There are no facility‚Äôs but there is some sort of playground next to it.

name: Camping Larribal
description:
Family campsite on the banks of the Tarn
Arranged in a green, peaceful setting, in the shade on the banks of the Tarn, just a few minutes from the old and gastronomic town of Millau in the Aveyron, and in the Grands Causses regional natural park: Sandrine and Eric will have the pleasure to welcome you to this shaded 3-star campsite, with swimming pool and direct access to the river.
--
Camping familial au bord du Tarn
Am√©nag√© dans un cadre verdoyant, paisible, √† l‚Äôombre au bord du Tarn, √† quelques minutes seulement de la ville ancienne et gastronomique de Millau dans l‚ÄôAveyron, et dans le parc naturel r√©gional des Grands Causses : Sandrine et Eric auront le plaisir de vous accueillir dans ce camping 3 √©toiles ombrag√©, avec piscine et acc√®s direct √† la rivi√®re.

name: Moure N√®gre
description: Good place for 4 or 5 vans at the departure of randonn√©es.

name: Nice quiet place on gravel road
description:
Nice quiet place on gravel road, near to d√©partementale. 
Large space. Some flat area. 
Advice to be in 4x4 or motorcycle.

name: le grand gravelot
description: A nice european style established campground. It's about 15 min to the eurotunnel and half an hour to the ferries. Comfortabele campsite with ample space for big rigs and facilities. 5 min walk to the beach with nice sunsets. Price is not super cheap but also not very expensive. We payed 25 euro for three people, a car and two tents.

name: Ferme D'Antan
description:
Parking lot of a shop for cider, whiskey, cookies. We ask them and they let us sleep for free. Water. Farm animals. Roadside, not too noisy.

Parking d'une boutique cidre, whisky, biscuits. Si on leur demande ils nous laissent dormir gratuitement. Eau. Animaux de la ferme. Bord de route pas trop bruyant.

name: Free Parking lot near the Muerthe
description: Small overflow free parking lot away from the road. Old pavement but level.  No services but walkable into the centre of Nancy - 2km. 4G service.  There is a paved walking path between it and the river so people during the day but quiet at night.

name: Roche de Solutre
description: Small charming grass field with 2 kinda level spots and a view at the rock of Solutre. It's a bit close to the road but very quiet, has a garbage bin and good 4G connection. 100m further is a big camper parking which is also nice,but this is more secluded.

name: Aire de Stationnement Camping -Car
description: Pay by credit card to enter.  About 14 sites with power included.  Cost 8eu 24 hrs.  Right across the road is a white building with toilets and heated showers on the left side. In front of the building you can dump grey and black and get fresh water.  If you are not camping, water is 2eu.  No real town around it.  Super quiet and an ok 4G signal.

name: Water Station
description: Very quiet little parking spot in nature. I parked in the grass next to the hill so I wasn't visible from the road. Almost no traffic. 4G reception

name: Camping Le Moulin du Luech
description: Small campsite with 35 pitches on the banks of the Luech river. The toilets are new and very clean.

name: Camping √† la ferme
description:
A nice little campsite ( 6 spots) surrounded by vines, with sanitary facilities and electricity. In addition, we had access to the park of the guesthouse ( same owners) and free services: swimming pool, mini golf, playground.
The cherry on the cake: they have a mini animal park with alpacas, wallabies, goats, donkeys, camels ( yes yes).
Welcoming and kind people...

Un joli petit camping ( 6 emplacements) entour√© de vignes, avec sanitaires et √©lectricit√©. En plus on a acc√®s au parc de la maison d'h√¥tes ( m√™mes propri√©taires) et aux services gratuits: piscine, mini golf, aire de jeux.
La cerise sur le g√¢teau: ils ont un mini parc animalier avec alpacas, wallabies, ch√®vres, √¢nes, dromadaire ( oui oui).
Des gens accueillants et bienveillants...

name: Garage Bay Utilitaires PRECISIUM Bayonne
description: On the way to our shipping in Hamburg, we had a clutch failure at the border of France. We were lucky to find this car repair shop, which was quickly available to help us. They quickly found a place for us and our clutch was changed in one day. Very friendly staff and very willing to solve the problem. They work with all brands and are specialists in motorhomes, vans etc.

name: Col du Pertus
description: old forest track. entrance not closed but might be in the future. only accessible with off-road motorcycle, foot or cycling

name: Aire de Lann Floren
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   
-----------------
Pleasant area at the entrance to the Rhuys peninsula 10 km from the beaches and the Gulf of Morbihan, ideal for visiting Vannes.

Spacious pitches (65 to 150m¬≤), stabilized and delimited by hedges. Possibility of deploying your awning and parking a trailer or small vehicle (eg quad).
Additional indoor parking allowing you to park your second vehicle if necessary (car, spider, buggy) to free up space on your pitch.
Accommodates American liners and motorhomes.

Green and quiet setting 700m from the village and shops (bakery 500m, supermarket 1km).

Prices :
- ‚Ç¨11.80 on the 1st day and decreasing rate if you stay longer up to ‚Ç¨10 on the 7th day and the following days!
(Services included: emptying, drinking water, electricity 10A) + ‚Ç¨0.55 tourist tax per person and per 24 hour period.
- ‚Ç¨3.50 for 2 hours of access to the area for emptying and filling up with water. (Service package)
- ‚Ç¨2.5 for the washing machine and ‚Ç¨2.5 for the dryer. Very practical!

200m away: bowling alley (Boule Bretonne and petanque), children's play area, skate park, bicross field, multisport ground, tennis and football pitches

V45 cycle route accessible from the area and allows you to join the cycle paths of the Rhuys peninsula.

Local products for sale on site, including oysters, cider, craft beer...

Member of the RVR eco-responsible area network

Aire agr√©able √† l'entr√©e de la presqu‚Äô√Æle de Rhuys √† 10 km des plages et du golfe du Morbihan, id√©al pour visiter Vannes.

Emplacements spacieux (65 √† 150m¬≤), stabilis√©s et d√©limit√©s par des haies. Possibilit√© de d√©ployer votre auvent et de stationner remorque ou petit v√©hicule (ex : quad).
Parking int√©rieur suppl√©mentaire permettant de stationner votre deuxi√®me v√©hicule si besoin (voiture, spider, buggy) pour lib√©rer de la place sur votre emplacement. 
Accueille les liners et campings-cars am√©ricains. 

Cadre verdoyant et calme √† 700m du bourg et des commerces (boulangerie √† 500m, Supermarch√© √† 1km).

Tarifs :
- 11,80‚Ç¨ le 1er jour et tarif d√©gressif si vous restez plus longtemps jusqu'√† 10‚Ç¨ le 7eme jour et les suivants ! 
(Services inclus : vidanges, eau potable, √©lectricit√© 10A) + 0,55‚Ç¨ de taxe de s√©jour par personne et par tranche de 24h00.
- 3,50‚Ç¨ pour 2h d‚Äôacc√®s √† l'aire pour faire les vidanges et le plein d'eau. (Forfait services)
- 2,5 ‚Ç¨ pour le lave-linge et 2,5‚Ç¨ pour le s√®che-linge. Bien pratique !

A 200m : boulodrome (Boule Bretonne et p√©tanque), aire de jeux pour enfants, skate park, terrain de bicross, terrain multisport, terrains de tennis et de football

V√©loroute V45 accessible depuis l‚Äôaire et permet de rejoindre les pistes cyclables de la presqu'√Æle de Rhuys.

Produits locaux √† vendre sur place, notamment hu√Ætres, cidre, bi√®re artisanale..

Membre du r√©seau d‚Äôaire √©coresponsable RVR

name: Locmin√©
description:
Possibility of parking with your motorhome near a body of water and in peace.
A few meters away the town center where you will find bakery, mini-market, butchers, pizzeria and many other shops.
You can empty and fill your gray and black water.

name: nice little tent spot
description: along this little walking trail is a perfect spot for one or two tents. not many persons come across this trail. we stayed one night in our tent.

name: view point
description: Along the euro Velo 4 there is a nice litte spot to camp. a few locals passed by. no problems at all. nice table for dinner. stayed one night in our tent.

name: Great view over wine fields of the south of France
description: We were visiting family in the neighborhood and searched for a nice and quiet spot with a good view. Looks like some locals (maybe wine farmers) use this place sometimes. The entrance is some sort of side road (gravel/farmer road) 4x4 isn‚Äôt necessary but makes it easier

name: Next to ferry terminal
description: If you have an early ferry to catch, this is the perfect spot to stay for the night. There are toilets 24/7 available. Many campers and cars 6 here. Just a parking lot, nothing fancy but free.

name: La Chapelle-Saint-Mesmin
description: Camping car park. No tents or trailers.  Next to the river and trails.  Super quiet, decent wifi and strong 4G.  Some large pitches but probably not more than 7m.

name: In front of the Camping L'arquet
description: There is a small forest just in front of the park, which has a sunken part where you can perfectly put up tents. In addition, behind the campsite there is also a large park with tall pine trees.

name: Quiet Parking Place with Dirt and Grass
description: Away from public roads and houses. didn't sleep here but looks like you'd be ok here. no fire, no trash, be reapectful

name: Eco-camping Le Folast√®re
description: Lovely campsite with campgrounds, chalets and caravans to stay.

name: Pont de Cuchet
description: Informal camping, several large flat sites in parking area for small sailing club. There are no signs forbidding camping. Beautiful shady spots beside the Rhone. 4G cell service.

name: JABRON
description: The road to the Verdon Valley.  Pine-shaded meadow.  You can hear cars during the day, but at night there is little traffic so it's quiet. We pitched a rooftop tent and spent one night undisturbed.

name: Camping Municipal Moraypre
description: Basic, inexpensive campground along the Meuse river. Facilities dated, but clean. 10 minutes walk to village. Flat, grassy terrain, partly shaded. Dish washing facilities. ‚Ç¨10 per night (2 adults, campervan, no power).

name: Some where close to the Vineyard
description: Little spot vert quiet. Just for only one vehicle. You have to use a dirt road for 1km before to arrive to this spot

name: U Pignottu
description:
Campground for tent, 4*4 and small vans
Under olivetrees and really simple with hot showers, toilets and water for dishes

name: End of the road
description: Nice place direkt over the sea between big rocks. You have a good look over the sea. Good for 4-5 Camper. The last 200m are a little bit hard.

name: luzeret
description:
Municipal pond with fishing
Parking.
Dining tables

√âtang municipal avec p√™che fishing
Stationnement.
Tables pour manger

name: Camping Bouscarel
description:
Spent a night here - 2 adults in a tent with electricity for about 21‚Ç¨, less without electricity.
Checkout at noon, but they don‚Äôt mind if you stay a bit longer. 
There is drinking water, a dump for chemical water, rubbish bins, a TV room, toilets and nice hot showers free of charge. 
You can also do your laundry, if you pay for it. 
It is right next to a road, so there is a bit of noise, but slept very well. 
The facilities are all a bit old and not the cleanest, but still recommend stopping by for a night, while on the road! 
Close by there is also a nature reserve you might wanna check out!

name: Chalais
description:
Picnic table, running water, lawn for tent camping. Parking is available.
.....
 Eau courante Wc pelouse face √©glise

name: Gravelines
description: Nice little park up. Ideal for the ferry or tunnel

name: Aire de bivouac
description:
Big bivy area, with nice shade, picnic table et public toilets. Perfect for cyclists, non accessible by car. Clean and quiet space.
----------
Grande aire de bivouac ombrag√©e avec table de picnic et toilettes publiques. Parfait pour les cyclistes, non accessible pour voitures.
Calme, propre et silencieux.

name: Top of Hill Vi√®rge Blanche
description: Amazing meadow surrounded by trees on top of the hill. Generous space for a few rigs with picnic tables, trash bin and even a compost toilet. Had a great night. Maybe busy on weekends with picnicers during the day.

name: Nature Paradise
description: Amazing place between fishing ponds (no fishing January to May), grass, trees, birds and frogs, just nature. Had just a few people walking by, all very friendly, maybe very busy when fishing season.

name: Volcano View
description:

Beware: Might by a P4N place, a van wanted to sleep right beside our car ;-)

name: L'Or√©e du Bois by Noricamp
description:
On the edge of the forest, the campsite is located at the foot of Arthez-de-B√©arn, crossed by the Puy des Chemins de Saint-Jaques de Compostela.
Surrounded by a luxury Nature, very calm, human sized and pet friendly.
New owners (march 2023) : a traveller frenchy-portuguese couple who are continuing welcolming guests while not travelling. 
On site : clean sanitary block (showers, toilets, sinks...), washing-machine, restaurant-bar in construction, mini-shop at the reception, wifi zones, babyfoot, ping-pong...
Possibility to rent accomodations : chalets with or without sanitaries insides, equiped tents...
Special prices for pelgrims and bike-tripers or walkers. Tools available for bikes.
Around (100-200m) : swimming pool (from the town), tennis court, petanque, rugby and football field, multisports ground, and lots of track for VTT and walks...
Town is 500m : bakery, butchery, pharmacy, doctors, restaurants, pizzeria...

Langages spoken : english, french, portuguese, spanish

name: L'Or√©e du Bois by Noricamp

Clean sanitary block (showers, wc, sinks, washing-machine...). 20 pitches with or without electricity. Pet friendly. Possibility to rent accommodation: chalets with or without sanitaries inside, equipped tents...
New owners since March 2023 : a French-Portuguese couple who are continuing welcoming guests while not travelling.
Facilities : mini-shop at the reception, (restaurant in construction), BBQ zone, games for kids, wifi zones, baby-foot and ping-pong table... 
Swimming pool is 100m from the campsite (owned by the town), rugby and football fields, petanque, tennis court, basketball ground...
Village is 500m : bakery, butchery, doctors, pharmacy, restaurants and pizzeria...
Shop (Carrefour Contact) is 2.5 km from the campsite.

Contact (whatsapp) : +33 744446199 
E-mail : arthez@nori.camp

Familial and former farm campsite, each emplacement is shaded and offers a breathtaking view of the southern Ardeche C√©vennes hillsides. The campsite is located between Lablachere and Joyeuse,  in the hamlet of "Le Vignal".

Near Vallon Pont d'Arc and the Ardeche gorges, come and enjoy a little paradise, surrounded by the cicadas' songs, beside the swimming pool and the pool SPA.
 
Ideal for resourcing yourself, come and enjoy holidays off the beaten track at "Le Vignal" campsite, close to local activities: Beaume Gorges , Ardeche Gorges and Chassezac Gorges, where magnificent places for swimming and activities are waiting for you: canoe kayak, canyoning, via ferrata, hiking, mountain biking, road biking, rock & tree climbing...

name: The beach
description: ¬´¬†Vieille Nouvelle¬†¬ª beach, very nice spot, large, easy to drive on the sand without 4x4. A bit windy but worth it. Take the left road when you are facing the ‚Äúcamping Paradis‚Äù and follow the path to reach the sea. Not for big vans

name: wildcamping, undisturbed with sight on the lake
description:
This spot is at the top of one of the hills right next to the bridge of the lac de sainte croix. It is a steep and somewhat difficult way up, only accessible by foot (or a professional on an off-road motorbike i suppose). Bring only the most necessary packages and find your way up the hill. You can follow one of the more established routes, yet should then go left at some point, when there is only few bushes to the top (you can check on google maps satellite).

Certainly not an easy way up, but once you‚Äòre there it‚Äòs all worth it. You‚Äôll have the most perfect view on the lake.

Keep in mind that on the top it is a bit rocky (but flat) terrain. You will definitely need an air-mattress to sleep comfortably. 
It is possible to set up a two person tent, though I would suggest this spot is most ideal for sleeping under open air, in just a sleeping bag.

One major advantage of this spot (apart from the view): As it is located in a very open spot, it has a very comfortable breeze of wind ‚Äî so you won‚Äòt sweat a lot at night.

There is a free parking spot at the bottom of the mountain.

Leave it as you found it and take your trash.

name: Camping Aire Naturelle des Granges
description:
A very simple campground with only few facilities, but fantastic base in the nature very closed to the city. The owner, a lady, doesn't seem very hospitable but it's her personal brand. She speaks French and also a little bit English. 
Price is absolutely fine and immediately to pay.
We‚Äôve paid 16‚Ç¨/ night/ 2 adults+4 children+1 dog + campervan without electricity. 
Sanitary facilities are simple, but clean. LOW BUDGET OFFERS NO LUXURY!
We‚Äôve felt comfortable, especially cause of the huge place to move for kids and dog.

a comfortable camping spot for either cars, vans or also tent / hammocks. Somewhat dirty so probably used by people on weekends (thus i‚Äòd only recommend on non-busy days). I was there on a Wednesday evening with it being perfectly quiet.

name: Impasse on the bay

Due to its location, this area has many advantages:
-starting point for hikes;
-proximity to a paragliding takeoff area;
-activities offered within the framework of the Sixt-Passy nature reserve
-restoration
-rental of leisure equipment (summer/winter)

NO RESERVATION
Price: 12 euros for a spot with no electricity + showers
(check website for all the price details)

Reception at the reception chalet:
- in the morning from 8:30 a.m. to 9 a.m. and from 11:30 a.m. to 12 p.m.,
- in the afternoon from 3 p.m. to 3:30 p.m. and from 5:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m.

I think these locations are best reached by bicycle, because of the nice bike paths in the forest along the river.

description: ‚Ç¨18.50 for two of us on bicycles. Pitches 1-5 are the best if you‚Äôre on bicycle - away from the motorhomes and sheltered by high hedges. There‚Äôs a bar, small swimming pool and restaurant on site and there‚Äôs basic, but warm showers. It‚Äôs only 1km from ALDI and a few minutes further to the centre of Orange.

description: There‚Äôs a lot of campsites in this town so you are spoilt for choice. This one has direct access onto the beach. We were two people on bicycles and paid ‚Ç¨22.80. There‚Äôs a spot set aside for cycle tourers with shared bike facilities including a kitchen, fridge, tables etc. We were assigned a normal campervan spot however, which was fine with us as we had a bit more space. It‚Äôs a large, but cramped and busy site. Despite this, we found it to be very quiet.

‚Ç¨23.30 for the two of us on bicycles in a tent.

name: Camping Des Drouilh√®des
description: From the beginning of April to the 3rd Sunday of September, Camping Les Drouilh√®des, a quiet campsite between the C√©vennes and the Ard√®che, opens its doors to you. We warmly welcome you and offer you a range of quality services that respect the environment and animals. You will be charmed by the location of this campsite in the middle of nature, in the heart of the C√©vennes National Park, at the entrance to the Ard√®che. The real plus of our quiet campsite is the proximity to the C√©ze river, which serves as a natural swimming pool. For a relaxing stay in harmony with nature, prefer the comfort and charm of our family campsite on the banks of the river between the Ard√®che and the C√©vennes.

name: By the River
description:
Wonderful spot for cycle tourers (only accessible by bicycle or on foot). It‚Äôs a little secluded beach by the river, perfect for washing in. There‚Äôs a cycle lane that brings you from Vichy, then it‚Äôs a little path through the woods to the river - you can see the path easily on Google Maps Satellite view. We spent ages here and had it totally to ourselves. There‚Äôs no buildings nearby - it felt like we were camping in rural woodland miles away from anyone. 

There‚Äôs a few water points in the parks on the riverfront in Vichy a few km away, if you need to load up on water before you get here. There‚Äôs also outdoor showers on the riverfront closer to town too. There‚Äôs a Lidl nearby.

You can follow the track a small ways for about 50m over a small hill and there is another spot for one camper, more out of sight of the gravel track but its less level.
No ammeneties but a wunderfull sunrise one the snowcapped mountain in the distance üòç

about 30min walk to the shuttle bus.
